QjJqEP7vBl_G98ABq2rqqA.review_text: We brought my mom here for her birthday, and it was such a wonderful experience!!  From the abiance to the superb service. The owners (husband (chef) and wife team) came out to our table more than once just to see if we were doing all right.  In my book service is super important and this place impressed me.  The food was excellent.  The short ribs are to die for!! I am coming back!!

b3qOI8pCnHYG5eVz3y_eaA.review_text: This review is for the gospel brunch.  All in all, it was fine, but the food was a bit disappointing.  I ordered the eggs and grits with bacon and sausage.  The eggs were scrambled but were cooked too soft for my taste.  The grits were good, and the bacon and sausage were average.  My boyfriend got the french toast and he said it was on the dry side.  The complimentary scones and cornbread were delicious and portion sizes were good.  Also if you go to the gospel brunch they charge an extra $5 per person for a music surcharge.  The live music was part of the reason I wanted to come and normally I'd be happy to pay a little extra for, but our reservation was at 11:00 and the music didn't start until about 12:00, when we were finishing up our food.  When they started playing the bad was great, but I expected to have the music playing throughout.    The ambiance and service were excellent and make up for what the food lacked.

Z92YrAqTEi0G18weYABXIA.review_text: Wow, what a discovery! For my jazz-themed birthday evening we had planned for cocktails at Yoshi's, but the bar was too packed with the wrong crowd so we decided to try the place next door, which was quieter with the more romantic mood we were looking for. Though only a few years old, it has a very old school vibe. We sat in the lounge decorated with portraits of the Fillmore during its jazz heyday, and I enjoyed the BEST Sazerac and then Manhattan I've EVER had! Very light and smooth, served up in martini glasses, unique presentation for these cocktails. We even saw Willie Brown there, but we see him at almost every swank joint we go to in San Francisco. This place does the neighborhood justice, and is at least as cool and comfy as Yoshi's (when it's not too crowded.) Cheers.

QwXpGYoZ4eUE4Bp_sQWj2Q.review_text: As sad as I am to give a two-star review, I cannot honestly give more than that because my fiance and I were both pretty disappointed with our experience.  We were so excited for dinner here, and we just did not leave satisfied with our dinner.  It started with us arriving 20 minutes early for our reservation and being told that we could sit at the bar and that happy hour was going on.  So we took seats at the bar and ordered a couple half-off appetizers: Maple Syrup Slow Braised Beef Short Rib "Sliders" and Black Skillet Fried Chicken Sticks.  They were both pretty tasty (and half off!), but sadly this was the highlight of the meal.  30 minutes passed and no one came to let us know that our seat was ready.  When we finally flagged down the hostess and asked if we could be seated, her response was that we could of course have gotten seated whenever we wanted to...then why didn't anyone tell us that?  But no big deal, off to dinner!  I was so excited for the cornbread everyone raves about, but we considered it dry and not very flavorful.  I'm so used to cornbread being moist and exploding with corn goodness, and this just was not.  As for the main event: - Fried Green Tomato Salad: Pretty tasty and unique, would recommend for an appetizer if you're a goat cheese fan like we are! - Barbecue Shrimp N' Creamy Grits:  This dish left a little to be desired.  The grits were heavy but not quite decadent as it was a little over-seasoned.  The shrimp were good but not great.  I didn't find myself gobbling this entire dish up like I usually do with shrimp and grits; instead we forced ourselves to finish at least all the shrimp so it didn't go to waste. - Barbecue ribs with White Truffle Macaroni N' Cheese (special):  The biggest disappointment of the night.  We were so excited for every aspect of this dish, but the ribs turned out to be SO DRY it was so so disappointing.  And the macaroni and cheese was once again heavy without being decadent, which is just so unfortunate.  You can barely taste the truffle because the bleu cheese is overpowering.   - Garden Pea Asparagus Farro: Pretty good if you're a fan of farro.  Loved the cheesiness of the asiago and it complemented the mushroom, peas, and asparagus well.    Overall, we left dinner feeling very disappointed and both agreeing that we would not return.  And the next day when we opened up our leftovers for lunch, we realized they gave us the wrong ones.  So as much as we wanted to love this place, we unfortunately just did not.  We expected a heavy meal with this kind of food, and no one appreciates a good artery-clogging meal more than we do, but the worst feeling is a heavy meal that wasn't worth it.

bUVgA17v-a1MLsoUNwUNEQ.review_text: Went here for my friends b day. The service was excellent and the food was definitely some comfort food. I also have to mention my friend, who is a designer, left  some mock up ad there and went back couple days later to see if they might have picked them up. To our surprise they did and did not throw them away.

5IW5j5Y5FEoyoMNTARNSZg.review_text: A stylish, upscale joint with excellent food. Pricey, yes, but arguably worth it for the cool vibe and tasty vittles. A bit noisy, yes, but in an upbeat way. Neat black and white photos in the room next to the bar, and an electronic picture frame of sorts above the bar itself, with rotating images.  Our server was young, seemingly inexperienced, and definitely nervous, but he mostly did a good job. Few service problems. Well, he did forget to charge us for a drink, but being honest sorts, we pointed this out. More of a bummer was that he forgot to give us our leftovers to go. Boo.  Love the cornbread triangles and their accompanying red pepper jelly (didn't care about the honey butter). We were convinced to order an appetizer because of the time it would take to prepare our beef short ribs and fried chicken, and we did enjoy our shared dish of BBQ shrimp and grits. Tons of fried chicken. The pieces of dark meat were perfectly moist, and the white meat was pretty moist, too, given how hard it can be to do right by that part of the bird. J. liked her short ribs, and my tastes of her food convinced me that the maple flavoring worked well with the meat. Our sides of braised greens and brussels sprouts had potential, but alas, both were slightly undercooked and shoud've been more tender. Too full for dessert!  I think 1300 on Fillmore would be a great place to go for an intimate dinner for two or a larger, group gathering. The ambience is wonderful, any way you slice it, and the food will please your palate and fill you up. Just make sure you have some moolah.

CH1SB2YaLHrW_recHdCWmA.review_text: I've been to 1300 several times now. I've been for the gospel brunch (fun and delicious), and have dropped in for drinks now and then (good drinks, nice atmosphere). I really appreciate that they're trying to bring fine dining to lower Fillmore (yeah, I just made up a new neighborhood), but it just feels a little forced.   It just feels a little uncomfortable to eat $25 fried chicken when the Popeye's around the corner is actually feeding most of the local residents for a fraction of the price. Another way of saying it is that I'd appreciate 1300 more if I felt like they were more of a reflection of the neighborhood than just serving soul food to transient outsiders.  I know that's hard criticism for a team that is probably trying to do well with what they've been given. I'm not trying to be mean-spirited; just hoping they'll embrace the neighborhood rather than stand apart from it.

55yqRlBLPqxmNiZnQ7VHKw.review_text: I liked the decor, I liked the food, I liked my server. I don't know much else to really say, you should try it for yourself because "soulful american cuisine" doesn't seem to make everybody happy, but I thought it was nicely prepared and very tasty. The meal was well spiced and generously portioned.  Really good drinks on top of it all.

5sv8NUz5q0jDMa6jr-5vEg.review_text: Run, don't walk.  This place was one of the most enjoyable meals I've had in a long time.  The bar is outstanding, with just the right crowd and noise level - it was busy, but not so busy that you actually had to wait for anything.  Dinner was spectacular.  I didn't know anyone in San Francisco had any idea what a grit was, let alone any idea what to actually do with one (well, OK, with many, but you get the point).  I had the assorted mushrooms with hominy grits, and my colleague had the barbeque shrimp and grits for appetizers - both were great, though the mushrooms were better.  For entrees, the tenderloin was perfectly done with bleu cheese scented grits as a great accompaniment, and my buddy loved his short ribs.  The braised greens side was good for the soul - my personal belief is that CPMC should keep glasses of the juice on hand as wound healing potions.  Add a nice wine list, a greeting from the owner/chef, good wait staff, and a pleasant hostess with a great smile, and 24-hour parking across the street, and you've got a destination in the Western Addition.  Yoshi's, Schmoshi's - I'm coming back here often.

Vcadamdv04NuyAiRIWSkOg.review_text: Trying to think how the entire picture went, i guess id have to give it 4 stars.    I went here yesterday, just because i wanted to try someplace new.  Last minute.  Not dressed fancy or anything, so i felt like i was not going to fit in.  The host greeted us as we entered, and gave us a table right away.  She even said a joke or 2 to us, and was really friendly.  I guess on a Tuesday night around 8:30 pm, theres not too much action going on.  As we sat down, the server came up and introduced himself.  Anyone who knows me knows that i am a wine whore.  So the first thing i did, was grab the wine menu.  I havent tried too many wines on that list, so i asked the server for a recommendation.  He said, he would get the manager to talk more with us.  The manager came and gave us suggestions, and i too the one of a cab franc.  Which was not too bad at all.  Then the food came.  Shrimp Hush puppies that were pretty OK.  I had the Bouillabaisse which i thought tasted awesome.  It had lobster, crab, scallops, mussels, and fish.  A little small on the portion size, but it was so tasty.  My friend had the rabbit.  She said it was a little dry, and i somewhat agreed.  And that was a really small portion as well.    Dessert was so good though, that it made up for her meal.  The Warm chocolate beignets with chocolate dipping sauce melted in my mouth, not in my hand.  That was so good, that i almost melted.  The atmosphere and decor is pretty chic.  Its comfy and classy at the same time.  Wide open spaces, good lighting, everything clean and crisp.    Service wasn't rushed either, seeing as we stayed there for 2 hours.  But again i don't think they were too packed.  So all in all, food was good.  At least my food was.  The wine was good as well.  The portions were a little small.  The price was a little pricey, but hey its not too outrageous.

8e0KSGo7VYQmFfB7w9TaBQ.review_text: Something has changed.  Still a classy place, but the food has changed. It is a bit saltier and somewhat less moist. The fried chicken use to be to die for, and for $25+, it better be. It's not as good as it once was.  Still one of my favorites, but maybe time to try somewhere else.

AHe1ZwJtxQiEAmd23U2AUw.review_text: We went there with friends for the Sunday Gospel brunch. We love restaurants with live music but this place was ridiculous. The band was good but WAY TOO LOUD! They need to turn down the amps. We could not have any kind of conversation. I was really looking forward to trying a new place but I would never go back. I left with a headache.  The loud music made it impossible to enjoy our meal. And the band never took a break.    We also asked for a list of whiskeys and had to remind our server three times before he remembered to bring it. We also had to hunt down our server to get our check. My meal was good but the portion was very small. I ordered the shrimp and grits and there were about 5 shrimp and a small portion of grits. There was no bread or other accompaniments with the meal. My meal arrived a good 5 minutes after my friends' meals arrived.   After reading all the reviews on Yelp, I was extremely disappointed.

v2LhtGmORy2r5f3QdjxjZw.review_text: I tried 1300 for the first time the day of the Union Street Fair; apparently it's new. The lounge area in the front is comfortable while you wait for your table. There's also a wall of photographs dedicated to the history of Fillmore Street that's pretty interesting.  The drinks are good and the food is really great. I highly recommend, surprisingly enough, the friend chicken, it's amazing. The ribeye, the foie gras with waffles and bacon foam, the gnocchi, and the shrimp with grits were also particularly impressive. The service was also noticeably pleasant.  1300 is definitely a place to go back to, but maybe only for an occasion as the food is rich and the bill is heavy.

asx4juE5TEE-kJLz55kDUA.review_text: This is more of a prelim. review. I only had the bar menu- which was rich as all hell. Cheese grits, corn bread with bacon?, something else cheesy... I mean it's soul food people.  Good food, portions could be a bit bigger for price. Drinks were good. Nice wine list. Cocktail list could use a little work but, It's closest competitor in that range is all the way up at the Elite anyway.  Harry's Bar does not count- That's place is the depth of cocktail hell. Anyplace with a frenet chiller, tequila chiller, and jager chiller- will not serve good cocktails. But i digress.... Anyway 1300- always is saying that it is booked out table wise. I have  never- save for one Friday night- seen the main dining room full. What's up with that on open table. You're not all that yet...

JUCnKShyNuO71NPfchIvmg.review_text: We had an amazing dinner. The fried chicken is fabulous. We had several appetizers and they were all great. We would definitely go there again. The wait staff was amazing. Every part about the dinner was just perfect. One complaint might be that the noise level is pretty high. Could they do something about that?

K8cVrkmyM2lTwR9froinpQ.review_text: No it is not acceptable to take my reservation, confirm my reservation, and then cancel it. If you are going to do business with Village Vines, then you need to honor your reservation commitments.  Here's my new policy: any restaurant that does business with any of the promotional discount sites (Groupon, Townhog, Village Vines, etc)  gets a one star review when you choose to not honor your commitment with said site. If I hold a discount and you choose not treat me like a normal customer, then I will not treat you well on Yelp.  This sort of behavior makes my blood boil. Enough said.

Rx7DNBmPPShVjlcQidGuTw.review_text: maybe it's my own fault for not eating land animals, but i was not that impressed w/ this place.  i came here last night for dinner, and we had a 9:15 reservation.  we got there on time, but our table was not ready yet, so we had a drink at the bar.  all the cocktails here are tasty, and i had the french 75.  we were seated about 15 minutes later and started ordering food.  for the table, we got the fois gras and sauteed mushrooms w/ grits to share.  the sauteed mushrooms and grits app was literally a spoonful, and we each (5 of us!) delicately ate small bites of it.  it was tasty but just tiny.  our server forgot to bring us the cornbread and eventually brought it over w/ the honey butter and pepper relish, which was good.  my friend got the poached egg salad, which she really liked.     since i  am not eating meat, for my entree, i got the arctic char, which came w/ brussel sprouts and potatoes.  the fish was cooked lightly and slightly rare on the inside, which i liked.  the portion was fairly small, and since we had such a late reservation, i scarfed down the whole thing.  also, there was a big lull between apps and entrees, so i was starving by the time the food arrived.  if i went w/ the infamous fried chicken or short ribs, which my friends got, i think i would have been much more satisfied, b/c the portions for those dishes were huge.  we also tried the collard greens w/ ham hock, and mac and cheese.  i had originally also ordered a side of fries, but our server forgot the order, so i decided that i didn't need the extra calories and didn't get them.  for dessert, we shared the beignets and the sorbets and petit fours.  the beignets were good, but they were supposed to come w/ a chocolate cola, and they ran out.  our server decided to comp this dessert.  the sorbet and petit fours was the smallest dessert i have seen in my life.  it came on a "tic tac toe" plate, which had 9 dif sections, each w/ a dif dessert on it.  however, each section was basically a 1 in X 1 in square, so not much could fit on there.  there were 2 scoops of sorbets that were each the size my thumb nail, one section w/ pomegranate seeds, one 2 two almonds, one w/ a cookie, one w/ a cream puff, and one w/ a petit four.  again, each item was about the size of my thumb.  this was not a dessert you should share.    anyhow, all in all, we had a great time, b/c the company was great..  however, given the price of the food and the small portions, i don't know if i would come back.

XJ4igeCvZ-nvBXpTMZr9Kw.review_text: Judging by the exterior, you'd never think it is so nice and cozy on the inside. The lounge area and the main dining area is awesome. People generally dress up a little here and that adds to the ambiance of the place.  Service is spot on, never had an empty water cup or anything out of place. Bar drinks are made really well, the selection of beers and wine is decent.   As for the food, I can't claim this place to have the best blacked chicken or the best corn bread, it is comfort food and as such I was satisfied, however room for improvement exists. After a few more visits, it appears as if not enough selection is offered on menu.  I was craving more variety.

mA3Os9shPwJj5CIsGFmpjg.review_text: This area really needed a place like this! Sexy, classy and full of SOUL!  The owners are super friendly and upon leaving on a Sat night at almost closing, 1 AM we got a chance to meet the Executive Chef Mr. David Lawrence and Monetta is so sweet!   The hostess knew we were waiting for a table with a reservation for about 1/2 hour and she brought us some corn bread which was very thoughtful! Thank you for that.   Shrimp and grits, Pork chops, halibut, Sea bass... Portions are a little bit smaller, but our service was great. Our waiter Jonathon even made a little joke with us about chocolate.   Try their dessert too!

kmrK4LByvnX3SgU2tIDmOw.review_text: If I could give this place more stars, I would. This place has absolutely phenomenal food. I have to admit, I was skeptical when my husband told me he made reservations here for our one year wedding anniversary. Fancy soul food? How could it be.   Oh, but it was. Every morsel that was on my plate was simply delicious. I'll give you a play by play.   First off, instead of bread, they bring you corn bread. It was so perfectly warm and crumbly. When you add the honey butter to it, it was yummy. When you add the jalapeno pepper jelly to it, it was out of this world. If I could have bought that jelly to bring home, I would have in a heartbeat.   In order to try more dishes, we ordered 2 of the small plates a an entree to share. We started out with the shrimp hush puppies. Perfectly seasoned and fried. On our waiter's recommendation, we had the shrimp and grits too. The shrimp was very good, but it was the grits, a food I usually don't even like, that completely blew this dish out of the water. The grits were so creamy and light!   As our main dish, we had the full slab of ribs. Absolutely amazing. There are no other words to describe it. I've never had ribs that were so tender, so juicy, and so flavorful. The portion size was very generous too. And the meal got even better. The ribs came with a side of mac and cheese with truffle oil. Oh so good.   When it came time to think about dessert, I was already so full, but I knew I couldn't leave without trying one of their desserts. Again, on our waiter's recommendation, we tried the bread pudding. So yummy, which is huge for me to say because up until now, I never had a bread pudding that I liked.   The atmosphere was great, our server was one of the best I've ever had, and the food is just mind-blowingly good. You need to head there soon.

_R2F23Gf1lscJGYESQcNbw.review_text: Went to 1300 Fillmore for the Gospel Brunch, Sunday 11 am.  Here's the rub:  FOOD: It was fine.  Not great, but not bad.  I got the fried chicken, which was good.  The mashed potatoes tasted a little too much like instant.  It's not hard to make a delicious biscuit, and I would say that these biscuits were mediocre.  My Bloody Mary was tasty and heavy on horseradish (not a bad thing) but the celery stick in it had clearly been cut the night before as the end was dry and brown.  AMBIANCE: The gospel music was great.  However, it was freezing in the restaurant!  SERVICE: Everyone was polite but service was slow. It took them 5 minutes to give us water.  Then they forgot our order of cinnamon rolls.  I reminded them and they comped the rolls, which was nice.

ztxDVxNgC6ZhUlraDfRhZQ.review_text: Food is creative and fresh.  Kitchen needs to balance spicy with not.  Service is over attentive. Less is more all the way around.

SHEziY_V4G60mVyLNvjLSQ.review_text: We came with very high hopes, but left pretty disappointed. We were headed to  Yoshi's, but decided to do something different and eat here instead of our usual ritual of dinner/show at Yoshi's. The space - lighting, seating, colors, etc. is really beautiful and romantic. Although the service was slow throughout our meal, the food did start out promisingly. The corn bread was absolutely delicious - one of the best I've ever had. The truffle mac-n-cheese and the greens were outstanding as well. Too bad those sides turned out to be the highlights of our dinner. Husband ordered the roasted catfish with andouille. Good, but not great. Needed a bit more heat. I ordered the fried chicken. I appreciate "upscale" versions of down-home cooking, but sometimes, it's best to just not try so hard. The chicken is de-boned (wrong on so many levels...) and rolled in what I'm guessing is some sort of cracker mixture, which gave it a very heavy texture. Also, the chicken and/or the breading was not well-seasoned. Worst part? The thigh meat was not cooked through. I thought it might have been the dim lighting, but I stopped eating it and turned to the white meat (which looked fine under the lights.) Upon getting home, husband and I both agreed that my left-over thigh meat was very, very pink and definitely not cooked through. That's the way you guarantee that I won't be back.

L-GQph-9IrXoKbvGJgz3uw.review_text: went back again for brunch w bf. stellar service and very friendly folks. after brunch, we moved over to the lounge, which is spacious and lovely and soooo comfy, and ordered up a bottle of wine and relaxed. i think we were there lingering for hours and when brunch service was over, they let us hang out. a couple friends showed up and we ordered another bottle (rec from manager) that was delish. they were very friendly and accommodating. brunch was pretty tasty too. i really like this place, i've decided. need to come back for dinner.

YX7jkIZ5Z1ppqE8EjGBFig.review_text: Great place in the Fillmore! Loved the Shrimp and Grits!

BsRhkiDWVVdRbaJcbbb47g.review_text: What a great place to spend a laid back evening with a wonderful friend.  Highlights were the appetizer Hush Puppies with fresh water shrimp.  These were plump, juicy, tender, perfectly cooked shrimp in a cornmeal battered crisp coating, served with a seasoned remaulaide (sp?) dipping sauce.  Cornbread was delicious, especially with the accompanying jalapeno jelly.  I was surprised at how much I enjoyed the jelly, and we found it was even better when we dipped our hush puppies into it.    The corn chowder was more like a sweet corn bisque, and arrived with a swirled pesto-flavored olive oil on top, in a  whimsical pattern.  My entree, part of the 3-course prix fix menu, was the beef "briquette," which the waitress confirmed was actually brisket.  I was underwhelmed: The three slices were comprised of about 1/3 fat, which some people might enjoy but which I can't get rid of fast enough.  (I wish restaurants asked if you like or don't like this type of presentation -- I find it disgusting.)  The beef tasted kind of like it had been cooked a lot earlier, then reheated, and was quite dry and tough.  The sauce is served on the side, and is spicy and nice, but couldn't  quite add enough moisture to the over-dry beef.  It came with a small ramekin of macaroni and cheese, which was kind of spicy and quite delicious.  It also was supposed to come with cole slaw, but since I don't eat cabbage, they quite cheerfully substituted a ramekin of sauteed greens, which were okay, but kind of tough.    My friend ordered the full rack of ribs, which were served with the mac and slaw.  The ribs were tender, perfectly cooked, moist, and delicious.  I like it that the sauce is on the side, because it allows us to add just the exact right amount each bite requires.  He also had the Little Gem Salad, which was garnished with pecans and corn bread croutons.  He said it was nice.    We finished with desserts and couldn't quite decide on two, so ordered 3:  the pistachio creme brulee, which arrived garnished with fresh fruit and with two crescent cookies on the side.  This dish alone earned 5 stars.  My friend had the apple tart in caramel sauce with vanilla ice cream on the side.  Yummy, delicious, perfectly cooked and presented, another 5 star recipient.  The third choice was the house-made chocolate chip cookies, served with a dollop of vanilla ice cream.  Hmmm... I guess some people like cinnamon in their dry, fluffy chocolate chip cookies.  We both agreed that it overpowered the cookie, which we expected to be warm, chewy, and oozing melted chocolate chips, but which were served at room temp.  They'd get 2 stars from me.    The ambiance is warm and welcoming, and all of our wait staff were friendly, and promptly responded to requests and queries.  I wish I could bestow 5 stars overall, but the brisket dropped the experience fully by one star.  My recommendation is that they rethink this menu item; watching the food being delivered to other tables, all the other entrees looked and smelled absolutely delicious.    There is a convenient parking lot directly under the restaurant -- enter on Eddy street.  I just learned they have a Jazz Brunch each Sunday, and can't wait to return to give it a whirl!

QJsvTbq7pryyBDrNAyoO4g.review_text: Food is over priced. I thought watermelon salad should be different, but it turned out it's just regular salad substitutes tomato with watermellon, really not impressive.   I got the ribs, it tastes ok. The strawberry shortcake was just ok too.  Actually the only good think I love, is the corn bread before meal and the sparkling rose.  They have live jazz and singer at night too. Parking is public parking or street parking.

LNodea7ZXjf2N_wE-0m6NQ.review_text: Went for Thanksgiving. Alex was a great waiter! The food was delicious and perfectly crafted. The cornbread, the mac and cheese, and the turkey were excellent. I am glad I got to spendThankagiving dinner at 1300 on Fillmore!

cxn7lGc4XOz4iACVAWNGbw.review_text: I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place.  Very romantic for a date.  Delicious food, curious staff, nice ambiance.  Love the Jazz decor.  Great drinks as well

ZnPRD8XJ5cp4mhPOD-15kw.review_text: Outstanding! The short ribs were great! Very good wine list. Excellent service. Our original choice that night was booked up so we went with a recommendation. Glad we did. Try the grits, yes I said the grits, you won't be sorry.

aWqqIhpplvoSsu-BikWFZA.review_text: The place is very hip and beautiful. However, that's all it was. First of all the rude was ... not nice, not mean, but more like I am bothering her with my presence. The service was crappy. It was a Sat evening and they ran out of my first 2 choices for the entree. So I decided to go with their pre fixe menu, which they then told me was not available Fri and Sat. But they were willing to do it for me a la carte. No thank you. Why wasn't that written anywhere on the menu??? My boyfriend got the salmon and I got the catfish. I'm not gonna even bother look up their descriptions nor did I bother to remember. Both lacked flavor. It's so full of a restaurant to not put salt and pepper on the table, assuming that their food is flavorful enough that the patrons don't need it??? Well their food did and it took them about 8 minutes to find containers to put salt and pepper together to present to me. The service was sooo slow. Took 20 minutes just to get water and bread. The server was pleasant but never came around at all. I won't be back. I don't know why it's so packed. Waste of money.

NDDgvl-JbJTQzpTUrgODHA.review_text: CLASSY fried chicken! WHAT? YEAH!  it was absolutely delightful, moist, and delicious.  word on the (boyfriend's) street is that the pork is also delicious.  went here for a friend's bday, ate delicious food, had delicious drinks, and watched the giants beat the phillies in NCLS game 6.   sweet.

WKsnYghGhVnol5XgM-cKmg.review_text: Great Restaurant - committed to great service. The Hostess may have been in training and never followed up with us on moving us to another table. Excellent food - Chef mad vegetarian entrees for my friend everything was delicious!

_ccjRaY3b8HNCtKOk96Iqg.review_text: Went with a group of 9 people to celebrate an engagement.  Several of us went to school in Atlanta and live in the neighborhood, so we were excited to try 1300 On Fillmore out.  We started in the lounge area.  Very cool setting, inviting couches, great decor.  Had to send the mojito back (too much lime, not enough sugar and mint?  just tased off).  Other than that the lounge was top notch.  We headed in to the dining room and things started off well.  Warm cornbread an butter was outstanding ... so good that we had several rounds of it.  Appetizers we decent.  Unfortunately, when the entres came, nobody was impressed.  Between us we have 3 fried chicken, 3 ribs (2 special and one off the regular menu), 2 ribeye, and I can't recall waht else.  They tried to hard to make fried chicken gourment and screwed it up (cinnamon flavor?).  The ribs were dry and not very flavorful, and the ribeye was dissapointing for this level of resturant (I can get a better one at Outback for less than $20).  Service was generally good, but the momentum slowed at after dinner when we asked them to bring out a cake we brought (it took 20+ minutes to get it served).  Also, it is a bit irritating to get charged $30 to serve a cake when your dinner bill is already well over $500.  Overall, I would recommend the lounge for drink before/after dinner, especially if you get there early with a big group and can "take over" a section.  Dinner was disappointing and not recommended.  I think they are trying too hard to make southern food gourmet, and screwing i up in the process.

nyOP3HbNfFyt91qCeo-qxw.review_text: We saw this restaurant on Check Please and made reservations for 5:30 for our anniversary. Arrived on time. First to be seated. Nice interior.  Ordered the fried chicken and wifey ordered short ribs. Food came out forgot to take a picture.  Too hungry.  Nice presentation food was average.  Fried chicken was boneless and needed more flavor. Beef was okay alittle over done. Sides were average can't remember remember what we had. Staff were  somewhat unfriendly too busy training each other. Overall under whelming.  Value was not there.

83wVBjW1caQeeSgDnT4uVA.review_text: 4.5 stars. Ummm yeah...where do I start? This place is freakin' incredible. The service is relaxed and professional and the food is impeccably prepared, upscale soul food. The shrimp hush puppies are awesome, as is the fried chicken and short ribs. The desserts are wonderful (and big), though they offer a few of them in half sizes (mini banana cream pie and s'mores- yum!) Add a bottle of Faust 2005 Cab and I was totally satisfied.

6HHCVftF3RNM2zN-DYukKQ.review_text: The venue is super cool. There are a ton of lounge style seats next to the bar so going here for drinks only is acceptable. However, you would be missing out on the food so don't do this. Instead make reservations and have the sea & swine appetizer and the black skillet roasted catfish. You won't regret it.

ILz8ApVEgTqbv5LnC6PyuA.review_text: Pretty nice spot! The bar itself is nice and classy and the lounge/bar area has plenty of seats, more so than the dining area. They did a great job here with the overall decor and vibe...

4uUspdcp3TZhIGcD5xHQgg.review_text: I came here for a friend's birthday, and she got a private room:  So.....  the food here is decent (as in edible), but most of the portions are ridiculously small and the food is overpriced/overrated.  I don't think it was worth the money, at all, and can think of five other places offhand that I'd rather be for the $$.  I ordered the fried chicken that I'd heard so much about, and it was not impressive.    And....  the service was slow, the waitresses forgot drinks, and then forgot to refill drinks upon multiple requests.  I just don't see what everyone else sees in this place.  It was at very best, o-kay.

mn2dBGX5-brzrPr8gx8XoQ.review_text: I recently returned to have share the fried chicken with a friend, we tried the fresh water shrimp hush puppies which were good, isn't almost everything fried ;-) The chicken was very yummy as I knew it would be, the brussel sprouts were good as well. We didn't drink wine and decided to go with something a little stronger, the wait for our drinks from the bar was a bit disappointing, however I probably didn't need anymore martinis so maybe they were doing me a favor.

GPSF15aWuhw_yiZs3X4eEg.review_text: Love the ambiance here. Perfect for dinner or a drink and Yoshi's is right next door. Food here is way better than Yoshi's so perfect place to get dinner before going to a show next door.  The service was lovely. The food wasn't the best I've had - fried chicken I'm looking at you...SF still can't seem to do soul food right. But the service and ambiance push it into the 4 star category for me.

5Xqj_KrRThawozsciuTdJQ.review_text: I went her for a birthday party and it has very nice atmosphere. A good mix of neo-southern food. Since it was a birthday party, we had a pre-fixed meal. We started off with thegrits starter. Very good! I loved the flavor and the mushrooms with it. Then we had the warm pear salad. The warm pear made that dish. For the main course, we had a course of the sea bass, short rib, or butternut squash farro. I chose the short rib. It was really tasty and tender. The sea bass looked good too.  It is small, but they did have a small band play on a Saturday night. I would go here again. I have to try the fried chicken and beignets.

sEHLbboKDHRZKpWuEVlYXA.review_text: Really cool place. The inside is very nice and we had great service.   The prices were very reasonable, the Fried Chicken was around $20 and very good. We were able to bring a couple bottles of wine to dinner and had a great time.  The bar area is great, they were having a private event there with a bunch of SF socialites that were getting pretty roudy. One thing i will mention was that although it is not a fancy restaurant, half of the guys in there were wearing blazers/suits, so I would dress up a little more for this place.   Great food, service, and prices, I will be back.

2twfOpOzul0ggUgFpdDqaQ.review_text: I can't believe some of these reviews I have been reading, as this was hands down the worst dining experience I have had in this city, and I have had some doozies (Farmer Brown comes to mind).  I went for a birthday dinner for a friend and there was just not one aspect of our meal that was pleasant.  For starters, we waited a good 15 minutes after beinbleg seated before anyone came over to bring water, menu's or anything. When our waiter came over, he made suggestions for things that were not on the menu, which I appreciated.  After taking our orders, he returned only when the food was ready, and at that time notified us that the specials he recommended were not available, it was at this time that we also realized that he had never even taken the birthday boys meal order. So now, 3 people had meals and 3 people were just now placing new orders and the birthday boy, his first order. It was a mess. There were no apologies, or even a acknowledgement of the situation. Upon receiving our meals, we were all terribly dissapointed with the taste, texture and even the appearance and presentation.  The food was bland, tough, and just plain unappetizing. I will never return here, and never recommend it to anyone I care about. Just plain sad....

rDyvkXwMjYz3yQ9WtoICwA.review_text: Good, hearty brunch.  What they offer is generally well made, but the menu is a little thin.  Classy, subdued atmosphere.  Solid service.

0in2lZcHmh6VqFq7_0nhUg.review_text: First off, the service here is awesome. George was our server and was fantastic and fun. Kudos to George for really awesome service.  We started with a cocktail in the bar. Drinks were very well prepared. The main dining area is very attractive, although the bench seating had us leaning into the table to avoid lapping the foods.  We started with the delish corn bread. Immediately I knew the dollop of honey butter would not be enough and George was kind enough to up that supply.   The hush puppies were quite tasty and great on their own without the sauce.  We got the beef short rib, half rack of baby back ribs and, of course, the chicken.  Beef short ribs is actually pulled and when first came to the table made us slightly confused. Resembling a round chocolate torte with a single bone in the middle, topped withan eloquent onion ring, it took a few moments to figure the approach. Once we did we found it to be quite tasty.  The pork ribs: personally, I appreciate good ribs with no sauce. I'm glad I do since I was given about .5 oz of sauce on the side. The ribs themselves were smoked and baked... Very good in that fashion but I would be happy with well prepared baked ribs alone.  Last was the fried chicken. So I know this was supposed to be the pinnicale, but while it was good, I didn't seem to be on the band wagon. The coating was tasty in flavor and would have been great but it was ultimately too salty. And my expectations were for for more of a crispy crunchy texture. This was more like a well baked coffee cake topping in texture. The chicken meat itself was quite good and moist and flavorful.  I think the ratings would be more fair if the scale was to 10.. I would give a 7. The price was a little steep for the value, so makes it difficult to come here for something other than special occasions, but I would try it again.

R4PT0KxM9HvccueUsWgPsA.review_text: went for brunch. was just ok. very cool ambiance

HHejW0DC4OyPKewIW8Xf0w.review_text: I recently stopped in for a late night bite with friends and was very impressed with the food, the music and the service. 1300 Fillmore has an elegant and spacious ambiance, dark interior, historical photos of the earlier days in the Fillmore and jazz and blues music in the background. From the creamy grits with shrimp to the amazing Black Skillet fried chicken, bourbon pork belly dish, Crispy Skin King Salmon and yes even the Grilled Ribeye Burger - all were perfectly executed. The waiter suggested a great bottle of wine to go with all the various plates.  The Berry Cobbler was a nice finish with homemade ice cream (4 spoons please!).  All in all great experience at 1300 Fillmore.

OFPG2PrbxGuaYYQQYs-1mw.review_text: If it forced me to find the keys to my old Yelp account, it must have left some kind of impression.  As a party of two we were seated at a four-top near the kitchen. The stream of servers hustling past on either side made us feel a bit like a rock in a river. We were ignored for most of our meal, save for the passive recognition that constant chair-bumping provides. When we asked if we could perhaps shift the table a bit : "Sorry, it's a walkway." True that.  You ever been at a party and have some guy start to make small talk with you -- and then you can see the moment five seconds later when he realizes he really doesn't give a wooly crap about your existence? As though talking to you was some kind of painful accident brought about by a brief moment of existential angst? Our server was kinda like that. Everyone else was nice though.  The food was passable as vaguely Soul, vaguely Low Country, vaguely Southern. I think the word "refined" misses the mark though; in most cases, it's a heap of food on a plate. (And some things are misnamed: breaded shrimp are not hush puppies, no matter the texture of the breading.) Admittedly it's a tough nut to crack, as "soul food" means a lot of things to a lot of people. All that said, the flavors and textures were generally good. And a little bit goes a long way. Dishes were heavy. Don't over-order. The shrimp and grits was a highlight; the soupy mac and tough, chewy  pork belly I could have done without.  Two drinks and six shared plates set us back almost $150 all in, which is steep for the quality of both food and service. For that kind of outlay there are better options in the neighborhood.

fLKbns1B_8AnbRqHFloALw.review_text: I must say, after hearing so many people rave about this place and having it bookmarked for over a year, I finally tried it.  I was VERY disappointed.  I wanted 1300 to be soooo good and it was a great let down.  Let me first start off by saying, the ambiance and decor in this place was EXCELLENT!!!!! I loved the low lights, the wonderful pictures all over the walls and the furniture.    The customer service was GREAT!!!! I was seated quickly and was waited on very promptly. My waitress (BETH) was great with recommended the dishes she thought was a hit.  Ok now, let's get to the nitty gritty...the FOOD!!! First and foremost, I looked at the menu and thought I was missing some pages or thought I was given some kind of short menu. WRONG!!!! Where the heck is the rest of the menu is what I thought??? For this to be a "soul food" place it was surely missing out a lot of options.   In any case, my friends told me I must get the shrimp n' grits and I did just that...and a little more. LOLOL  For starters, the corn bread was great.  After seen these cute little triangular cut pieces of corn bread, I knew I wasn't in Kansas anymore.  I definitely had in my head a different expectation of this food. I want soul food!!! Real soul food.  This on the other hand was like foo-foo soul food. You know that upscale soul food.  That soul food where they call it soul food but give it a what I call a "money" twist.    The corn bread was just that. Foo-foo.  I mean don't get me wrong it was good but anyone could have made it.  And just because you offer corn bread with dinner doesn't make it soul food.  It came out with a honey butter that was good but of course, I wasn't tasting honey any where. LOL  It was also accompanied with some jalepeno jelly that wasn't my cup of tea.    The shrimp n' grits came out and it was beautiful :)  I also ordered the Hush puppy shrimp. Mmm Mmm.  As you can see I was ready to get my shrimp on :)  One bit of the shrimp n' grits and I was wondering where the heck was the seasoning????? I mean grits with no flavor might as well had been cream of wheat. Nice decorated on the plate were the shrimp and they were very good. The gravy was mediocre and I was hoping the shrimp hush puppies would be better...NOT!!!! They too were seasonless and dry. Thank goodness I had some dipping sauce!  All in all, I was so disappointed that I didn't even want to try the dessert and wondered what all the hoop la was about.  Doubt I'll ever come here again :( This executive chef needs to visit Pican in Oakland or Farmer Brown's for some tips. SMDH...shameful!

pnV2iycAX0cTuSt45eBPng.review_text: This is one of my favourite places to take clients and my parents in SF. The Jazz inspired ambiance is sophisticated and the cocktail bar is perfect for waiting for your guests to arrive over a dirty martini.   The tables aren't too close, the chairs are comfortable, the music isn't loud and the lighting is perfect. Everything you need for great conversation!  Good wine list. Great corn bread with jalapeno butter. My favourite entree is the shortrib which is so tender it melts in your mouth!

6bB8wE3iTdpBumUoJbKzxw.review_text: Great place to stop by after Yoshi's. Excellent also if you just wanna come in out of the cold and have a hot drink...

0gCrKZvOYRRDNExE-uL0qA.review_text: 1300 of Fillmore ruined our evening.  My cousin and his wife were visiting from out of the area.  We planned a special evening with dinner and a show at Yoshis.  We arrived on time for our dinner reservation and told the staff our show started in 90 minutes.  It took 30 minutes to get a table and another 30 minutes to be served appetizers.  The kitchen finished our dinner 5 minutes before the show started.  I asked the waiter to hold the dinner for us so that we could return after the show, and suggested he work on a discount.  At midnight we returned to 1300 on Fillmore for our dinner.  The waiter was leaving and told us the manager had agreed to a gift certificate to ease the pain.  We were servered cold catfish in cardboard boxes.   It had not been refrigerated to get cold instead put in the cardboard boxes two hours earlier and left to sit out and soak into the cardboard.  The manager was nowhere to be found.  We asked several waiters and were told she was busy in the back but that we should wait.  Finally I had to go into the back of the kitchen to find her hiding out.  My recommendation is to eat at Yoshis.  You will save yourself a lot of money, aggrivation and arrive to your show on time.  1300 Fillmore should have a sign on the door that says "Please Wait Here".

MhVGeE4WtrTHMizA89Pccg.review_text: Great place for a fun and unique (and not stuffy) Easter brunch!  Live Gospel music, bottomless pomegranate mimosas and spicy eggs benedict = best Easter brunch I've been to in a while (yes Palace Hotel you are still amazing, but when I want a fun and low-key brunch I'll go here instead; and yes Brenda's I love your homestyle Southern cooking, but hate standing in line).    Great option for a fun brunch with family or friends.  They also have quite a bit of seating for larger parties.

HdaLqZjroe6IMPci055BDA.review_text: I've been wanting to try 1300 for a while now and because of the BBE promo, I decided to to finally try it with some girlfriends.  Our table ordered the Fried Chicken, Braised Short Ribs,  the Crispy Salmon, and the Truffled Mac N Cheese.  The fried chicken was definitely overhyped to me as it was a little too dry.  However, the biscuits that came with it was the highlight of my meal.  They were so good!  The fried chicken dish can be easily shared.  My friend and I only ate half of our orders and took the other half home.  The short ribs were a hit at the table and the crispy salmon was just okay.  I wish the truffle mac n cheese had more of truffle kick to it (I love truffle!) so it tasted ordinary to me. The cornbread served at the beginning of the meal was very moist so I pretty much enjoyed their baked items.  We ended the night with the banana creme pie which we all thought was superb.    I must say the service was superb.  Our server spent a lot of time with us recommending his favorite wine and dishes.  He really made our night more enjoyable.    Overall, glad I finally got a chance to try 1300. Might come back for happy hour one day but I feel like I've tried everything I'm supposed to here.

IwR7rQBe19tXWxThX-Yv_A.review_text: I had been wanting to go to 1300 Fillmore for a while now because my friends said they liked it. I went last night and was very pleased but read on for issues. I called around 4 pm and got a reservation for the same night at 7:30, nice. We were sat on time. Our waiter was young but very good and knowledgeable about the menu. The cocktails were great. The maitre'd helped me choose an exquisite glass of wine to go with my dinner. The food was lovely, not perfect but very good. We had the shrimp hush puppies, yum, the shrimp & grits, divine, the bacon & egg salad, the egg wasn't runny and the vinaigrette had a too much vinegar it overpower the velvet of the bacon fat, the little gem salad with green goddess dressing was wonderful, very garlicky, the rib eye was too tough to cut but it was so tasty I sucked on a few bites before sending it back, so we went with the short ribs and mashed potatoes, very tasty but a little dry. the banana cream pie was lovely and I don't even like cream pies, the chef had left some of the bananas in chunks which I thought was great for the texture and the lime caramel sauce was delish even though it didn't sound appealing. The check came with a charge for a surf turf we did not order! I hate when that happens and it becomes an issue we have to resolve. It always leaves the dinner on such a bad note to have to fix your bill no matter how good your meal is. Restaurants should have a policy to have their wait staff double check the bill before they present it so they can catch & fix it before the customer has to deal with it. We really enjoyed the atmosphere, the decor, the location. We will be back.

S1Yu4McDc-ecjMO5PgW2dQ.review_text: came for gospel brunch with a girlfriend.  ordered the fried chicken and was blown away.  solid soul food, amazing live band, unlimited mimosas?  What's not to like. Definitely coming back!

nB8ffR7BZo3uezvoNmGJXA.review_text: I came with a large group of girls, we reserved an entire back room.  I ordered the risotto and simply don't know how to justify what they served.  The risotto itself looked lovely, very salty--but had potential.  The odd part was that it was served in a pool of orange oil.  Not chili-infused, not flavored in any way.  It was just sitting in about 1/4 cup of orange oil, the kind of oil you'd find on a slice of greasy pizza.  The restaurant itself had a nice ambiance, but I'd take a hole-in-the-wall with good food over 1300.  Their wait staff was somewhat rude as well, loudly proclaiming, "EXCUSE ME" with every lean in to take a plate or place a fork.    PASS.

8jo_T4CxapC2YRczmg6uMQ.review_text: My inlaws took my husband and me here for our anniversary and I have to say it was one of the best dining experiences I've ever had.  We arrived a few minutes before our reservation and decided to have a drink in the lounge, where 1 wall was an homage to all the Jazz legends from Sammy Davis, Jr., to favorites, Nina Simone and Billie Holiday.  We were then greeted by the Exec Chef, David Lawrence who wished us a happy dining experience.  -I love that personable touch!  Our reservations were for 7:30 and we were promptly seated and greeted by our waitress, who was a doll.  To our disappointment, she informed us they were sold out of their short ribs - which I was anticipating and planned on ordering.  But no worries, my second choice was their organic fried chicken with beautiful, fluffy truffle mashed potatoes and I was indeed a fan.  My mother-in-law had the beef tenderloin, which was cooked to perfection.  My husband enjoyed his entree of grilled pork chop and my father-in-law had the halibut.  Everyone's dish was seasoned, cooked and plated beautifully.   The last and definitely not the least was our dessert which was their homemade beignets, served with a chocoate sauce and coffee soda.  This was probably the BEST beignets I've ever had.  They were light and airy and melted in your mouth.  I would recommend this spot for an intimate dining experience, where the ambience invites you to stay, the staff, Chef and wife team have created a memorable place to dine and left me and my family wanting to come back again and again.

nsIMJkENEE_hsLL0dBH4Zw.review_text: Okay, so I did go back , that's right I did!  And I had two plates of the damn oysters, they were perfect, I have no will power....

DMLUJa3EkS7F3pvBaDWT7g.review_text: Great food, live music, bottomless mimosas and amazing waitstaff

kK996Gx3ZoR7Avd5WILFEg.review_text: So it's been over a month and this meal is still fresh in my mind. Granted, I haven't eaten out lots since then, but still.  Nothing was bad, I mean, I had a dessert that felt more like a puzzle I had to solve, and I still can't totally make sense of it, but I'm not complaining. that's not what I want to tell you about though.  I want to tell you about the shrimp and grits; the anson mills white grits with grilled shrimp and I think some kind of aromatic oil on top. Eat those.  And I want to tell you about the braised short rib. It comes presented in a way that does not remotely resemble a short rib or any other rib-related cut of meat, and I'm not sure where that bone in the middle is from because it seems way to small to be a rib, and the idea of onion rings on top seems a little cheesy and pedestrian, but damn, you need to have this dish. it's kind of sweet, but not sweeter than beef should ever be, and it's so tender but not mushy at all, and you get the idea, you'll be talking about it a month or two months later just like I am. That is all.

SJd8jaulh57oW2TCXoH6lA.review_text: My wife and I decided on this place based on some decent Yelp reviews and we wanted to try a new restaurant.  I was able to get a reservation on Saturday late afternoon for a 7:15 table.   Our table was ready when we arrived and the ambience was great and found myself drawn to looking at the wall pictures in the lounge of the old Fillmore district.   The staff was very friendly and our waiter was friendly and  enjoyable. He definitely added a good sizzle to the steak with his descriptions and knowledge of all the items.  We started with an appetizer of Fried Green tomatoes and  the Shrimp and grits.  Both we're fantastic. My only gripe was that there could have been more shrimp.   For entree's she ordered the buttermilk fried chicken and I got the half-rack of ribs. I'm always suspect of the quantity/size of the half rack portion of the pork ribs.  But when they came out like a brontosaurus burger, I was relieved to only have ordered the half-rack.  Since I had some left-overs for the half-rack. Partly because I probably ate too much cornbread, which I devoured like it was my last meal.  The sauces (Mustard and BBQ)  were a great combination since they provided 2 distinct flavors for the ribs.  The ribs also had plenty of pork which is another plus.   The wife enjoyed her fried chicken which was cooked perfectly.    For dessert,  I  really wanted to go with the Bananna Cream Pie but had already over eaten so we decided to split the Beignets which was a perfect closer.  Great staff, great ambience and most importantly great food.  Higly recommend this place.

qGBTI7AQxIUIecRcYtWjYg.review_text: Really a great place to go when you're in the jazz / fillmore hood.  Food is consistently good.  Sometimes the service isn't though and somethings the service is surly.  If they made that consistent, 5 stars.

RX-j1snP8EudojhMg8IkpQ.review_text: Great First Date Place.....Wonderfullll....Love it.... Try The Dessert......Everything on the menu tastesDelicious

9h1nRWISb6tdpzMwSDYMDg.review_text: John McCain was finished as a viable candidate when he stopped looking for pork and started dry-humping Dubya.  And kneeling for Jerry Falwell.  The ONLY source of his appeal was his "maverick" image, which of course was a total crock of bullshit his handlers assiduously cultivated -- he was about as "maverick" as a preppy shopper in J.Crew -- but STILL!   Oh and his ANGER -- was he ONE BITTER QUEEN or WHAT?!?  I watched him only because I wanted to see him rip Cokie Roberts' head off with his bare hands.  ENTERTAINMENT, people!   But what do we have now? Just another robo Repub who wants to tell women what to do with their uteri and prevent me from marrying Richard Simmons.    Well, I've commandeered the Straight Talk Express!  And since I'm writing the 43rd review of this restaurant as opposed to the 430th, I'm obligated to be informative -- oh shut the fuck up bitches, I'm TRYING.   I'll therefore refrain from discussing   - the gay sex I just had - the gay sex I plan to have - the gay sex I know you're having right now (HUH?!?)  I CAN SEE THE DISAPPOINTMENT ON YOUR FACES.   After drinking FAR TOO MANY Hangar Ones with cranberry juice at a party, I stumbled down Fillmore Street with a friend in a desperate search for a meal.  Fate -- or rather my hip friend -- brought us to 1300 Fillmore.  We were obviously without a reservation, yet we scored a great table in the lounge area -- in fact, I preferred the lounge to the dining room since we melted into the comfy leather armchairs there.   The space is spectacular: high ceilings, excellent lighting, lustrous and thick curtains partitioning the sizable dining and lounge areas, a "heritage wall" of lightboxed photos and video captures highlighting the cultural significance of the Fillmore.   The cornbread triangles with red pepper jelly were exquisitely hearty; the tourchon foie gras had a hint of gaminess (which I prefer) that contrasted well with the sweet huckleberry jam; the grits with truffle oil (!) were earthy, smooth and creamy; and the braised ham hock greens gave me a wide grin and a heart attack.  BUT LET ME TALK ABOUT THE FRIED CHICKEN.  My two boneless breasts were marvels of fleshy, moist meat enveloped in a crisp, thick batter surprisingly free from the oily burden one finds at lesser establishments.  And the biscuits that came with the chicken were fluffy and scented with chives and parsley.   The bill for three drinks, three appetizers, and two entrees came to around $65 per person without tax.  Definitely worth the momentary currency purge for a quality meal.  Basically, if you're like me and  - Love delicious, indulgent meals after drinking - Love a great plate of fried chicken - Love to be called "nasty slut" and "dirty whore" while having sex  Then head over to 1300 Fillmore**  **Okay, you should still visit if only two out of three apply to you.

lTmQr9rIRh96iLAcMlNBdQ.review_text: Can't get enough of that place. I just love going there. The staff is great, I love happy hour, the ambiance is so nice particularly in the lounge area. Love it!

Z5h-T5QgdQaqCGAC_svN6w.review_text: The portions here are actually surprisingly pretty large.  You can't beat the ambiance even if you were Chris Brown and the ambiance was Rihanna.  Try the fried chicken, mad tender and nearly boneless.  Cartilage can be edible, I don't consider that "bone" per se.

qvrWBzxS-K0-aaEBOkELQw.review_text: I love this place.  The food was great!!  I love the ambiance.  Great decor, and great live jazz playing, even on slow days!!!!!    They start your meal off with cornbread served with butter and a jalapeno jelly.  The jelly is really good, and a clever idea for the cornbread, since a lot of people like jalapenos in it.  We started with a couple of apps.  You have to try their shrimp and grits!  It's fabulous!  I wish I could've had a big plate of that as my main course.  Their pork belly was also very very good.  For our entrees we had the fried chicken with truffle mash.  It was good, but I've had a lot better.  The crust didn't stick onto the chicken.  We also ordered the salmon, which was tasty and perfectly cooked. The salmon came on a lobster hash, but the lobster pieces were so small, I think it looked like crawfish.  I think there was only like 1/2oz. of lobster in it at the most.  I think they should put a little more in the dish.  So people can at least see it and taste it.   We went to Blowfish the night before and ordered the salmon entree they had.  It came out very overcooked, but we still preferred the salmon at blowfish.  The salmon was really really good.  Anyways, we had mac n cheese and fries with our entrees.  I was expected the mac and cheese to be the highlight of the meal, being a southern food place, but there was something lacking.  The fries were average, but the ketchup was the best we've ever had!!!  We wish they sold it by the bottle.    I will be back.  Next time I'm gonna come early, so I can sit by the bar and enjoy the music.

TlphV6gUvMJbC74pktHVFg.review_text: I only at the restaurant once, and it was pretty good, but my review is really recommending the lounge. In fact, I wish they'd just turn the whole place into a lounge.   Nice swank space with big comfy couches and chairs that are good for small groups. The Monday to Friday happy hour is the real reason to go - lower prices on some of their appetizers (lamb sliders were the best) and $3 beers and $5 well drinks and house wine.   Just a nice place for an after work drink.  Oh, and if you like gospel music, check out their Gospel Sunday brunch once a month.

5ZXT4BQB-C1XjUpKmh7kaQ.review_text: I had a fantastic dinner here two weeks ago.  It was 6pm on a wednesday night so there wasn't much of a crowd, but the food and service were both very impressive.    The warm cornbread fresh out of the oven with the butter and jalapeno spread was a good start.  We shared the shrimp grits as an appetizer which was phenomenal.  The flavors were so delicious, I could hardly keep myself from lifting up the bowl and licking it clean.  I could've gone for about 5 helpings of that and been set for the night.    For the entrees we tried the blackened catfish and I got a half rack of ribs, the daily special.  The catfish was cooked perfectly and the flavors were very fresh.  The ribs were interesting because they had apparently been cooking all day, but they weren't prepared with the sauce already slathered on.  They came to the table completely dry with a bbq and mustard sauce on the side for you to apply as you see fit.  I tried a bite without any sauce and it was good meat.  Tender, slightly moist, but definitely a little bland.  Not being a mustard fan I went for the bbq sauce.  This would've been great had I liked mustard, or if the second sauce was something more suited to my tastes because I love the idea of mixing up the sauces right there at the table.    Dessert was chocolate filled beignets with chocolate dipping sauce.  Good.  Nothing phenomenal, but who doesn't love a fresh doughnut with plenty of chocolate to go around?  I would definitely come back here.  I need to try the mushroom grits, but those shrimp grits were just so good, I may need to eat a dinner of nothing but appetizers.

fVjYNENvePDEbYpEPFH7rw.review_text: I was very excited to try this place and my wife took me here on my birthday.  My fellow Yelpers seem to love this place and for the life of me I cannot figure out why?  Decor and Ambiance?  Okay I'll give you that, it is a pretty cool space.  Service?  Our waiter was okay, he certainly tried to accommodate and he was very generous with helping us choose some wine.  Full bar?  You bet, and that is always worth some points with me.  So what happened that I only gave the place 1 star you ask?  The food!  2 of us had the fried chicken with mashed potatoes and biscuits.  Pop Quiz hotshot:  Which was more dry, the chicken or the biscuit?  Toss up, they were both unbelievable dry!  To make matters worse, they don't add any green to this dinner, none, nada, zilch!  Are you kidding me?  I know fried chicken isn't health food, but come on, add some green beans to the plate!  We ordered a side of the brussell sprouts and they were the highlight of the night.  The other two entrees were fish and completely non-memorable.  I guess if I lived across the street from this place, and I had not eaten in 3 days and I really wanted to overpay for fried chicken I would be back.  Otherwise, you can keep it.

G5LXEaxhQMF_BVjNHkVr7g.review_text: Upscale Southern Food done right, although not inexpensively. Went here on a Sunday evening without a reservation and after a short stay in the swanky lounge, were ushered to an open table.   Having recently opened, you got the sense that everyone dining had a genuine excitement about the newness of it all, I know my friend and I did. It's definitely a swanky layout, with bold photos of the Fillmore area of old bedecking the walls throughout.  For dinner, I'd highly recommend the sauteed mushrooms to start with, perhaps the arugula salad to offer a healthier balance. While all the entrees looked and sounded good, my eyes and stomach fixated on their Fried Chicken, an entree that did not disappoint.   I'm excited for the one-two punch of 1300 and Yoshi's next door. A hot and happening jazz scene, fine cocktails (although my lime daiquiri could have been tarter) and a stylish crowd all sound promising.

rbx-RdBgLbuQFMU5IUCn4w.review_text: This was a very disappointing meal.  The fried chicken had no flavor and the potatoes were also very bland and a little runny. Fried chicken shouldn't be a struggle at a southern restaurant.  Service was very slow.    The corn bread and jelly was good though.

AYeJvi6HJyVelkjmHrL1ZQ.review_text: We did a yelp special for dinner for two.  More about Yelp later.  The restaurant was really pretty with very interesting lighting.    I didn't realize the Yelp special was for a prix-fixe dinner.  My mistake and I owned it.  There were very limited choices for dinner with this really shitty Yelp special.  One salad choice, two entree choices, one dessert choice...none of which I wanted.  I asked the waiter if we could may more money to order off the regular menu.  Or could they just apply the cost of the certificate to our dinner...how could we work this out so they made money and we got to eat a meal we wanted.  He was nice and was sympathetic, especially since I said the mistake was mine.  He said he would ask the manager to step over.  She couldn't be bothered to talk to us and said via the waiter there was nothing she could do.  We would just have to eat the prix-fixe or throw it away (we paid $81 for it) and order off the menu.  So we ate the prix-fixe...or I should say we ordered it and took a few bites of what was not very good food.  The salad was very sweet and no where near as good as I could have made at home.  Minimal goat cheese.  The entree was really fatty and not well seasoned.  I skipped the dessert but my companion said it was not much to talk about.  The glass of wine that came with the meal was some brand I have never heard of.  We googled the wine and found the price was $2.81 for a 750 ml bottle.  You could have put it on pancakes.  We didn't drink that either.  So for the meal we paid for but didn't eat we were out over $100 by the time we tipped our nice guy waiter.  So fellow Yelpers. Yelp makes a killing off deals like this.  Apparently the restaurant sends the coupon to Yelp and is reimbursed a much smaller amount as yelp keeps a bunch of the money.  Yelp, you pretty much suck in my book and I will never again buy anything from you.  Ditto for this restaurant.  The only reason it got a second star was the waiter.

aqmlR0AYz9uHZ_wyLlOhbQ.review_text: The food was very delicious, as was the wine. A solid choice for a classy dinner in San Francisco. My only complaint was that the (live) music was a bit too loud to have a conversation.

2TN-jjYg98_cPNft8OJHCw.review_text: My very best friends and I were here last Friday night.   It's not in the best neighborhood so you may want to opt for valet parking which is $12 for one car and cash only.   My friend CL and I  valet the car and walked right in and saw the other girls eagerly waiting for us.  They ordered appetizers for us already, hush puppies and cornbread.  Yumm!  I loved the hush puppies - it was delish.   I ordered the salmon and my gf and I shared the fried chicken.  The fried chicken was so delicious and so were the buttermilk biscuits that accompanied it.    The mood of the place is great for  a date or even a large group of friends celebrating a bday etc.    I will definitely bring my husband here.  I loved it!

DADQMlV-eO1bP_SmC6-bzg.review_text: Just went here for a Girls-Night-Out and had a great time!  I love the decor and ambiance - they have a very nice lounge, bar and dining area which is great to celebrate almost any occasion.  I got to this restaurant about 10 minutes before my reservation so I went to the bar and ordered a Hanger One Vodka Lime Gimlet.  It was absolutely delicious, but the price was kinda steep ($13 + tax/fees).  BUT you get what you pay for right?  Dinner was very good.  Two of us ordered beef and two of us ordered fish (salmon & catfish).  The portions were a decent size and everything was delicious!  Even the cornbread before the entrees was so delicious, we asked for seconds :)  The only thing I wasn't really crazy about was the service.  The check-in lady was nice, the bartender was nice and so were the table assistants... but the waitress wasn't the best (I HATE when people give me the bill before I'm done with my dinner).  Normally I wouldn't be so picky on the service, but when the place only has 3 - 4 tables with customers in one evening, I would expect better service.  Nevertheless, this place deserves 5 stars :)

BOSJCHlDLJDsFWmA-oypYQ.review_text: Love this restaurant.  The food is excellent, the service is wonderful and the atmosphere is relaxing and modern.  Dim lighting, background music, the perfect place for a date or a group of friends/family.  I've been there twice and both times were great.  Looking forward to the next time! PS: I highly recommend the ribs!

zQxDUhxKOHdZygnNRZ-4ng.review_text: The food was really good, fried chicken, cornbread, shrimp hush puppies. The waitress was really nice but the bartender ruined the evening. He was rude and seemed annoyed that we were at the bar. About $200 dinner for 2, I don't see a need to deal with crappy service. I do not recommend this place.

4T-ZU1__KysNe5MMmGsCYw.review_text: I was highly disappointed with this visit to 1300. The only saving grace was the music & the wine recommendation from our waitress (after she informed us they didn't have the bottle we ordered). First of all we got hoodwinked into giving up our table in the dining room to sit in the "highly coveted lounge seats"  only to find the band didn't get going until we were well into our entrees & there was ample seating all around us.  The food, although it looked gorgeous, was sadly a bit bland. I kept taking bites expecting the taste to match the look. But very few bites actually did.   We elected to stay for dessert solely because the band was great. The binges were alright. A little doughey. But the one finger of single malt scotch that was clearly watered down was inexcusable.   Unfortunately,  I would rather spend my time and money elsewhere for the illusive date night.

5X0eSDja58EOYvs_CPXbfg.review_text: I really don't like writing 2 star reviews, but I feel this one is very needed.  We went yesterday for Thanksgiving dinner.  There were three adults and one infant.  The plates were $49 for a three course dinner and one bottle of wine at $51.  The butternut squash was absolutely amazing and we each had the ribs for dinner which were very good; the meat was perfectly tender.  For dessert I had the pumpkin sampler which only had four samples of pumpkin.  I was a bit confused when it came to the table since it was suppose to be the "pumpkin sampler".  It included pomegranate seeds; very disappointing.  We also purchased a bottle of wine, which was nice.  The service was good and overall, we were happy.  However, it was at the end when the bill came that we were completely disappointed and felt a bit of shell shock.  They added an 18% gratuity onto the ticket.  Wow.  On a party of three AND on Thanksgiving.  All of us at the table at some point in our lives have waited tables and felt kind of insulted by this.  Normally restaurants do this on parties of six or more, not a party of three adults.    We would have given 20%, but unfortunately did not because of the bill.  Shame on 1300 Fillmore for doing this.  If this is their policy for parties smaller than 6 people, it's poor.

9vAOanZByunASTUns4-BhA.review_text: Review is on dinner.  Still as good as I remember from a year ago.  I had the porkchops with bleu cheese grits, the chicken tender skewers and the pork belly. all delicious.   My friends had the fried chicken and the ribs (half rack).  Fried Chicken was great and the Ribs got an Eh. (shame too because it was what the waiter suggested)  Apple Bread Pudding gets 5 stars....  well just because its perfect combination of not being too sweet, has crunch, warmth, and cold all in a decadent bite.   Strawberry Rhubarb was too sweet for me and needed more crumb to balance out the flavor (that and it was kinda cold in the middle) but thank god that was on the house.

51p6NYvYdMEVZpt2opPtQA.review_text: The first time I experience 1300 On Fillmore was for a Pre-Fixe Dinner and it was amazing!  The whole night people were telling us we had to come back for the friend chicken, so we did last week.  We went mid-week and boy, were we disappointed. Service was again, excellent but the food was downright not good.    This is what we had: Oysters - good Corn Chowder - very good Fried Chicken - meat was tender, but breading is spicy!  Not your tradiitonal chicken!! Baby Back Ribs - horrible, had to have been left over.  Was more like beef jerkey than ribs.  I was expecting traditional, comfort food.  Everything was was so dry and bland.  We had such a good experience the first time that we were psyched to go again.  Not sure we'll be back, unless it's just to go to the bar for drinks.  They do have a nice area for cocktails.

sd4E5iKUZotDEeiF3cC81Q.review_text: BIRTHDAY SHOUT OUT TO MY BEAUTIFUL MODEL FRIEND, JEANETTE D. Came here for her 20th birthday. Long story short, it was supposed to be a big group surprise but her boyfriend epic failed and totally brought her there before everyone arrived. Awkwardly said surprise as small groups made their way there... and...... took IG pictures together by the bar area. haha Anyways. Let's begin shall we? ~.:: Atmosphere ::.~ I walked in feeling like the Queen of England. Red carpets and camera flashing from every angle. Ok. Maybe not. But it was still super fancy. There were two big doors as you entered to the reception area. It was dimly lit and I felt like it was a whole Gatsby era kinda of feel. Decor was spot on and super classy. The seats were super comfy as we took over a section of the restaurant with the couches on one side of the table and chairs on the other. ~.:: Food ::.~ First time having soul food I would say. But my roommate is from Louisiana so when he says its pretty good, I choose to believe him. Everything he liked, I shall label it... L APPROVED! (Louisiana approved). 1300 takes the traditional soul food and "dresses it up" and refines it to a super swanky dish. Cornbread: complimentary! There are different types of cornbread and this happens to be a dry crumble of cornbread here. It went really well with the honey butter and the jalapeno jelly. It was a good use of the fruitiness of the jalapeno! I know it sounds super weird, but i promise u it's not spicy. It's really interesting.  Although I personally like the more moist type of cornbread, I understand there's different types of ways its made. Barbecue shrimp n grits $15: an amazing mesh of ground corn slow cooked with barbecued shrimps laid on top. If i was a selfish person, I would have gobbled this whole, but I decided to be a nice friend and shared with everyone! And everyone liked it! L APPROVED! yelp.com/biz_photos/1300… Black skillet roasted catfish $25: Andouille Sausage & Shrimp Jambalaya Cornbread Panzanella Salad under a skillet roasted catfish. A small kick of spice that went pretty well with the jambalaya. The jambalaya was a little bland but the sausage made it better. L APPROVED! yelp.com/biz_photos/1300… Ribeye burger $15: came with House Made BBQ Potato Chips. My yelp friend, Tommy N., had this and said that it was a very tender well cut meat with the tomato sauce, but he wished that it came with more of it because it was so good yet scarce. ~.::Service::.~ Our waitress was amazing. She was sweet and super friendly about everything. We were all a bit late due to traffic but the receptionist was super nice about it when we called her. No attitude from her whatsoever. However, prices were a bit too much for me, so it's a good one time thing to try.

exygIMUwWiMg8HU4L_lNIw.review_text: I'd ideally like to give them 3.5 stars, but I cannot justify 4. The restaurant is quite nicely decorated and gives off a subtle sense of class. I was there for a birthday dinner, and they gave us a private dining room. Service was excellent all around.   The food itself was surprisingly reasonably priced, and only had about 8 items on for the entree which made selection easy. I went with the pork cheeks and my friends got everything from fried chicken to the rib eye steak.  Everybody was satisfied with their meals, but none of it really grabbed me. There is nothing I would go back for. So, overall an excellent experience etc, but the food just wasn't that special.  Excellent cornbread however!

l-zgWG-brcQ4iRev-pfrsg.review_text: Very swank.  Very cool.  The feel of a glamorous old movie set or the hangout of hot jazz musicians and actors of yesteryear.  Fabulous.  We eagerly snatched up the cute triangular cornbread muffins with tiny sides of butter and jelly (this was slathered up in record time).  For apps, the sauteed mushrooms were delicious.  Shrimp hushpuppies were not as expected - light on the shrimp- and a bit uninteresting.    The grilled pork chop with chicory, apples, and cider sauce was simply divine - tender and supremely tasty!  The southern exposed black skillet fried organic chicken with potatoes and gravy was good, but did not live up to it's long ass name (alas, it's hard to beat Firefly's "now that's" fried chicken which is permanently etched in my memory).  Sadly, the chocolate beignets did not satisfy.  They tasted and looked a bit deflated.  Service was friendly and attentive (Folding our napkins nicely every time we left the table.  I got up a few times just to see if they would get tired of folding my napkins for me.)  Overall, great dining experience!

qQa9J0fXA6E-3JSFNsF7TA.review_text: Forget the lounge - you'll wait too long for service - just grab a table in the dining area and grub.  Let's get this out of the way, the food here is amazing. I can eat the cornbread all day, every day. My catfish was fried to perfection and was served over jambalaya. Chef didn't OD on the seasoning, just pure catfish goodness the way it should be. Friend had the beef spare ribs and wow they were sooo tender. We ordered a side of white truffle mac n cheese - it was unlike any other. Grown up mac n cheese is the best way to describe it. The fries were ok - I'd rather walk down the block and get em from McDonalds. The beignets were ok. They were served with this peculiar coffee soda which had the consistency of a really light meringue.
