Service was pretty aweful all three visits.  When we were sat for dinner and had ordered drinks, Vince made a face about how much liquor was in the beverage and the manager actually said, "Oh, nice face!"  Who says that?  Our server was so annoying and a complete idiot.  The other two occasions I was there I had to practically beg for menus and to place an order.  This was in the lounge area and I don't think they staffed for a cocktail server.  The absolute saving grace each time were the freshly made beignets.  They are just the most delicious dessert ever!  GO!  ENJOY!  Hopefully you'll get lucky with a great server...

e7B7IsZlRT8LbFj8FcY78w.review_text: I feel pretty conflicted about this review, because the food was amazing, but the service was horrible.  Anyway, I went for brunch on Sunday with some friends.  After asking for our drink order, I don't think the server came over to us once for the next 30 minutes, so we had to ask someone else if we could order.  Then, although we asked for share plates, only two people got share plates, and we had to ask for our plates as well.  We also had to ask for our check.  I can't even say what our server looked like because I don't think we ever saw him again.  See you later, server!  For that level of service, I could have gotten up and walked into the kitchen to get my meal.    That said, the food was really good.  The scones were delightful and you got 3 different flavors, which was nice.  We also got the fried chicken, mac and cheese, brioche french toast, breakfast fry plate, and duck fat fries.  I would order the fried chicken, french toast, and scones again for sure.    I'll give the restaurant 4 stars for now, and try to go back again to see if they can work it out on the front of the house.  SF has too many good restaurants for them to suck so bad on service, and win a loyal customer.  But I have been thinking about those yummy scones...and I like that this is a family-owned business.  I hope they can work it out, and that my server left mid-meal because he was let go permanently.  That, I would forgive.

Yhg6xrt66dck2JnVCCC2JA.review_text: So I've lived in SF for about 10 years. Heard about this place. Even walked past this place a couple times, but never really considered it until this past weekend. My parents and I were going to a show at Yoshi's next door and wanted to dine in the area. My mom is not that adventurous with food so I knew 1300 would be the ticket. You just can't go wrong with gourmet, southern inspired food.  Speaking of food... OMG! So good. I wanted to the fried chicken but didn't have time [it takes 20-25 min to make], so I got the short ribs on a fluffy cloud of mash potatoes. So good, so tender. My dad got he blackened catfish which is served with jambalaya. Okay so after I tasted this I thought "I should've order that". It was, hands down, the best catfish I've ever eaten. Mom got the special with were the ribs...she said they were good.  GREAT cocktails. We got 3 dirty martinis. Grey Goose and no vermouth.   I'm coming back [as soon as I get my next unemployment check]!

wPfO0bhqtn-20K79nUICTA.review_text: A small group of us decided to check this place out for the first time this past Thursday night. We had reservations at 7:30 and were seated at 8 which was fine because they were nice enough to tell us ahead of time that there might be a slight delay in getting us seated because they were going to be super busy that night.  Once we were seated, our waiter George came over immediately. he introduced himself, told us what the specials were, gave us a few recommendations and took our drink order. When it came time to take our order, he was really honest and on point with how much food to order. We ordered 2 appetizers, the pork belly and the shrimp grits, which were both excellent. Even though we were 5 people, he suggested that we just order 4 entrees since we were doing this family style and so we can save room for dessert. We ordered a full rack or ribs, the short ribs, the salmon and the fried chicken. The ribs and chicken were my favorite. I'm not a big beef eater so I didn't care too much for the short ribs but everyone else seemed to like them. The salmon was so so. We also ordered a side of mac & cheese which was also good.  For dessert, we ordered 2 chocolate chip with ice cream desserts, the banana cream pie and the beignets. I didn't like the beignets too much but it came with a "coffee soda" which was really interesting. It tasted like a carbonated cream pudding. The banana cream pie is a must try!  We also ordered a bunch of cocktails. I personally had the Southern Soul and 2 key lime pies. They were both good but super strong. They were a bit too strong for my taste and ended up with a headache a couple hours later so watch out if you are a light weight like me..lol.  Overall, we had a really good experience mainly due to our great server and of course good food. George was fabulous! He was attentive, honest, funny, patient and extremely helpful. He's definitely one of the best waiters that I've had in a long time!

OeVKfJBN8JGWwbE_xkpyOg.review_text: I was really looking forward to some good southern food especially after experiencing some delicious and authentic cooking in North Carolina, however, sadly, I was very disappointed.  My boyfriend and I shared our anniversary dinner here last night and to both of our dismay, we left feeling disappointed from very oily and bland food.  I ordered the short ribs, which were very tender, but lacked in any flavor and my b/f had the catfish, which was also very plain tasting.  The only saving grace was the jambalaya that it was served under.  The side order of fries also tasted like it soaked up about a gallon of oil.    I would recommend coming here for drinks only, since the drinks we ordered were quite delicious (pear flower, hanger lime gimlet and dirty martini); and the service and decor was lovely, however, definitely not worth the overpriced, bland and oily food.

zqttuCEWI4-l4ZBCbfGk6A.review_text: After receiving a gift card for 1300 on Fillmore, my boyfriend and I put it on our radar for our Christmas dinner. We arrived a bit early and waited at the bar until our table was ready. I was immediately in love with the ambiance -- very old school and swanky with a great cocktail list. We had already taken a peek at the menu before arriving so we definitely had a good idea of what we were leaning towards before we arrived. Our service was great -- our waiter was exceptional: attentive (but not overly so) and definitely gave us some guidance when we were trying to decide between dishes.   We ended up ordering the shrimp & grits along with the mussels to start and both were amazing. Without a doubt, I would order both of those again. Our entrees were great, too. I ordered the blackened catfish with shrimp jambalaya and was definitely happy with my order. In all honesty, I find their starter options to be the real stars. I would love to go back and have a meal of JUST appetizers (that is socially acceptable, right?) with drinks. In fact, there's a good likelihood that that will happen. They also have a gospel brunch on Sundays that might be on my radar for this year! Side note for foursquare users: first check-in gets you 50% off a specialty cocktail.  For ladies who are wondering about attire (I know I always wonder what's appropriate): if you're someone that likes to dress up, you can totally get dressed up if it's a special occasion (or if you're like me and just like getting dolled up sometimes). If you're on the opposite end of the spectrum, you'll fit in just fine wearing dark denim and a cute top!

OY32TwbyMP1z6MIyirm0Yw.review_text: Alamo Square/Western addition is definitely on the ups.  With the addition of 1300 & Yoshi's the neighborhood is really changing.  It's nice to have some nice options on this side of Geary!  My favorite has to be their black skillet Fried Chicken.  I don't know how they make it boneless, but whatever...tasty.  Oh, keep the cornbread coming....honey butter and jalepeno jelly?  Damn, I could come in just to eat that.  Kinda like the chips and salsa at Chevys....mmmmmmmmm Chevys.

4qsVIa8wP0EDk86VogIs1Q.review_text: While I have eaten through most of the appetizer/bar menu at 1300 Fillmore, I finally joined some friends to eat off the dinner menu. Starting with the one appetizer I had not yet tried, we ordered the sweetbread described as "Crispy Sweet Breads "Cast Iron" Corn Bread, Morel Mushroom Cream, Peppercorn Demi-Glace." For $11, this was almost an atrocity; three very small sweetbreads served with two dried morels soaked in cream, atop a hunk of cornbread (which we had ordered anyway). I was just thinking that a few blocks up the street, for $8 at SPQR, I could have an entire plate of several dozen sweetbreads.   Three of us ordered three entres to share: Fulton Valley Farms Organic Black Skillet Fried Chicken with truffle-whipped mashed potatoes and pan gravy. $21  Maple Syrup Slow Braised Beef Short Ribs, Crispy Onion Rings, and Buttermilk Chive Mashed Potatoes. $28  "Smothered Rabbit" Baby Turnips, Parisian Potatoes, Pearl Red Onions, and Rabbit Essence. $26  For starters, there is no difference between the chicken's mashed potatoes and the short rib's mashed potatoes. Or, I should say, if there is any truffle oil/essence in the mashed potatoes served with the chicken, it tasted no different than the "buttermilk chive" mashed potatoes served with the short ribs (which, by the way, seemed to lack any chive that I could see).   The chicken was reasonably good and tender although not as moist as I thought it might be and I desperately wished the pieces had not been de-boned. There is nothing quite so satisfying as gnawing on a great piece of fried chicken with one's hands instead of having to use a fancy-schmancy knife and fork.  For the short ribs, again I was slightly disappointed. The onion rings were slightly limp although nicely flavored with herbs in the batter. The meat from the rib fell obligingly away from the bones but was shockingly dry.  Then there was the rabbit. Here was a sincere chance at greatness for this dish had undoubtedly the best flavor. Enticing and rich, I struggled to discern the ingredients in the sauce. The disappointment, however, was in its minimalism; two meager legs. I could not but help compare it to Aziza's rabbit where you get two legs AND several medallions of sliced loin to enjoy. Here, the red onions complemented the rich sauce and intriguing complexity, but there simply was not enough of it.  Also, in my several visits, I have found the cocktail to be *very* inconsistent. This was the third time I had ordered a Sidecar and on this particular occasion, it was so strong with mediocre cognac as to be undrinkable (all three of us tried it).   We did finish up the evening with a dessert, a gingerbread napolean with quince-apple compote. Between the three of us, we didn't bother finishing the dessert; dry cake stacked with whipped cream, a crispy tuile, and a side of the fruit.   I am very sad about this as my first few visits eating just the bar food was quite good but this recent meal was shockingly disappointing. I'm sure I will go back as I think they are still working with training wheels and hope some of these problems will resolve themselves.

eUmVXP9UnoWtz9NSBwY4jA.review_text: Things that impressed me with our meal at 1300:  -Awesome service from beginning to end. From the hostess to the busboy to our fantastic server, we were treated as though we were dining in a friend's home (although I don't have any friends with houses this nice)  -The menu. Yes, it's a bit pricey (think $12-$15 apps and $20-$30 mains) but everything sounded mouth wateringly good. Yeah, I said wateringly.  -My fried chicken. Oh my Lord, I just died and went to Southern Fried Heaven. Boneless, with an incredible flavor that I'm still salivating over. My brother initially balked at the $23 price tag but I figured if they had the nerve to charge that much for chicken then it probably would be fantastic. As usual, I was right.  -The complimentary warm cornbread with jalapeno chutney, our braised pork belly appetizer and my bro's braised beef short rib were all solid choices. The only let down was the sweet potato gnocchi with crab - the flavor of the crab really overpowered the dish and we could barely taste the sweet potato in the gnocchi.  I will definitely be back to 1300 on Fillmore soon, most likely at brunch so I can see their take on day time Southern fried goodness. Was our meal expensive? Yes. Was it worth every penny? Hell yes.

D5uMny1pAVWhNGDvFDPp8g.review_text: I went in doubtful as to the quality of the food and prices and came away very happy with the meal.  We came here during Dine About Town which seemed to be the case for most of the people there on the grey Monday night we were there.   The design is modern and slick with nods to the past and the same is true of the food. My French spouse commented that all the food was good but rather simple for her tastes and expectations. I on the other hand with family in South Carolina and from New Orleans found the food reminded me of some of the best soul and southern food and for me the food was worth the cost.  The service as other people have mentioned in uneven. The place was only half full and there seemed to be a full service team but there was delays in everything from getting the menu to getting the check. One the other hand our server was very attentive and when we realized my spouse's dirty rice had meat in it she doesn't eat, they brought out a version without the meat.  We started with the grill pear salad which had large grilled pear slices, a very flavourful greens mix and balsamic vinegar. We then had the butternut squash with had a great saffron aroma and flavour.   Our entrees were the catfish with dirty rice and the fried chicken. The catfish was some of the best we've had outside the south and the dirty rice was creamy, rich and filled with chicken livers and sausage and has a broth rich from ham hocks. Unfortunately my spouse doesn't eat red meat so they made her another dirty rice without the red meat. I enjoyed the red meat dirty rice and it was one of the best dishes we had.  I had the fried chicken which was had tender meat, a nice spice mix and a good coating. It wasn't the best fried chicken I've had but probably one of the best in the SF bay. It was served with two biscuits and mash potatoes.  We finished with the apple cobbler with vanilla cream and house made trio of sorbet. The trio of sorbets were great with a pear sorbet that wasn't too sweet. The apple cobbler was served in a deep ramekin filled with tender apples inside and with a flaky crust on top.  There was nothing that didn't taste good and a couple dishes that were great. I would come back here again.

mhF6DY2t2-sy9cU3P4wp-g.review_text: Went here for an work Christmas party. I didn't like a single dish of the several courses. They served nasty mushroom grits, pickled okra salad and salmon that was still cold in the middle. It was like having dinner at a trailer park in Alabama. "You didn't like it?" No that's why it's all still there on the plate, and I haven't eaten anything you've slapped down in front of me yet why are you still surprised?

besF7w4YxEV_K03Gb-0a3w.review_text: The atmosphere in both the restaurant and bar is comfortable and cozy, and the staff is extremely friendly and accommodating - even the chef came out to greet our table! The food was delicious (appetizers, salads, and entrees) and plentiful enough to share across our table of four.  It was a great way to spend time before going to Yoshi's for a show.  Nice twist on classic soul food - a must try is the Feisty Orange cocktail - so good!

mMaWTr59Bl3Po7fEBqwPhg.review_text: We came here to celebrate my bf's birthday. We loved the decor very much. it had a jazzy chicago vibe to it. we loved the bar lounge area and the lit up photos on the wall. We tried the spicy blood orange martini. jazzberry martini (too sweet) and the last word cocktail- great drink. We ordered the fried chicken and short rib. both dishes were soooooo delicious. I would definitely come back here again for the cocktails, ambience, and the food. only constructive criticism i do have to share is our server felt very jaded. he didn't seem happy to be there at all and that definitely affected our dinner. we wished he was more enthused (or got a new job?) other than that, we loved the restaurant.

2XX0A2hNEzM_q5wlrPlv5w.review_text: Came here last Sunday for a friend's birthday brunch with a group of about 10 and loved it. I had a mimosa, scones (with cream and pineapple jam), and the 1300 on Fillmore (scrambled eggs, grits, toast, and choice of bacon or sausage). The eggs were so creamy and yummy!  Also, plusses for the decor (warm and inviting; and the lounge is very swank and has historic touches), and the service (friendly, though maybe our entrees could've come out a bit faster).  I don't know what the usual Sunday crowd situation is, but there were only a few other tables filled, so it was nice to feel unrushed and like we had the run of the place.

bnpWy-sYnUaiycuUrlkm-Q.review_text: Enjoyed the food soul food with a twist.

jTH5nxMl0ri5l8Q3ehVU0g.review_text: I went here on Friday evening and was overwhelmed with the decor and incredible service.  I highly recommend getting to the place early to enjoy the gorgeous lounge for a drink and take in the wonderful photo display of the Fillmore area in years past.  The service was impeccable - including the busing of tables - on target every time.  As for the food, the short ribs, the fried chicken (cumin in it!), and the shrimp hush puppies (app) were incredible.  They also have a gospel brunch on the first Sunday of the month that I must go to.

AGraTma9eEgsiJFDIy6tbg.review_text: We finally came here for the Gospel Sunday brunch, and it was such a joy!  I love the ambiance of this place, so classy cool.  First, the variety of scones they gave us were delish - buttery, some with raisins, yummy yum!  For my brunch, I had the BBQ shrimp & grits, and then I could not resist the idea of bottomless pamosas!  :)  Repeat :)   Love their shrimp and grits!  My friend had the french brioche and a side of bacon (I tried the bacon and it was crispy good!).  The gospel band (sorry, forgot their name) was awesome!  The female singer's voice was naturally gorgeous - she even brought us to tears during one song!  And the male singer was equally naturally talented.  Both had lovely, lovely voices and the band nicely complimented their talents.    I thought their gospel brunch was only the 1st and 3rd Sundays, but as it turns out, it is *every* Sunday - woot!  I'd be back.  There were quite a few people celebrating their birthdays there today - what a great place to celebrate with your friends for this or any special occasion!

qJaBubcxoyYbnnFrieOd6g.review_text: 2.5 Stars for the Food 4 Stars for Atmosphere 3 Stars for Service -------------------------- Overall 3 Star Review  The most disappointing part was the food which was decent, but expected more for the price.  Most disappointing was that our pork chop and pork ribs were dry and overcooked and the mashed potatoes had the overwhelming smell of Lipton Onion Soup Mix.    However, the atmosphere and service were good to excellent bumping this to a 3 star review.  The place is good for group dinners, but if they improved the food this could be a great place.

lTSeLB-TXPPEn6MMbJqPGQ.review_text: Came here during Black History Month.  I got their earlier before our reservation time, so decided to order a few items from their Happy Hour menu. Loved the decor of the lounge area.  The mushroom w/ grits were fab!  Dinner was also good. I had their fried chicken...yum!  I ordered one of their featured wine for the month, a Napa Valley Pinot from Vision Cellars.  OMG....the Pinot was sooo yummy!  I would come back to this place again and try their other items.

ZYgEeE-R_e5VAZhUP5AmQQ.review_text: Soul food meets Californian.   The atmosphere is dimly lit and romantic and great for a date.  The lounge is nice with large comfy chairs and couches.  The drink specials were a steal for $6 made up of Bacardi O, peach schnapps, lime, and orange juice?  that was sweet and had a kick that all went to my head.      The cornbread came out in cute little triangles but was too dry by itself and crumbles easily yet was nice with the complimenting sweet red pepper sauce.  We opened with the 1300 charcuterie appetizer platter made up of chicken liver pate, duck rillette, house cured tasso ham, creole mustard, bread and butter pickles.  The pickles were pickled with a sweet/sour taste, finely cut and crunchy.  The duck rillette and pate had nice savory flavors.  We quickly devoured everything over crostinis.      For the entree, I ordered the surf n turf that was made up of two (2) scallops, over pulled beef short rib over a small mound of mashed sweet potato.  $26.  The entrees took 1.5 hours to arrive which was a longer than expected.  We were late to a show that we almost cancelled our orders, which is when they told us our entrees were being plated in 30 seconds.  I didn't get to taste and linger on the flavors as much as I'd like to normally but found the mashed sweet potatoes yummy and delicately sweet.  Scallops were tender and not over cooked, but slightly greasy.  Pulled beef short ribs were flavorful and tender.  However, I thought this dish that the portions were small for the $.  My friend ordered the black skillet catfish that had a more decent portion with a large fillet of catfish with spices grilled into that was wonderful from the little taste I had.  My other friend ordered the maple syrup slow braised beef short rib that was identical to the short rib that my two scallops rested upon and he ordered a side of greens with ham which he loved and egged us on to try.     The wine list has lots of napa valley wines.  To compliment the meal we ordered a Mount Veeder Cabernet Sauvignon that was a light oaky red.   A cocktail, wine, appetizer, entree and no dessert came to $70/person.   On the pricey side but delicious.  Go here if you can leisurely dine and aren't in a hurry.  We came back after the show unexpectedly for desserts and a glass of wine when my friend was following a hot girl into the bar.   We shared the warm chocolate beignets that were filled with chocolate and came with a chocolate sauce and a coffee soda.  We weren't sure if we suppose to drink the small shot of frothy coffee soda or dip it, so we dipped.  The 3 beignets were light, fluffy and wonderful chocolate goodness, but reminds me of a $9 chocolate boston creme donut.

EiwxlbR8fb68lMgEXhcWKA.review_text: This was sort of a random stop on our way back to SF to drop off my friends from a fun weekend in Napa. We tried to visit State Bird Provisions because they lied on their website and said they reserve a "significant number" of tables for walk ins.  Vile, vile lies.  Anyway, being that it's 2nd choice, we weren't really sure about this spot but their bar menu grabbed us and we decided to give it a try. I am definitely not disappointed! The highlights were the hush puppies and the bar burger. I really liked their take on the fat fries as well despite the fact that they were not cooked in duck fat :(   Their lounge area is extremely nice, I don't know why more people don't take advantage of it. I think it's definitely a great place to meet a first date or a cute little place to hang out with friends!

j0huDycECykRSXpe2i_6_Q.review_text: To start, we got the mac n cheese. I LOVED the mac n cheese here - it just had the perfect level of creaminess mixed with herbs and spices. Some restaurants go overboard and make their mac n cheese too decadent - I thought 1300 fillmore's was just right.  Fried chicken was good, good seasoning, served with yummy, soft biscuits in creamy potatoes. They said allow 20 minutes prep time but we were served our chicken in less than 15 minutes.  For dessert we had the house made chocolate chip cookies with ice cream, because they didn't have the banana cream pie (not a fan of seasonal menus!!). Cookies & ice cream were great - though the cookies, unlike our chicken, took a very long time - almost 30 minutes to prepare - but the menu didn't warn us of this! The espresso I got with dessert was eh - really not up to par.  Dim, sexy, loungy atmosphere - seems like a fun place to get drinks too.   Great service - almost overwhelmingly attentive - but very focused on making sure we were alright.   So overall, 4 stars warranted.

xwy_ojOciOXo1DQyE7Uyng.review_text: I went here with a friend and we had a really good time. This is Southern soul food done fancy and with a California flair - meaning you get your macaroni, fried chicken, catfish, and grits but also expect fresh local ingredients and a French refinement. I am no expert on southern food and thus cannot speak towards its authenticity, but the service was great, the drinks were strong and the food was excellent quality, cooked perfectly, and delicious. The atmosphere and price make it a special occasion/ date night spot.

YsyVYjwV_8vJAjFsBUgVhw.review_text: Sliders and salads and ribs! Oh my!  Lovely ambiance and professional service with a smile. Kick-ass music accompanies your every bite, and the Heritage Wall helps mark the historical import of the stomping grounds on which this lovely lounge/restaurant stands.  The menu is very meaty, but vegetarians should find a couple of salads worthwhile. If I recall, I think there were some Southern-influenced dishes that weren't rendered in bacon fat and then deep fried (the concept of which has forever kept me miles away from Southern cuisine).   For that alone (and actually for all the above), 1300 is a quintessential stop for libations and nibbles.  Full disclosure:  I had already eaten hefty bar snacks at Yoshi's when my friend and I snuck into 1300 with full bellies, just to see what was up. The menu inspired us so much, we ended up with another round of hefty bar snacks that were WAAAY better than what we ate next door.  Gluttony was worthwhile last night! As was 1300!!!  :-)

eFSiluoJXAS4HhXCPwa98A.review_text: The food was delicious!  The Barbecued Shrimp and Grits  for an appetizer and the Skillet Fried Chicken as an entree was perfect! The atmosphere was very cool and festive but you could definitely carry on a conversation and be heard. (Good setting for a small group...and they have a more private room for larger groups).  The only thing that lacked just a little was the service, we had to call our waitress to the table and she did not check in with us to see if we needed anything after our food was served.  We also had to wait longer than expected to get water and for her to take our order.   It wasn't real bad but the quality of the service didn't  match the quality of the food.

rcMW_Kt-uesZxarQQtJM5Q.review_text: I went to the bar to have a couple drinks. The bartender was ok. He was a little too friendly to us, then rude to another lady who sat next to us at the bar.  She was extremely angry, which made us uncomfortable, and he wouldn't admit that he was being rude, so we had to step in to calm her down.  Pretty expensive drinks, but that was expected.    The owner is super nice, the place has good ambiance, great music, so I'd like to try the food sometime.

ZqqDgvz4ZExn5QqF0nyC1Q.review_text: The food is truly outstanding...I've been several times for dinner and also the Gospel Brunch.  My favorite dish is the mushroom grits covered in tuffle oil--insanely rich flavor.  If any complaints, its not the best place for a party of 2--those tables are not in prime locations.  If going there on a date, don't bother with a reservation...find a place in the lounge.  They offer the full menu in the lounge and the room is cozier.

hyPh_BNHpqjv6xTWFVbhMw.review_text: I really wanted to love this place, but my overall experience was just okay..  I liked the look and feel of the place, very swanky. You can dress up or down and feel just as comfortable.  Food was just okay. Aside from dessert, there was nothing that stood out: - Cornbread: Good - Warm Poached Egg Salad: Beware, the blue cheese dressing is extremely strong! It was good (and the portion was big), but just too filling for one person as a starter. I'd recommend sharing this plate if you want to try..  - Sage Butternut Squash-Apple Soup: Once again, pretty large portion. Our waiter described it as a "sweet soup", but it wasn't too sweet. It was good. - Fat Fries: Good, but nothing spectacular - Mac and Cheese: Watery and a little bland. So sad. - Skillet Fried Chicken: Takes 20 minutes to prepare and was not worth the wait. The crust tasted strongly of cumin which none of us really liked. It's boneless and you get a LOT of meat. The chicken was moist, but just not that flavorful. I was so disappointed. The mashed potatoes and biscuits were good though. - Caramelized Apple-Bread Pudding: Best thing we had. Bread pudding was nice and warm and crispy from the caramelization. So good with the vanilla ice cream. Our waiter recommended this and he did not steer wrong!  Service was slow (it took awhile for our waiter to even show up, and then again to come back and take our order), but good when it happened. I think it was because of a large party in the back, but still..  It's not cheap here, but portions are big, so I think you get what you paid for.  If it's between 1300 Fillmore or Pican in Oakland, Pican ALL THE WAY!!!

F01s5dK-Rit8g_SlSkJdTA.review_text: It was my lovely friend's 26th birthday recently, so we picked 1300 on Fillmore as our celebration spot. There were some definite hits, and some definite misses here.  Hits: - Love the decor and ambiance. Very swanky and cool with the pictures of the jazz legends on the walls. - The service was very friendly, especially considering some of our peeps were late. - The fried chicken was GOOOOOOD. I like me some fried chicken and this was really great.  Misses: - You will definitely not get any bang for your buck here. Seriously - my starter salad was like 3 pieces of lettuce and two pieces of blood oranges for $9. - The service, while friendly, was certainly off at times. I got served a salad that was for another table. They took it away, and then when my other peeps got their hot appetizers, I was waiting for my salad. Plus, no one came around to refill our wine glasses. - An argument broke out right next to our table between the staff and a customer. I don't know what it was about, but it certainly didn't add to the ambiance.   Bottom line: if I'm going to spend this much money on dinner, I expect a little more, both in terms of food and service.

GNJwUlODqU_Tr0aYIQ_Nzw.review_text: Imagine my surprise when I was ignored by the waitress who began taking the orders of a couple who arrived 30min, after me. She then proceeds to take a menu from my table while explaining the offering. I informed her that I had arrived long before the couple she was helping. She hesitates as if trying to control herself, before saying that she would be right with me. This was New Years Eve, and I was alone, waiting for friends. Later, I moved to to the bar where I remained waitng for my friends and noticed a distinct chill from an owner and the waitress through out the evening.  My daughter works in the industry and states that lone diners are percieved as low tippers and there is not much money to be made from them. I hope that this was not the case last night. Otherwise, the ambiance was good, the food was good, the music was excellent. My wait service, not so good.

34zD-trIglvacPKZrNl3pw.review_text: Darn it!  I would like to give 1300 4 or 5 stars but my visit last night just will not allow that.  Been there twice and the first time was fantastic.  Top notch.  Last night the service was so horrible that I should probably give it 1 star.  But that food...wow.  It really is delicious.  It took them over an hour to deliver our appetizer and by the time we received it was not what we ordered.  Best part was the waitress admitted that she knew it was not what we ordered.  Interesting approach!  We ended up being late for our show at Yoshi's and only had 15 minutes to eat our appetizer and entree.  But back to the great food - I highly recommend the braised short ribs, fried chicken and bouillabaisse.

kXsE8IF4j7KfkeQrGdN2Jw.review_text: love this place!  have been twice, both for the gospel brunch -- and it has never disappointed!  most recently, we held my grandmother's 77th birthday with a special brunch in her honor. 16 of us and the staff was awesome - kyla helped us with every planning detail!  everyone loved the flavors and ambiance - my dad got the bbq'd shrimp and grits and after tasting it, I have been craving it since. so yum! they are great about keeping the bottomless pomegranate mimosa's flowing -- watch out!

8XwZggy8l9x8lm6mCZFwGA.review_text: Where to begin? I guess first I will say that they had great service. It felt like our server was a close friend who just happened to be serving us food. His recommendations were right on point and there was never a moment in the meal where we had to wonder when someone was going to fill our glasses or clear the plates.   Although I came here with the intention of ordering from the "Dine About Town" menu, I couldn't resist the temptation to try the Shrimp n' Grits our server raved about. He told us that the chef had been attending an event where an app contest was taking place and even though the Shrimp and Grits was not officially an entry, the judges liked it so much it won anyway. This was my first experience with grits and oh.my.god...so good! The dish had so much flavor and a little kick that will make you want to lick the bowl clean!  As for the entree's we ordered the Fried Chicken and the Short Ribs to share. Both were hearty and filling. In the end we were just too full to finish everything so ended up taking a to-go bag which made a tasty lunch the next day.   My Honey Sweet Ice Tea cocktail hit the spot and was the perfect compliment to my meal.  I have been dreaming of the BBQ Shrimp n' Creamy Grits since I left so I am sure I will be back soon!

nvtFXpBauOcS-i0fMxRdIg.review_text: Meh, could have been better... I got the pork chop that I didn't find very flavorful. Jambalaya on the other hand was much better, full of different flavors, and a good portion as well. Beignets were yummy and tasted fresh, too! I really did like this place and wanted to give it 4 stars (inside is dressy and the restaurant has so much culture with a live person playing music on a Saturday evening), but knocking off a star 'cause our waiter could have been a little nicer.

f81Y2EzuRqefayCrL1Ra3Q.review_text: 1300 on Fillmore is a nice place to take a date or have a nice hang out with your friends but overall, they charge a high amount for their food and just isn't authentic soul food.  I got the surf and turf which wasn't bad. The scallop was a little bit on the salty side and it was not as good as I thought it would be. Then the nice flavored beef that they placed on it was delicious. The dish did not have any harmony because the flavors didn't mix in well together. While they were good on their own, I would not want to eat them together but here they are on my dish together.  My friend had the ribs which were... ok. Myep. Just ok. They weren't bad but for what we had to pay for it and ugh. It just was not delectable enough to charge us that price.  Our other friend had the fried chicken. It was pretty good damned chicken. That might've been the only dish that we got the best bang for our buck. I would order the chicken again.  I love the ambiance, I love the drink selection that they offer. Nicely put together. Although a lot of the wines do not come in just a glass and would require you to take down the whole bottle. That would be fine if you didn't drive, it's not that sweet to find parking around the area. The night that we went the parking lot was already full. So be prepared! I would suggest  a taxi to there, get wasted and lie around on the couches and take one back. =)

IjSFfWgKSDfQI-fOrmj_hw.review_text: Went to dinner before a concert last night. When we arrived, we stood at the podium for awhile while the two people (the hosts) were talking about something. Neither one acknowledged us. Once they finally did, the maitre d' tried to seat us at a crappy table right outside the kitchen. We asked for a better table. The maitre d' made a show of having to "go check" even though we had walked past 3 empty tables for 2. He came back and put us at the table in front of the one he had originally planned. It was not the best, but it was better. I guess we looked like we wouldn't be good tippers or something(?). We noticed that they never tried to seat another pair at that crappy table the whole time we were there, which I found interesting.The waiter was ok, but not great.He came and announced the specials and left before we could get any questions out! He was nice enough, but the service felt rushed. Honestly, the busboy (or the person who brings out the bread and stuff) delivered the best service. The food was meh, and overpriced. Won't be coming back. If you're going to have questionable service, the food should be stellar, imo.

fnU-EtUp0G82qySiFpWbQQ.review_text: After my second wonderful visit to 1300 I had to write about this spot. Whether you go for a romantic dinner date, a night out with the girls (or boys), or a drink after a Yoshi's show (a few doors down), this supper club will set the stage for a great evening. There's been live music both times I went, a very friendly staff, great ambience and an amazing menu.  Ambience first: The decor is dark, black and earth-toned and minimalist. Some seating feels very lounge-like and cozy, with big black stuffed chairs around small tables. Most seating offers street views so you get entertainment not only from the live music (old school jazz one night with a four-piece ensemble and fun R&B and Hip Pop covers for NYE) but from passersby.  The food: Oh my lord. Just slap me now! The food is delicious. Soul food meets French haute cuisine. There's a lounge menu, dinner menu and a Sunday gospel brunch menu. Here are a few items from the three to give an idea: Fresh Water Shrimp Hushpuppies; Sautéed Wild Mushrooms with Spring Herbs Mascarpone Yellow Hominy Grits; Black Skillet Roasted Catfish, Andouille Sausage, Shrimp Jambalaya, Cornbread Panzanella Salad; Lemongrass-Ginger House Cured Salmon, Cornmeal Pancake, Molasses Glaze, Chive Crème Fraîche. And I would sell my own mother for the warm chocolate beignets.  The menu is kept fresh by Executive Chef/Owner David Lawrence whom I met New Years. Along with his entire staff, David was friendly and inviting. I felt like a very welcomed guest.

rojUPzLJQgn0g1dizXVxHQ.review_text: I've been here twice now for libations, the second time there was some snacking. And let's just say these people can do Brussels sprouts like crazy. I hate Brussels sprouts. but I could have eaten POUNDS of these Brussels sprouts.   The barbecued shrimp and grits didn't suck either. And I don't usually like grits!   However their "Fat Fries" were a bit of a letdown. In need of salt... or a miracle. They were poorly textured and a bit bland.   Well, enough of that food nonsense. You only need one reason to pop into 1300 and that is the decor. It is beautiful! I've never sat in so comfortable a lounge, surrounded by such great images and beautiful taste. It rings true to the Fillmore's roots and amps it up with a touch of modern class while giving more than a passing nod to the past. There is a wonderful mural of old black and white photos gracing the lounge and a nearly larger than life street shot of Fillmore and Post, circa 1948. The room is warm and luxurious, with soft, stuffed leather furniture and Persian carpets.   The table service in the bar is friendly and prompt, the martinis are pretty wicked and their wine by the glass list is very nice. There is no reason at all to not wander away from the predictable, white bread north-side of Fillmore and step into refreshing experience.

u4VSEV9Mf0LOPwBbuaQPDA.review_text: Nestled in the Fillmore Jazz District, this restaurant consistently delivers great food and fantastic service (las tnight it was Jonathon,,,great job)! The food is French with southern American influence. The put a great spin on standard favorites! The decor is VERY well done with great lighting and a noise-level that makes this a good date spot!

U0E1WmRNLa3_x7U91MczLA.review_text: This is a great date restaurant.  The atmosphere is dark, glamorous, and sexy.  It is clear that a lot of work went into the decor.  The bar area and lounge areas are great places to wait for a table or to eat.  Sitting at the bar makes it feel like a NYC restaurant, classic and urban.  The food here is very rich and unique.  I love the corn bread and butter they bring you in the beginning of the meal.  I could probably get full on that.  The menu offers a variety of meats and seafood with unique executions.  You might have foie gras prepared in a classy soul food style, grits, bourbon braised pork belly.  Even the salads are rich.  Every bite here is flavorful, so coming here is probably a once in a while treat.

c8ODvXT-8EugXo3NLJJyZA.review_text: Love love love this spot! My boyfriend and I go here for drinks pretty often. The bartenders are awesome, as are the drinks (blood orange jalapeno martini is my favorite - spicy and delicious). They have some interesting appetizers that make a great snack with drinks. I've had the chicken sliders with pesto and goat cheese, as well as the mushroom grits and chicken strips with blue cheese fondue. Everything was great. There is live music at night on the weekends in the lounge - really swanky intimate setting. Probably my favorite thing about 1300 is the Sunday brunch. They have a live gospel jazz band playing in the dining area. There is a fee added for the music but if you sit at the bar the fee is waived and you still have a great view of the band. Not to mention a bartender right in front of you to keep filling those bottomless mimosas! The eggs benedict is to die for! The english muffin is really crispy - it really makes the whole meal. Definitely the best eggs benny I've ever had. The prices are a little steep but its worth it. They have some decent happy hour specials as well. I can't say enough good things about this place. Go check it out!!

ior7exTVZ8dxJUkTJAYKEQ.review_text: Love this place!  It's the definition of SWANKY!  A bit on the pricey side, but the fried chicken is to die for!    I'm glad to see such an awesome place open in my neighborhood.  Plus, the owners are quite friendly, and always remember my face and come by and say hello!

3jyJ7VIRuKiZDr6WwAvovg.review_text: 2 Stars!!   I wasn't too impressed. I came here for a friends birthday party. We sat down around 10 pm and left the place at 1. 3 hours wouldn't seem long if we were eating the whole time.    I ordered 3 dishes:   Asparagus soup: Pretty much tasted completely green. I wish it had some other element to it that didn't make it taste like grass.   Some Salad: It was like greens with walnuts and I forgot if it had apples. Anyways, he forgot this dish so I got it at the VERY END of the meal.   Grits and mushrooms: The best dish by far. I love grits and I love mushrooms. This is what gives the restaurant 2 stars.   I did try the fried chicken and that was pretty tasty. I just wish they had remembered my salad and the soup didn't taste like grass. I may come back and give the place another chance.

_5uZ9Ur33MnFvpjeryyKMQ.review_text: The (soggy and poorly flavored) fried chicken and mac & cheese REALLY disappointed me, but the short rib, collared greens, happy hour prices, and just-swanky-enough scene are fantastic enough to cancel them out. (The 'daily special' baby back ribs aren't bad but aren't incredible so it's a wash).   Happy Hour runs from 4:30-7:30 (I love a late HH) with $5 beers, $5 well drinks AND $3 champagne!!!

Ws6zQe4z4BJE5zn8uG1Xuw.review_text: If first impressions are lasting then this place certainly made a lasting impression!  To make a long story short check out this restaurant.  From the Barbecue Shrimp N' Creamy Grits and Bourbon Braised Pork Belly to the fried chicken and braised beef ribs to the Bouillabaisse, Lobster, Scallop, Mussels, Crab meat, Snapper, Andouille Sausage, Rouille.  This was our first visit to 1300 and everything was done right.  We also enjoyed the home made crumble in your hand cornbread paired with the jalapeo spread and honey butter.  My wife mistook a small hunk of butter for cornbread and actually enjoy it!

NLjRAhG_O9odE0qDD_FAYQ.review_text: gorgeous new restaurant in the historic fillmore jazz district. went here on a friday night with a group of 3. no reservations were available, but we decided to chance it. we arrived at 730 and ended up waiting an hour for a table, but time passed quickly hanging out in the amazing lounge.  the decor is sophisticated and glamourous. in the lounge, there is an entire wall covered in photo's showcasing the history of the area. the restaurant features a private room adjacent to the main dining floor, great for dining at a communal table or large group dinners.  as for the food, i like to call it fancy southern food. the fried chicken was the best i've had so far in sf. although there was no bone, it was served w/truffle whipped potatoes and biscuits. the batter was just crispy enough, and the chicken flavorful and and juicy. mac and cheese was so so, but the sweetbread appetizers were definitely interesting. they also had mini lamb burgers at the lounge if you're a fan of lamb.   i'll definitely be back to try the pork chops...or perhaps even a drink at the lounge. do check it out if you're in the area!

mdd9Qm8GnUgYvUtU1uBjAQ.review_text: The blush is off 1300 On Fillmore. A Monday evening dinner had my favorite food, still solid, but something was lacking- maybe the excitement of that amazing fried chicken has faded after having it 3 different times.  Service was not in line with the prices and the MO of the place. I hear November was a rough month for the restaurant, so it's possible staff is not making bank, but it does not explain the attitude of the server, or her agonizing desire to feed us quickly and get us out of there asap (the place was half empty and she only had one more table). She brought the bill with desert, even if we wanted to order coffee (which we did and she had to re-run the bill). The tip definitely reflected our experience...  One more note on service: big pet peeve of mine is when 1 of the table is still eating and the bus boys clean everybody else's plates, making that 1 person feel rushed. Big no no in my book of expensive restaurants.

ti4lRf8rv9KICw6msOJT0w.review_text: sunday night it's not too busy at 1300 on fillmore.  walking in, i immediately wished that i had already eaten and was cruising here to watch the live band jamming while sipping drinks instead of sitting clear across the place waiting to dine.  this is what i though about the food:  ribeye steak - very good, but a bit rich. eating the whole thing was rich beef overload. fried chicken - not too dry and had hints of indian food spices that i can't put my finger on, interesting. catfish & risotto - deeelish! i was surprised, it was very good. fried okra - very yum shrimp & grits - not bad not great. mac & cheese - i liked it a lot, my friends not so much  bonus note - the server said that the pork chop was just a regular pork chop that can be mimicked anywhere, she suggested trying items that are more signature to 1300.

_O7NFOcGXo3tA1gx1dxlEw.review_text: 1300 is elegant, sophisticated, and a nice spot for a quick bite and a drink before heading next door to enjoy jazz at Yoshi's. Plus, 50% off happy hour if you come before 7 makes your night out a bit more wallet friendly.

d_42gNWdfFBXHHX5zNPgYQ.review_text: This restaurant was simply amazing! They were offering smoked ribs, that were some of the best smoked ribs that I ever had! They were paired with jalapeño Mac and Cheese that was so good I asked for more! The ambiance was nice and the drinks were good too. This is a must if you are in SFO!

bLLpAJ5ia_Bq170E0jZdOQ.review_text: Went here for a quick drink after the ROOTS show one weekend.   If you're looking for a classy lounge to impress a date, then 1300 Fillmore is the place for you.   Nice leather sofas.  Friendly, well dressed staff.  And a magnificent tribute wall detailing the history of jazz.   The drinks were well made and reasonably priced.   1300 Fillmore is the perfect venue to take a date if you actually want to have a conversation and not be drowned out by crowd noise or a bad dj.

zAFS5GwqdQH9ZlwgL5ywAQ.review_text: Oh my goodness, oh my goodness.  Butter and cheese and grits after Thanksgiving.  Pure gluttony.  It's my sh*t.  The description of upscale soul food was a little off-putting for me.  Talk about a contradiction, right?  I thought, real soul-food = down-home (like Brenda's).  Wrong.  Such a great combination and they pull it off seamlessly.  The decor is as lovely and as upscale as the food.  I can't even describe how sinfully scrumptious those grits + wild mushrooms were.  So sophisticated.  They fell a little flat when I asked for a vegetarian entree.  I really threw them off.  They wanted to do a risotto with veggies.  What?  More starch?  OK, since that was the case, I opted for...hmmm...more GRITS!  With veggies on top, of course.   Not the most creative but I certainly appreciated the effort.    Add all of that to the fact that the owner came out to check on us and recommended some fab desserts.  Personally, I'd take the beignets sans the coffee soda ice cream.    ***Last thing.  This one's for the ladies:***   Put your makeup on and dress to impress.  A certain male celebrity was in the house and all the women (and men)  were drooling!  Apparently it's a regular occurrence.

PE-zyoVy_gADgoW1O0piqA.review_text: Yuuuuum! From the cornbread to the mushroom grits to the char with lobster hash. This place is delicious. Plus, it's got a great atmosphere -- sophisticated but not stuffy. You can actually have a conversation without raising your voice even a little bit. I loved the bar and lounge area -- a great place for afterwork drinks. Next time you'll find me in the bar with a big plate of the fries and homemade ketchup.

-VZ1WHE9EVr45FclgnAhpQ.review_text: Excellent service and ambiance.  The food was delicious, the short ribs literally fell off of the bone and were beyond tender and full of flavor.  The specialty mixed drinks were perfect and well worth the price.

Syt_iQqW_c9T2_lrvsddqQ.review_text: Uber yelper Gregor G. and me spent his OpenTable points at 1300 On Fillmore. Nice! Thank you G.G. and O.T.!  The room is warm and welcoming, and so are the staff. The atmosphere is elegant-ish but not stuffy in the least. And the food is really, really good. If I can have grits gone classy for dinner, I am happy. Seared foie gras was excellent and I also had a lovely salad, perfectly dressed.   1300 turned out to be a wonderful place to celebrate a couple o'belated birthdays. We will be back!

1g_ajkmxzivqpY8E9s9sgQ.review_text: Their catfish sandwich was pretty legit.

sZCLIvqhKPXZimcpey5p7g.review_text: Hubby and I came here for Valentine's Day and we fell in love (hee hee). We ordered a wild mushroom and polenta appetizer, the fat fries, the fried chicken, the short ribs, and the apple bread pudding for dessert. We also had a great bottle of Chardonnay.  All of the food was delicious and, at least the fried chicken portion was really large.  The service was a little lacking when we first got seated- it took our wait staff quite some time to greet us. Once we ordered, however, the service was excellent. Also, the restaurant was fairly full, yet it didn't seem that loud inside.  We were also fortunate to meet the chef and owner on our way out. Overall, it was a fabulous experience!

0E3zMPX6TWMUJ1NKkJNNBA.review_text: My girlfriends and I came here this past Thurs for DAT (knowing that it wasn't offered Fri-Sun).  At first glance we were a bit disappointed with the selection choices.  In the end I ended up ordering off the DAT menu.  The other 3 ordered a-la-carte from the regular menu.  I had the squash soup, fried chicken & apple dessert.  Everything was tasty, but nothing wowed me.  Except the cornbread.  I couldn't put it down.  I may have been too stuffed with cornbread to enjoy the actual entree as I took half of it home.  They served a hefty 3 piece chicken portion. Mixed drinks were on the sweet side.   I would give our waiter 5 stars.  We would have liked to have seen the short ribs on the DAT menu.

yW5ajGtDmMAujfld63J-eQ.review_text: My girlfriends & I came here on friday evening for Dine About Town, or what we thought was Dine About Town.  We had made the reservation on opentable and when we arrived we were told they only do it from Sun-Thurs.  That was fine, but we had to have the most uncomfortable conversation with the manager about what we could "afford."  We are by no means cheap girls but when you show up for something and its unavailable you get a bad taste in your mouth.  We ordered hush puppies for appetizers which turned out to be shrimp?  In what world are hushpuppies shrimp?  Whatever, they were still friend and good.  I had the fried chicken which was pretty tasty.  Best part was the cornbread.    Anyway, I won't be back - the whole evening left me with a weird taste in my mouth.  And its in the ghetto, the hostess suggested I not walk to the left side of the restaurant for safety reasons.

rpqKQErEs36haM0ccKcI9g.review_text: "Upscale soul food" is how this place was described to me by a friend.  Sure enough it is!  A nice dinner setting, this place has a relaxing atmosphere, accompanied by live jazz on select nights.  The hospitality matched the comfortable décor.  Our waiter was very attentive to our table, keeping our glasses full.  I ordered the "Fulton Valley Farms Organic Black Skillet Fried Chicken, Truffle Whipped Potatoes and Pan Gravy" which was recommended by our waiter.  Two thumbs up from me, there wasn't a single dry bite!  The menu is a bit pricey but it's worth every penny.

9_dHJM9z0Pn_4W8v6u4fSg.review_text: I give 4 stars on just their shrimp and grits ALONE.  You MUST love garlic though. It was delish! I ended up with the pork porterhouse cooked down in molasses topped with brussel sprout slaw- it was delicious and the portions are huge. The corn bread that they give you is delicious as well. I got the violet fog drink as well and it was good too. My friend got the fried chicken and even the breast meat was moist. I thought the mashed potatoes with the fried chicken was okay at best. The only thing I would complain about is that the service was SO good that they took the food away before I was even done with it! I had good 2 heaping spoonfuls of shrimp and grits left and the guy took it away before I could even say anything. Also when the guys were taking out our food (which I had more than 1/2 on my plate and more than a 1/3 on my friend's plate) He was going to just take it, didn't ask if we needed a box, so I had to stop him and ask him to box it up.  I don't know, it's like they wanted us to eat really fast or not take food out either. I mean, it was empty that night we were there, we for sure didn't have to get a reservation.  Besides the crazy great service that might have been too good, the food and drinks were all excellent! The prices weren't terrible either. I'd come again if I were in the area.  The lounge area is very cute too!

BSTWz28R2Ir_xcTNfwbeTg.review_text: A few gfs and I came to 1300 On Fillmore for a girl's night dinner on a Thursday night. The place was not too crowded and the service was excellent! The hostess had originally seated us at a table that was a bit small and close to the door and we asked if they could move us to a booth in the back. The hostess was very accommodating and very sweet.   The food was very good as well! We ordered the catfish, fried chicken, pork cheeks, and the surf and turf (scallops and braised pork). We also ordered a side of mac n cheese to share. The fried chicken had a lot of flavor. The seasoning on the skin was really good. I didn't try the biscuits that came with it, but my friends said that they were delicious as well. The pork cheeks were also amazing! The scallops on the surf n turf were seared perfectly and tasted very fresh as well. The braised pork was good, but nothing really special. I didn't try the catfish, so I can't comment on that. The mac n cheese was AMAZING! Probably one of the best mac n cheese's I've tried in the city (and trust me, I've tried a lot!). It had a very southern style to it and had a little kick of spiciness to it. It melts in your mouth!   For dessert, we decided to all split the Beignets, which is their housemade, donut-like dessert that comes with a whipped espresso and chocolate sauce. The dessert actually only comes with 3 beignets and the 4 of us were going to split it, but our server was so sweet and made sure that they gave us 4 of them! And it was a good thing he did because these were really yummy! The donuts had chocolate inside as well, and the whipped espresso was the perfect accompaniment.   All in all, we had a great dinner. They had some really good dishes. The service was excellent, the prices weren't too bad, the ambiance was cozy and fun. I will definitely come back!

QpXRM_xjge-oKNcL1MkvrQ.review_text: Fried chicken was not crispy.    Seasoning was good, but for $23, my fried chicken should be crispy.  If I'm eating something deep fried, the calories are only worth it if the chicken's crispy.   Blackened catfish was bland.  The risotto was delicious, with the generous liver and sausage, but BLAND moist fish.  Would I come back here for food?  Nope.  However, the ambiance was delightful.  I'd certainly come back here for drinks and people watching, love the decor.

1a2gkKWKeqQKFMik5X3fEA.review_text: Came here for dinner with the husband. The space is cool, but we weren't  impressed with the overall experience.  We started by sharing the Barbecue Shrimp N' Creamy Grits -- probably the best thing we ate all night. He ordered the special of the night: Baby Back Ribs -- they had a dry rub, a couple BBQ dipping sauces on the side along with a teeny serving of the mac and cheese. I ordered the Black Skillet Fried Chicken -- kudos for being boneless and not having to use my hands. Then we ended our meal with the Warm Chocolate Beignets, Chocolate Sauce, Coffee Soda (close #2 to the grits) -- the beignets were warm and had chocolate inside them as well as a dipping sauce but I could've done without the coffee soda. It was just strange.  After our meal, our waitress asked if I wanted my fried chicken bagged to go since I barely ate half so I said yes. When we were walking back to our car, I had remembered that she never came back with my leftovers. Lame, but I wasn't about to walk back in the pouring rain to ask for them when they were probably already in the compost pile.  I'm glad I tried the place but I don't think I'll be back.

1OHEdx9m-Qp9xrT4JE24eQ.review_text: Made a 1p Sun as-advertised BRUNCH reservation for 2 using OpenTable. Arrived at 5 min to 1. Was told they are still setting up the dining room. "Please wait inside, and I'll call your name." "Inside where?" With incredulity and that oh puhleez look, "There's a lounge (every table was taken with people eating) and a bar (every stool taken by people eating)." Found a railing in the bar to lean on. Ear-splitting noise from 20-somethings, just way too hilarious for themselves and piercing volume trapped in the glass cage which surrounds the bar. After 15 min., a party of 2 left, we could comfortably get to the bar and order a drink to wait. No Ramos Fizzes, because no egg whites (No. 3 brunch cocktail). Bellini (actually listed on the menu!) but no peach puree for them (!?). "Thanks anyway". After 25 min., with no further contact from the hostess,  bye bye.

PtTZf3VF_JwSKf-rkhuvRA.review_text: 4.5 Stars.    This place is wonderful! Beautiful decor, lovely service and super yummy food. It is great for large groups as well as intimate dinner parties (if your party is fairly large, ask for the private room). I used to live in the Fillmore/O'Farrell complex, and it's great to see how the neighborhood has changed within the last few years.   Like everyone else, we fell in love with the cornbread (which comes with honey butter and jalapeno jelly). The jelly was great - I've never tasted jalapenos in a jelly form (probably bc I hate jalapenos to begin with - but as a jelly, it was very tasty).   Appetizers - our group ordered a variety of them. The gnocchi looked good (but very rich). BF and I ordered the fried green tomatos w/fried goat cheese - can you say caloric overload (that's probably an accurate way to describe the entire meal, actually). Very tasty, yummy...this is about the point where I started to get full.   Entrees - yes, the fried chicken was amazing and well worth the 20 minute prep time. I'm normally not a fan of fried chicken, but I couldn't stop eating it off my bf's plate! I ordered the maple syrup-braised short rib, which came with mashed potatoes, greens and onion rings....unbelievably tasty and flavorful.   The service was really great - from the hostess to our waiter to the bus boy, everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. Overall, our entire group really enjoyed our dining experience - we just felt like super fat lard-os when we left!

K1NLdTfT1IizE-6smhsSug.review_text: I have to agree with my bf's review below...the best food I've had in ages!  Absolutely delicious and mouthwatering!  From the martinis with blue cheese stuffed olives to the fried yumminess of the chicken.  Give it up to Mark the Sous Chef and his entire team!!!!!  :)  I will be back here over and over again.  I love the energy of the place and it just draws you in once you walk through the doors.  Love you!!!

Y2iLLq02CUVfKHsowQ4wXw.review_text: The service and decor is really nice. But seems kind of out of place in lower Fillmore. And I know it's next to Yoshi's and all, but it definitely seemed too pretentious to be down there - I think it would be more appropriate sitting on Union Square next to Farrallon and Morton's. Just my two cents.  And the food was good - actually, the shrimp and grits were AWESOME - but the rest was just too over-the-top. I know they're trying to do a cool, hip take on some soul food - but take notes from Front Porch and Farmer Brown... you can't try too hard. What I mean is, you can't put (overly)truffled mashed potatoes with fried chicken. Keep it real, peeps, keep it real.

K0zrsXqu55JPwT4dnvNUDg.review_text: When you walk up to the outside of the place, you're already going to expect something that will be classy and special.  and what do you know, the inside looks great.  some lounging area to the left and a good size bar to the left as well.  i just have to say, the place looks great.  whoever did this, surely was able to get that fillmore jazzy vibe that it was going for.    but ONTO the food so me and my friend ordered wine.  I had the oakville Cab and she had the merlot, both really good, and not bad for the price.  I was pleased wth my Cab since it was good in flavor and alcohol.  wine by the glass went around $8 to like $12.    the appetizer we chose after reading many yelpers here was the pork belly.  I must say i was a bit dissapointed as people kept raving about it.  They oyster bisque caught my eye first but then just following the crowd, i went for the belly.  it was a lil bit too saly and the texture wasn't a melt in your mouth feeling.  to me it just seemed like eating a really good piece of bbq pork from the chinese markets.  however, the presentation and mashed chestnut or iono whatever it was that it was sitting on drenched in some sauce.  but overall, not a bad pick.  I'm sure they'll shape up on that dish.  For the main course, i had a hard time choosing.  with the fried chicken in my mind, i ended up picking this and saving the chicken for next time.  so for me the seafood bouillabaisse and my friend had the sea bass.    the sea bass was very flavorful and had a nice crisp skin with a tender meat inside.  my bouillabaisse was at first glance, somethin both appetizing to the eye and the mouth.  the pink/orange broth that all the seafood was soaked in looked so damn good.  it came with a crispy toasted bread that was really good with the broth.  everything in there was gerat, the lobster, the giant scallop, tender pieces of fish, and crab.    and the dessert?  the sweet potato soufle was really unique and actualy good.  i had my doubts in the beginning but it turned out somethin that was worth trying.  iono if i'll get it again, but everyone who comes to 1300 should at least try this.  we also got the chocalate bouigets which was kinda like a pastry with choco sauce and coffee to drench it in.  i didn't quite like it. i thought the pasty could have been more fluffier or crispier but instead, it was heavy, it didn't soak up the sauces very well and didn't quite do it for me.    but overall, the food was good.  they did say they weren't officially opened yet so i'll take this as a trial run and something for them to work on.  come next time, when they are fully staffed and opened, i'll hopefully have a great dinner.    oh and the service was great.  iono if its the excitement, but they all are just really helpful and made sure you had what you needed.  i ordered extra bread for the seafood.  they might as well automatically do it since that broth is so so GOOOD.

Qrza-_Tu6MCBYZ4B1M06pQ.review_text: Um HELLO, crazy crazy yummy.  Shrimp hushpuppies?  Who knew that my foul mood last night could be curbed by fried shrimp?   Stopped in here with a friend and found ample space in the bar for a nice dinner.  We shared the shrimp hushpuppies, arugula salad and the beef short ribs.  People, do not pass go, go directly to this restaurant and have the short ribs, they are CRAZY CRAZY good.  Coming on the heals of an amazing yoga class, I was already on the path to happiness.  The short ribs sealed the deal.   The ambiance was truely beautiful with large lanterns gracing the ceilings and the lights turned down just about right.  I like eating in the semi-dark, it's more SEXY.    We concluded our meal of "uplifting Claire's spirits" with a banana cream pie.  SERIOUSLY.  I do not have a sweet tooth, but this pie was off the charts.  When I do have cravings, it always seems to be for bananas.  Chocolate covered bananas, banana milk shakes, bananas and peanut butter.  Maybe it's because I"M BANANAS?  I'll leave that one to be determined at a later date.....

_j4vcT9O2IysokQXoZhjGA.review_text: This place is GORGEOUS. Definitely a dressy little gem in the Fillmore, so put on something classy and appropriate. It's a perfect spot to grab a few cocktails with friends, or even enjoy a lovely dinner. The atmosphere is very calming and warms the soul. Plus, you're in a beautiful neighborhood and you can stroll around and enjoy the sights of the best city on the planet.

1JdAL6t5un5afI-aAFDBsQ.review_text: The best damn fried chicken in town, point blank. I'm not sure what they are doing with that chicken, however when it comes out on my plate its crispy brown on the outside and juicy on the inside.   This place reminds me of what San Francisco USED to be like. When you could go out and see beautiful people old and young, enjoy themselves, eating drinking and making merry.   We took my Mom for Mother's Day Brunch and they even had live jazz.  They also make a perfect sidecar for those chilly San Francisco Nights.

798S7vLIQRye3GZMa6iLMA.review_text: The food was awesome.  I think it was a great fusion of different cuisines.  However, I give this place 4 stars for one reason.  Service was not great.  Dear servers, you are not doing us a big favor by serving us.  Lose the attitude.  Thanks. :)

8nzU_lPdNzZrbLyBW1t2TQ.review_text: I hate to say this.... I recently went with a large group of people and the front desk reception messed up our table reservation. The restaurant was packed and we had to wait for an hour to be seated. The manager remedy the table reservation mix up by serving us some 'odevours as we waited. That was really nice considering the hostess was extremely rude. I think the mix up was the hostess fault.  The food is very overpriced. We waited a long time for our food. I ordered the salmon and it was good but pretty bland. Where is the Cajun spices or Cayenne pepper. Where's the heat? I ordered a side order of mac and cheese and it was disgusting. It was extremely greasy and lacked taste. I could not finish it.  I was really disappointed in general with the food. I love Soul Food. I was raised on it. My advise to the owner is to concentrate more on the food versus the decor. The food will keep people coming back.   I could have made my own dinner at home and saved the money and time.

615wKV_aQVAII2NdC7ey6A.review_text: Pluses:  Easy parking in the building; good service; sophisticated atmosphere, live music in the bar on some nights; good -- but not great-- food  Minuses: $12 flat rate for parking (I'll do the math for you...$6/hour for a typical 2-hour dinner), can be unbearably loud; if you are known for your fried chicken, it should be much better

IwDgHBKnSRv2yDl1_uUnlQ.review_text: After visiting this restaurant, I finally started to believe that San Francisco does have a legitimate food scene (I was starting to have my doubts).  Everything was spot on - food, service and wine all were excellent.  There were four of us and we were all gaga over the experience.  1300 wins my vote for best modern take on southern soul food - I can't wait to go back!

ItlNc0Ac2Mf8FzQShnXRYg.review_text: Whoa mama.....1300 on Fillmore is awesome. Lovely, sleek decor with floor to ceiling windows and long drapery to subtly hide the hustle & bustle of the city streets. The lights were dimmed just right, giving the perfect mood of what was yet to come.   Our server (George) was extremely friendly and helpful on advising what his faves on the menu were. We took his advise and started with the Bourbon Braised Pork Belly. I've read on past Yelp reviews that this is a winner. Man, they weren't lying! Literally......5 layers of absolute heaven melting in my mouth. Fat, meat, fat, meat.......definitely not for the faint of heart. But sooooo to-die-for!  Next, for our entrees. I had the Fried Chicken with truffle whipped potatoes. To be honest, I could see why others would enjoy this dish. It was crispy on the outside and moist on the inside but the all over flavor wasn't there for me. HOWEVER, my boyfriend's Beef Short Ribs were "fall-off-the-bone" good. OMG! I give that dish 5 stars alone. It was so delicious. No need for a knife, the meat simply feathered off with his fork. Mmmm.....i will definitely get my own plate of ribs next time.  Our eyes were much bigger than our stomaches. Cuz i'm not done. We also ordered 2 sides. The mac & cheese and greens to add to our  Thanksgiving-like dinner. The collard greens soaked in the sweetness of the carmelized onions. That was good. The mac & cheese....ehh blah, but I guess we are used to that good ol' traditional mac & cheese, not kicked up with different spices.  Last but not least. They had beignets on the dessert menu.....a must-have in my book. Nothing will be as great as the real thing in New Orleans but their Chocolate Beignets with coffee soda and chocolate sauce was super rich and sinful.   My recap: 1300 on Fillmore is a great place for all occassions. Post-work cocktails, a dinner date, or just out with some friends. You MUST go if you haven't already....go go go!

vtLoC7_iIpl1nUmxVp_gzg.review_text: How an evening should be spent!  As we indulged in a few cocktails prior to dinner, we admired the "Heritage Wall" in the main foyer.  The decorations in 1300 make you feel like you have stepped back in time to a place that carries a great feeling of mystique and elegance.  Now onto the food and drink... The drinks are varied (except for the beers on tap) with many mixtures that are featured with distinct flavors and personalities from the south.  Check out the drink menu to understand the personality.  The food was delish.  Quite simply a spectacular evening, but I will warn you it was difficult to decide... We had the surf and turf with scallops, fois gras, braised pork ribs, Fried chicken and rack of ribs. Side of mac and cheese is a must because it again rewrites the book on how they are generally prepared.    Now the beignets for dessert were splendid, but the cappucino sauce was a little much as they were already stuffed with chocolate with additional chocolate on the side... watch out diabetics!  Tip: Dress to impress, many local celebs appear frequently.  A former mayor was sitting directly behind us.

PxK1UxCPlmJn81CYhVUi3Q.review_text: Awesome.  The food, ambiance, service, all top quality.  The crowd is a nice racial mix.  It's nice to go somewhere that's black owned and operated and it's white tablecloth, and not those laminated tablecloths.  The service was very friendly but not pushy, just plain pleasant and attentive as it should be.  We had the shrimp hushpuppies and crabcake to start - I loved them both, hubby thought the crabcake was a bit overwhelmed with spice.  He had a cosmopolitan and said it was perfect.  I had a glass of champagne which I loved. We got the bill and were puzzled, until we realized it was not just champagne, but $15 glass of Dom.  hmm, the waiter could have said that a bit louder and I would have passed... but I'm glad I didn't.  For dinner I had the lovely and succulent boullaibase, hubby had the blackened sea bass.  We were both very pleased with our choices.  For dessert, we couldn't justfy 2 desserts, so I gave up my choice of warm molten chocolate cake for hubbys choice of banana cream pie with caramel sauce.  The maitre D thought it very lady-like of me to sacrifice my first choice for hubby's, so they comp'd me the choc. cake since it was my b-day. aww, they are just too sweet. Anyway, both desserts were amazing.  Sorry they didnt have live music as I was expecting, turns out thats on Sun. and Mon. nite.  Will have to go back for that experience.  Love this place!

UDrVdIeUNnmBT3__dJchCw.review_text: WOW. I am so sad it has taken me this long to discover 1300 Fillmore. Hands down the best southern food I've had in the Bay Area. (my favorite food is fried chicken so trust me, I've tried a lot.)  The food: 5 stars. Service: 4 stars (great waiter, but weirdly speedy.. ie: we received our appetizer a mere 3 minutes after we ordered it..)  We ordered the shrimp and grits to start which were delicious and flavorful. Even if you're not a huge shrimp person like me, I recommend them.  For our mains, we shared the fried chicken and the shortrib. While the shortrib was fabulously tender and delicious (I'd definitely get it again), we both liked the fried chicken better. First of all, it was boneless which makes it so much easier to eat! Secondly, it was perfectly seasoned and crispy with just the right ratio of chicken and skin. Being the fried chicken aficionado I am, this chicken comes with my highest recommendation. I am also a HUGE fan of biscuits and let me just say, this was one of the BEST BISCUITS I've ever had. You won't do wrong with this entree.  Finally, we ended with the banana cream pie for dessert and it was de-light-ful. Although the service was eerily speedy for a Saturday night in a fine-ish dining establishment, the amazing food will have us back without a doubt.  TRY 1300 FILLMORE!!!

wivIgjB2If8lsWDrKuchcg.review_text: Really lovely holiday lunch here for our department at Gap HQ.  We had the place to ourselves thanks to the generosity of the owners and were prepared a prix fixe menu that included choices between buttery rib-eye steak and boneless fried chicken- both delicious- and came with either salad, which was so much more than the usual half-assed starter, or hush puppies.  The cornbread was warm and crumbly.  Prior to sitting down servers walked around with trays of amazing appetizers that really did whet the appetite, and we ordered coffee and drinks from the open bar.  Even the coffee was good.  I don't remember what dessert was, oddly, but I do remember that I ate mine and someone else's as well.  The service was impeccable and the owners were warm, polite and approachable while giving us space to enjoy ourselves.  The interior is warm and well-furnished, and they are able to use partitions and curtains to gracefully block out parts of the large room.  We didn't get to enjoy any of the live jazz promised but I will certainly go back here for dinner to try it out.

N67UV9tXgKEqFINl1P2kQg.review_text: My boyfriend and I arrived quite early for our reservation, so we sat in some of the comfy chairs in the lounge to enjoy a cocktail. He ordered some citrus-y spicy martini thing and I got the holiday highball with pear puree. I was tentative about my beverage choice, but our waitress didn't hesitate to offer a replacement if necessary. Ultimately, we liked each other's drink so much, we switched, but I thought it was a classy touch to offer to switch.   The band was starting to play in the lounge when the rest of our party arrived and our reservation was ready. Despite a live band in the next room, the dining room was a comfortable noise level and great for conversation. We started with the sweet potato gnocchi, which had a nice kick and came with olives and bell peppers. The corn bread was a bit dry (I admit I abstained from butter) and would have been nicer had it been warm, but I liked that it fit with the culinary soul food theme. I ordered the short ribs, which were excellent and so tender that I was compelled to try them the next week at Salt House just to compare the experience (1300 wins, but I'll leave the details to my Salt House). My boyfriend had the char, which was nice, but probably the least exciting dish. My friend had the fried chicken, which was scandalously good. We had brussels sprouts on the side, which were really tasty. I think we skipped dessert because we were so full, but found the low-calorie cheesecake option amusing after such a decadent meal.   Net, net: Classy place with delicious food that sticks to the theme. Would do it again with enthusiasm.

gdTAebkameev_DQq_NCZzw.review_text: Overall food and service was just ok.  Came here with the bf for Xmas eve dinner.  First I must say the phone service did not set a good vibe for the rest of my dinner...my bf and I were stuck on the freeway and I was thinking I should call the restaurant to let them know we may be running late. I call and someone picks up asking if it's ok I can hold. I say ok and I'm placed on hold. Not very long after I hear a click and I suppose they hung up on me. I call again this time no one says a word to me and it just sounds like I've been butt dialed as I just here the chatter among waiters. I continue to say hello hoping they realize that they picked up a call and need to respond but nope they hang up on me again. I call again and this time someone picks up and asks if I can hold. I say no because you hung up on me twice already. The person on the phone doesn't apologize for anything and proceeds to say ok how can I help you?
