Even the fat fries are tasty. The Lamb burgers are just the right size to nosh between drinks. The drinks are also good... not wimpy... well worth their price and made with fine spirits. I enjoy the sorbet n petite fours dessert.  it is a great way to end your experience on a heavenly note.   I will be going here for as long as they keep their doors open.   I have taken to hanging out in the lounge area where we sit and drink plenty of cocktails and taste yummy dishes while we talk the night away. It is a very inviting environment... a lot more than the place next door that I just don't think I will ever go back to... unless... well... there is GOOD reason.   The decor makes me wish I could have experienced first hand what it was like back in the good old jazz days of Fillmore... it is cozy, warm, inviting... the waitstaff is great too... the facilities are splendid... and you can always see the head chef and owner along with his partner and wife cruising the floor and saying hello to their guests. I seriously can't say enough as to how excited  I am that they exist... Just can't get enough. This is one upscale place I am not going to complain about paying for. I know... it is friend chicken... but see... this ambiance and service... I am willing to pay for.

Nl4FMNlqtbZ42p8BgGd2pw.review_text: **BEST... Sunday brunch in San Francisco**  Amazing food, delicious mimosas, and great music!  My new favorite Sunday brunch spot in the city!   Everything earned 5 stars!  Service, food, ambiance, drinks, entertainment and overall experience were all above and beyond expectations.  I recommend requesting a table further away from the band as it can be pretty loud if you are near the speakers but the performance is really great!    Their eggs benedict inspired me to learn how to make hollandaise and was so delicious that I had to recreate the recipe so I can make it at home.  Served on a biscuit and topped with a tabasco hollandaise, the dish was definitely the favorite of the morning, although all others were delicious as well.  I had the french toast which was nothing super spectacular but still quite tasty.  They served a basket of biscuits, scones and cornbread with honey butter and pepper jelly which we devoured.  I could have just eaten those and skipped the main meal!  Very yummy.  Throw in some bottomless pomegranate mimosas and you have the recipe for an extraordinary brunch experience.

Jq6fiCRKhVmqqptxLAPnGQ.review_text: My cousin and I had our 40th birthday party at this place and I cannot say enough how much fun we had.  Great band, great food, friends and family!   The best part of the night is when they brought out the birthday cake and the band sung happy birthday for us.  The cherry on top was the design of the cake which was a Oakland Raider helmet!  Raider cake in the middle of SF, too cool!!!  In your face 49er fans!!!

dB11NQfvGM-cv-05YV_SGQ.review_text: Upscale soul food? 1300 is the spot! There's a lot to be appreciated in the Fillmore when it comes to music, culture and food. A group of friends and I dined here for dinner on a weekend. The decor is very sheik and they have a nice bar. The ambiance also gives off that jazz vibe and you know you're in for a good experience.   The dishes get high marks for presentation. Everything looked great. I ordered the BBQ shrimp and grits to start. It was flavorful. For my entree, I went with the steak. It was a little more pink than what I had ordered but OK. We shared several desserts including the chocolate beignets and chocolate chip cookies with ice cream. The beignets were a little greasy for me and tasted a little burnt.   1300 is definitely a nice romantic date place but you can also come with a group of friends. The service is accommodating and attentive.

XeOGjshZq7xHEE195TbZJA.review_text: You can take the Girl outta Texas, but you can't take the Texas outta the girl! I grew up eating fried chicken, grits and biscuits, so I know my southern food. I was in charge of picking the restaurant for our post new year's dinner with some out of town guests. I was really excited to try this place since having their delicious shrimp n' grits at the Fillmore Festival. I will have to say I absolutely love the decor, it's cozy and filled with unpretentious style...but that's where it stops.  They should be ashamed to call themselves southern comfort food, because true "Southern Comfort" comes with "Southern Hospitality" and that they did NOT have, the host was rude, slow and he let us wait 45 min in the bar area while 1/2 the restaurant was empty tables. They were "closing down half the restaurant" WTH is that? Never in my entire dining experience have I ever heard of that when. When there are guests waiting, seat them. PERIOD!   There was also an empty table in the "front room", that sat empty, just looking at us. So we asked the host why we couldn't sit there...then he says oh, we can try to "squeeze you" on that table, turns out there was plenty of room!! Idiot! What?!! So we you mean we were waiting at the bar for no reason?   Onto the food part. The host comes over and says, "management was notified of the problem and will be sending out appetizers on the house." So some redemption there...but just wait...it goes downhill from there. They comped us the Fat Fries spiced with a little cinnamon and nutmeg were good, but anything would've been good since we were starving by then! Then mini pulled pork sliders...ehh, they were just ok...I've made better at home with my All Clad Crockpot!   The Special of the Day: Baby Back Ribs....mmm a Texas girl can't resist ribs...we ordered a full rack for the table to eat as appies...uh BOMB or should I say BOMBED...the ribs were extremely dry and lackluster in flavor. Resisted the temptation to ask for an entire jar of BBQ sauce to give the ribs some flavor...  The flavoring of the Grits was on point, though a little cold and cold grits are ick! Makes you feel like you are eating cold butter. They should use those hot clay pots to keep them warm.  Fried chicken was just mediocre...dry and a little overdone. Not greasy which was good, but a little too over-fried and hard...I cut the roof of my mouth from the rock hard batter. Whoever said the fried chicken was the best in town here, has absolutely no clue about fried chicken (but then again we are in California). I much prefer town halls fried chicken. Biscuits were delish however, they got that one right. Blackened Catfish was pretty good, Braised Short Rib was slightly bland, it was a bit flavorless without the sauce. Chive mashed potatoes were really good. Mac and cheese didn't have that cheesy oomph. The Coleslaw was good, different and more mustardy than I've had. I'd have to say that the Brussels sprouts were really good, even though I forgot to ask to add bacon (for an additional $1.50)  And to add insult to injury, they charged us for the comps!!! They apologized and immediately took it off. The waiter said "Sorry, it slipped my mind." Is this some kind of joke?  1.5 Stars

ErexzgZF08rZCT9y-qlQ6Q.review_text: An amazing experience, we had a wonderful time, love the southern atmosphere! The corn cakes they serve as bread are warm and a little sweet, just perfect! The Barbecue Shrimp N' Creamy Grits were good but not amazing. The entrees were way better: Black Skillet Roasted Catfish and Maple Syrup Slow Braised Beef Short Rib, lots of flavors! Both dishes were really well prepared! You have to try the Strawberry Rhubarb Cobbler!

k502b-DfHQMEU-XST5jTow.review_text: We were at 1300 on Saturday night, sat at the bar, music was flowing from the lounge area. We tried the Matchsticks Okra, Deviled eggs with chicken liver mousse, watermelon feta salad and hushpuppies. All delicious. Thank you 1300 for a great meal.

RsmzkgQ6S9ghtKb2DGX0Mw.review_text: The soul food that didn't away my soul. I am stealing this quote from a friend that ate with me at 1300 on Fillmore. There are definitely cheaper and better places to have southern food in SF. Make sure you have your whole party there. They will not seat you until your ENTIRE party is there. The highlight of the meal was the bbq shrimp with grits. I had one bite of it and was excited for the rest of the meal. I guess I got excited too early. Sad Face. We also got the fry seafood starter..crisp but nothing out of the ordinary. The catfish was flaky. The mac and cheese with truffle oil was too overpowering with truffle. I guess they really wanted to give you the best bang for your buck. The fried chicken that so many people raved about was just eh. I would have to say usually service doesn't really matter to me until tonight. The service was so slow and we needed to ask multiple people for items. I would have to say the food was alright but the service made it less appealing. I am glad we had a discount from Blackboard. It definitely made the experience better.

qQfnpFfenSM1HZasUvgugA.review_text: Went here on Christmas Eve for a 6:00 reservation and the restaurant was about 1/2 full.  The service was great and the food was delicious.  We had both types of grits to start and we were off to a great start.  The BBQ Shrimp and Grits had large chunks of garlic in it and the Grits with Mushrooms had lots of fungus in it.  BBQ baby back ribs was the evening's special so we had that along with the fried chicken.  I couldn't dine here more than once a month because it was so filling.  The corn bread was a hit as well.  No room for dessert, but I'll have to try a few things next time.  I heard a lot about their fried chicken, but I can't say it's the best.  It's boneless, juicy and flavorful, but maybe my expectations were too high after hearing too many people rave about it.

0dBFo7b1OYL9BMjvSaigsw.review_text: Loved the dark décor and vibe! Our group was very pleased with their dinner choices. I had the Maple Syrup Braised Beef Short Ribs, they were lip smacking good! We couldn't get enough of the White Truffle Macaroni N' Cheese- gluttonous guiltiness!   I'd definitely would come back for dinner or a drink and some jazz.

EbY06gT5bi8zpErl1_W1Kw.review_text: It's such a great atmosphere! I was a little disappointed this last time I went. The service was off and so was the food. Hopefully they can get that spark back!

fjl6GgR1G2SbqK8yEEjs1w.review_text: I'm only giving this place 3 stars because the food really is delicious! But it deserves none because we had a reservation and did not get our table for over an hour!  That said, the service is ridiculous!! The prices are high, and the drinks are slow in arriving.   We had a reservation for 8:45 p.m., party of 10. Two of our guests arrived before 8:45 to secure our table as we  made our way through the city with our birthday girl.   We arrived at 8:56 to be told by a rude and tasteless hostess that we should "go over there and wait." Over 30 minutes of standing around goes by when I grab the man in charge of the reservation and make my way up to her to find out what is going on, only to be told that our table had been given away because she "didn't know what to do."  She proceeded to tell us that we were very late for our reservation so she gave our table away because she didn't know what to do. She lectured us saying we should have called, despite the fact that 2 people from our party were standing in front of her at 8:30 telling her we were on our way! She should have saved our table or more reasonably given it to our early party members! We weren't even 10 minutes late.   We asked to speak to a manager 4 times. He never showed up. The waiter was ok, he was SLOW as molasses in the wintertime! The drinks were slower...and the manager, well he came out, stared over the crowd (it was very crowded and HOT), and never showed up to talk to us!  Finally our bill came many hours later (we closed the place), we held our bill hostage until we were given a manager. The owner showed up. Our bill was $370+ so I guess she assumed she should collect.   She asked us if we were doing ok, and we said "yeah sort of, the food was good." We proceeded to tell her the problems we had, people decided not to come because of the hostess, etc. My bestfriend (birthday girl) had to deal with stupid hostess-girl's drama because she was rude and unprofessional to us. And all the owner does is comp us a shitty $6 cookie that no one ordered! (it was a birthday thing, and it really sucked).   All in all, the food is good. Here's how it went down:  Salads: they suck! they're not worth the prices so SKIP  Entrees:  The chicken is pretty bomb, fried and good, which it should be for $23.  The pork chops: dry and just so so Beef Rib: good, not dry due to sauce, tender  Drinks: Decent, pricey, take too long to arrive  Dessert:  Don't bother you've already been robbed.  Last note: owner is a money grubbing tight ass who does not care about her patrons and hasn't the sense to hire respectable people to deal with her high paying costumers. Although she boasts about her desire to make it feel comfortable and intimate, "a place where people are happy and feel like they're family,"  sadly, people feel like it is a hot, loud, expensive drama-fest.

UlV9wTYkUKlQBVE534V07g.review_text: We were very excited about hitting this place before the 10pm Yoshi's show last night...ordered two bottles of pricey wine...a couple of appetizers...and entrees.  The food was terrific, but it took almost an hour and a half for us to get our appetizers!  We had to flag down the manager to find out what was going...he ended up taking them off our bill but they brought the WRONG dish!  We told our waitress and she looked at us with cow eyes and said "yeah, I noticed that" and did absolutely nothing.  Unfortunately when you pay that much for dinner, you expect to have great food (which we did) AND great service (which was horrible).

tL0RL-FgATE2xvcrv7uxCQ.review_text: Probably the best meal I've had since I moved to San Francisco.

2ILxSblUWx4q02E2H_e9YQ.review_text: We went for the Monday night prix fixe menu consisting of soup or salad, fried chicken, biscuits and mash potatoes, and apple cobbler and ice cream for dessert -- all for $28.  That's a lot of food!  So my girlfriend and I ended up splitting the meal.  Though the food is good, it makes you not want to eat for the rest of the week, because it is sooooo rich.   Yeah, I know, no one forced me to order fried chicken with mash potatoes and biscuits... But even the soup put me over -- it was cream based with a ton of oil drizzled in :(     It would be great to have soul food served up somewhat lite.  Is that possible??  Light fried chicken and mash?  The ambience is great -- they had live jazz playing in the bar area, and the service was very warm and professional.    So if you're into eating healthy or attempting to be a slim, mean, fighting machine, this is not the place for you.  Otherwise, if you don't give a dam, 1300 on Fillmore might just hit the spot.

ytxm744qKpJ04EK3EF7prw.review_text: When I hop on the 1 California after my swing shift in the Fi-Di, I always smile when I say 'hi' to the driver-- he has such a hep look to him: goatee, beret, glasses!  He makes me think of how the Fillmore District used to be, back in the day.  There's a restaurant that brings up the same nostalgia- 1300 On Fillmore!  I dig it.  The atmosphere is Old School, Old Frisco for sure.  Nice music, cool lighting, a nice space, and a nice diversity of people who are serving!  I love the homage it pays to the old Fillmore District.  The food: really nice.  The shrimp hush puppies were just fabulous for appetizers, along with the bar-b-que shrimp and creamy grits. Creamy gritssssss! The cornbread with pepper jelly was addictive.  You can't go wrong with a braised short rib, which I loved, but I truly savored the greens and buttermilk mashed potatoes that were the base of the dish.  Loving it.  Beignets and peach cobbler for dessert!  Yum.  The only disappointment for me was the fried chicken.  I thought it was just so-so, but everything else was stellar. (4 and a half stars!!!!!)

RKz1AsNHHqr4LLCZlQ8cBw.review_text: Came here for my birthday a few days ago and it's a Beautiful restaurant, romantic atmosphere and really delicious food. I had the catfish and truffle Mac and cheese and it was heavenly. There was a rude hostess, and I felt a little, patronized. Thats the only way to describe how I felt. She spoke to me as if she were talking to a troublesome teenager or something. She honestly could have had a serious case of chronic bitch-face or just have had a bad day, I guess I could understand that but she just came off very snooty. But everything was beautiful and I highly recommend trying it out!

VS2UhdMT4zFx4c_wUClDzg.review_text: AMAZING! Chef David had come to my law firm for Black History Month presentation and brought along a spectacular spread. I fell in love with it and vowed to come and visit his restaurant. Yum Yum Yum! Took our family of 9 here for Father's day brunch. Loved the decor of the place. Very cool and contemporary. Live music played from 11:30-12:30pm. Service was spot on.  I was a little hesitant to bring my 3 kids (2 yr old twins, 6 yr old) but it worked out. I didn't expect them to have high chairs... They did. Exactly two, and one was in use! AGH!   The Black Skillet Fried Chicken was so moist and flavorful, served with mash potatoes and gravy. My husband and dad had the french toast and both said it was the best. The twins devoured the corn bread and sweet butter. The Eggs Benedict was also a hit. Mimosa - off the hook.   Parking garage right next door.   Will definitely come back for dinner when I have an adults day out.  Couldn't help to check out the lounge and bar area. Very swanky!

tWcRTr3HAsBG3iWYKA34JA.review_text: Food and coffee were excellent. Grits and shrimp were amazing. Service was horrible. Sever was unavailable and uninterested.

PcN-zHKC1ubqnaZqpOn5pg.review_text: I stumbled upon this place the other week during an art walk. I had appetizers and some wine here, and it was a great experience! I was very pleased. The live music was incredible, server was very knowledgeable both about the ingredients in the food and the wines, the food tasted delicious and the service and price was right, not to mention the ambiance. The restaurant is big but not loud. Highly recommended.

CNng7eZLx_MLsCGXH3lm_g.review_text: My parents and I met for an early dinner at 1300 Fillmore last night and it was their first time dining there. Our meals were delicious - superb and tasty, especially the fried chicken - incredible! The wait staff was very attentive, organized and professional. Loved the ambiance of the place and we left n a perfect mood to take in the 8pm show at Yoshis  - strongly recommend this restaurant for dining in the Fillmore!

lJ6S1pWAUBvl8VIpjsIxlA.review_text: We've never had a bad plate here. Not even a weak one. Stellar fried chicken. Fish is always fresh, delicious and perfectly cooked.  Desserts are always devastatingly good. Great for special occasions, brunch, drinks, it is one of the gems of the Fillmore. Truly a solid dining destination with excellent service. Specialty cocktails, top shelf, artisan, beer, wine, drinkees down and dirty as well. The wine list is thoughtful and pulls from California and special vintages from a bit of everywhere not a huge list but very solid.  It's just south of par with Wayfare Tavern. Not the same experience and not the hot gastropub, but you can get a table here without financing your meal and stiffs cluttering up the bar. Lively and elegant with a pulse and a beat.

rR_5neGv4_2-IL7EUqE7DA.review_text: Note: The review is for Happy Hour, not dinner.   I LOVE the atmosphere at this place. Whenever I want a comfy place to have a drink and actually hear what people around me are saying, I go here. I get my sidecar, I am happy.

NzZhNmGLrdlRcFEOf7DLVQ.review_text: had the pear flower cocktail! ahhmazing:) and the key lime pie cocktail literally taste like a freaking key lime pie! yumm:)

CeiULUiNMiNWr0dND4WlmA.review_text: So, I thought this place was really yummy, but didn't get 5 stars because of a couple of misses. First of all, our server was wonderful and attentive and even dealt well with an annoying member of our party who wanted to know where every ingredient came from.  We ordered a few appetizers: the pork belly was awesome!! The mushrooms and grits were wonderful. However, the mac and cheese was really bland and flavorless and the hush puppies were so-so.  It is these two items that prevent me from giving this place 5 starts.  Every other entree we tried was good. I personally ordered the sea bass and it was very good (small portion). The fried chicken was really good (large portion) and the ribs were really good.    Check this place out..worth the money.

d3cUg6ChwwXh4ABRTKa7yg.review_text: HORRIBLE service.  I have seen DMV employees work faster than our waiter.  He turned our dinner into a 3 hour event even though the place was not even crowded.  Other than that, the atmosphere was very pleasing, but the food was just ok.  I have had much better short ribs elsewhere. Since we were in a group, I also got to try the burger, ribs, and fried chicken.  They were decent, but I would not justify paying their prices for any of those entrees.  Maybe if the service wasn't so bad.  Not going back...

ybnJoXphDsVeg299y5A3hQ.review_text: Okay I clearly did not know what I was getting myself into because I felt quite undressed and not classy enough for this joint! Anyways, I was meeting a group of my friends here for a Sunday Gospel brunch. Parking isn't too bad if you go over to Webster, there is plenty of 2 hour residential parking there.  We hung out for a bit in their lounge chairs while waiting for the rest of our friends and admiring the decor and art in the place. It felt like a very sophisticated, yet not stuffy atmosphere.  I got myself the biscuits and sausage gravy with eggs. Mmmmm so good and so rich. The eggs were heavenly and the gravy and biscuits were incredible. I wish they had salt at the table though, I wanted a dash more salt.  Since bottomless pomosas (champagne and Pama pomegranate liquor with a splash of juice), were $12, and the normal mimosas were $9, I figured, hey, get the bottomless and drink two, and you've made it back! The pomosas were pretty tasty. Our server kept refilling it so fast I couldn't really track how much I drank, so I stopped somewhere around 2.5 as I had to drive back.  I tried a bit of my friend's french toast, and it was very good as well.  My friend tempted me into getting the cashew cinnamon rolls, and even managed to tempt the rest of the table after I was tempted. They were really good! Warm, sweet, cinnamon-y, with a bit of crunch, what else do you want?  Service was excellent, putting up with my rapidly changing demands.  The total was came out to be about $27 a person before tip. So a bit pricey but very good. Tip bumps it up to above $31.  I'm taking the rating down from a 5 to a 4.5 because the music, even if very good, was just too damn loud and we couldn't hear each other talk. The lady singing was quite good, even if she pulled off annoying if very impressive stunts like holding a really high note for a really long time.

EU_n27blS-VJaIsCJEDj5w.review_text: I've only been here for drinks so haven't gotten the opportunity to try the food, but it has a great ambiance.  Really nice inside & kind of on the swanky side.  Bartenders were attentive & we got our drinks quickly.  Didn't LOVE the drinks- they were just okay,  but it's definitely a nice spot.  We were lucky enough to catch the live music for that evening, which upped the atmosphere even more.

xtZMctl7AQNspIL_SF3guA.review_text: After hearing all of the hype surrounding 1300 on Fillmore, we decided to give it a try since it is within walking distance of our apartment. To start, the new Yoshi's and this restaurant have really classed up the surrounding blocks, which depending on your perspective, could be a good or bad thing. As for 1300 itself, we found the interior to be very warm and inviting with the rich chocolate brown hues, and cozy seating. The food itself was great - I'd highly recommend both the fried chicken and short ribs, and the wine list had a nice mix of varietals and some good by-the-glass options.   That being said, things fell apart in the service department. We had an 8pm reservation and weren't seated until 8:50pm due to a mistake on the part of the hostess. Luckily my wife and I are fairly laid back people and found our way to the bar to enjoy a pre-dinner glass of wine, but we found the wait (and more importantly, the reason for the wait) entirely unacceptable for a restaurant of this caliber. We barely even got an apology, which was pretty lame as well. Once we were seated, it look us until 9:30 to be served the appetizers we ordered, and the waiter was a bit scatter-brained, although certainly a very nice fellow. All in all, we had an enjoyable evening, but I would hesitate to go back due to the lackluster service. There are too many other restaurants in San Francisco that serve equally delicious food and don't drop the ball   on the service.

msHUlHTw9NlsYgwDm1k8sA.review_text: Though I really love the ambiance and the atmosphere, the live music playing was great.....but the food sad to say a major disappointment.  Fried Chicken was dry and barely warm Short Ribs were tough and very chewy Scallops were alright Shrimp and grits were the only ok thing the whole table said was ok.   Will not be coming back for dinner/lunch service but enjoyed the atmosphere that I will come for a drink at the bar/lounge area

joOaVsEifxHUmzYwrZWqBg.review_text: I wish I could give it 3.5, and not have to round it off!   Anyways, the ambiance was good and the service was pleasant. The address was sweet and made good conversation which is always a plus.  We ordered 4 items: Shrimp and grits - simply delicious. Fried chicken - good but not great. Cat fish - good but not great Pecan pie - the pie was alright but the Orange-chocolate sauce was delicious. The best was their corn bread.. it was, by far, the best I've ever had.

DKmUukETiMVidu548TE-zw.review_text: 1300 on Fillmore has a gorgeous decor, with sleek chocolate-toned walls and furniture and lavender chiffon drapes around the windows.  The lounge area by the door has cool historic pictures that I assume has something to do with the history of Jazz in SF.  For a second, you forget you are at a brand new restaurant and thought you stand in a historic mansion that turned into a local museum.  There is also a private room on the side with glass sliding doors, intimate but not completely cut off from the rest of the restaurant.    This is probably one of the best-looking restaurant I have been to.    The food has its ups and downs.  To thoroughly confuse our poor waitress, one friend had an appetizer and an entree, I had two appetizers, another friend had just an entree and the fourth friend had an entree and a side.   Despite the claim that the famous fried chicken takes 20 minutes, it came out promptly along with everyone else' entrees.  What a delight.    I had pork belly and gnocchi with dungeness crab.  The pork belly was well cooked with good texture, but was a bit bland for my taste.  The gnocchi was soaked in delicious creamy crab soup, however I didn't like the gnocchi themselves.  They were mushy and not very chewy.    The fried chicken was really good.  Very tender and well spiced (not your average KFC).  The mushroom appetizer was alright.  Two other friends had ribs and pork chop.  They both claimed to have liked the dishes.  The side of greens was pretty spicy!  Not for wussies like me.   For dessert, four of us shared a Peach Cobbler, which was delicious.  Very fragrant, very peachy.    Plus some cocktails, the bill was about $200 after tips and taxes for four.  And oh yeah, this is one of the many restaurants that DO charge a 4% surplus for Employee Healthcare.  Much like the skyrocketing gas price, I don't even bat an eye anymore.  It has officially joined the rest of the daily nuisances that you learn to live with in San Francisco.  MUNI will always be shitty, SF real estate will always be out of reach, and restaurants are gonna charge you that 4%.   Don't forget to reserve early---a dinner on Thursday was practically impossible to book.

rgAZ-3ebghnnL_2qhaQ6oQ.review_text: Celebrated my dad's 50th Bday at 1300 on Fillmore back in August and was so pleased with the food, I went back to work on Monday and raved about it to coworkers. The best way I can describe the food is fancy southern/ soul food. I ordered the fried chicken and was surprised at how large a serving it was! Favorites of the night included the shrimp grits and the peach cobbler. The peach cobbler was still warm! They also have beignets, but didn't get to try them, I was too full!  All in all, 1300 was a great place to celebrate my dad's 1/2 century mark.

kZJWAY828P8QZTqVYzhTCg.review_text: Hi-lights:  -- sexy lounge, leather armchairs, moody ambiance -- sweet & syrupy shirley temple  -- appetizers of boiled peanuts (I thought this was only a Filipino thing!) & shrimp & grits  -- fall-off-the-bone baby back ribs   Low-lights:  -- thick triangles of overly dense & gritty corn bread  -- 1 star for desserts. Beignets were hard & flavorless, but carbonated espresso dipping sauce (interesting, right?!) was so good. Banana creme pie-- the individual parts of this elegantly-stacked dessert did not meld well with one another.  -- black skillet fried chicken: would not accommodate my white meat only request. Also skin is left on underneath the crispy batter...off putting for someone like me who does not eat chicken skin.  -- 1 star for wait staff: our waiter took forever to take our order, long pauses between courses. The Indian busser who did check on us was such a sourpuss; He looked so pissed off when we asked for an extra knife (which btw, besides drink refills, was the *only* thing we asked for.)   My group is usually super forgiving of any service missteps b/c we realize being a waiter/busser is damn hard work, but the neglect was too blatant to dismiss here. Half our items were decent & the other half was flavorless, so I don't feel I'd be missing out if I never came back to try other menu items.

nNzbFCq1fpFL4Mp9VZGQuQ.review_text: One star for the look of the place. If it wasn't for the rudeness I received on the phone I would spend my money here. What a waste

BMZhUSiHCkKpvkjbNQwM9w.review_text: This place is incredible! We had the shrimp in grits, shrimp hushpuppies, fried chicken, beef short ribs and the banana cream pie. All of the dishes were amazing, the wine list was phenomenal, and the service was impeccable.    Holy crizap this place is good!  I highly recommend 1300.

zRcJofpMlRBV-Y-2duNWeg.review_text: This review is long overdue. I had my wedding reception at 1300 and it was AMAZING. I highly recommend this place for special events. The evening was so perfect that I would not change a thing about it.  We had a 7 course meal (I can't remember bc I only ate half of them) and the courses I ate were DELICIOUS. We were told by almost all of our guests that we had the best wedding food ever. The staff were very attentive, and the bartender kept the drinks flowing. A few guests enjoyed the open bar too much and dropped their drinks on the dance floor. The staff were very responsive and rushed to clean up everything immediately. We didn't put a lot of effort into decorating (just centerpieces and tea lights) as 1300 is already a beautiful setting.   Best wedding reception EVER. Thank you 1300!!!

9E1t_oJjgWh5m19tLMXulg.review_text: My best friend and myself had dinner here on a Friday night.  First off, the entrance door itself illustrated the amazing ambiance you are about to enter.  Who would have thought, delicious, finger licking, soul food served at an exquisite restaurant?   I sure didn't.  Not only did everyone make you feel special in this place, but the food is definitely delish!  I mean, we went from the appetizer to the desert and everything was gone off of our plates.  And yes....the cornbread with the hot and sweet chili jelly....omg...heaven!  After dinner, you can go to the bar room and enjoy the beautiful display of historic photos.  Seriously....you really just feel like you are somewhere else.  I felt good entering this restaurant and even better leaving it.  Definitely worth it! :)

BKdMoAaI_H2dA9O9kP5C-Q.review_text: Sat at the bar and had the Fried Chicken (excellent) and the deep fried okra (good).    My sense from looking around was that the kitchen has it together and that everything on the menu is pretty good.  Why only 3 stars?   The service was professional but not particularly friendly.   Judging from a few of the other reviews it sounds like I'm not alone.  Kind of felt like I was surrounded by patrons who are friends of the owners and staff.    Would I come back?  I suppose so if I was going to check out a show at Yoshi's next door.   Wouldn't make a special trip here.

NpFvjy3AHPDNfqwtmYFzmQ.review_text: The Porkchop.  Please get it.  It was delicious and perfectly cooked.    Scallops were good. Ribs were alright (not fall off the bone).  The beignets were pretty good-would have went better with ice cream than chocolate dipping sauce.    Nice date ambiance.

SdnzjV4RiV4P9HeUbjQaNg.review_text: Customer Service: awful. Literally every single time I have been here they have forgotten my pie. The first time they had forgotten it, they spent a half hour making it from scratch or something. The wait time is terrible.

PABIXXEx_6ykhF7I6_Fu-A.review_text: Went here with a few girlfriends to celebrate a belated birthday. The waitstaff was top notch, but the food seemed a bit lackluster and bland. We ordered the shrimp with grits, gnocchi, fried green tomato salad, and the shrimp hush puppies....of those, the only outstanding one of the bunch was the BBQ shrimp and grits. G.R.I.T.S like myself (girl raised in the south) know a good soul food dish and this was delicious.  The entrees of the braised short rib and fried chicken left me a bit disappointed. I've had better fried chicken at Hard Knox or Farmer Brown and I wasn't a fan of the latter. The sides were only ok...white cheddar mac and cheese and fat fries. Not worth the caloric intake. I had to salt everything, which is not something i normally do.  The dessert was less than memorable. If Happy Birthday wasn't scrawled on the plate I would have said the mudpie was perhaps the least impressive part of the meal.  Food aside for a moment, the decor was spot on and the wine list has a few gems. We ordered a great Rose and Roussanne for under $40 apiece. Hooray!  **Corkage is $15**

8Niv7tzWuhrJseLtPdg-hw.review_text: ORDER THE SHORT RIBS.  I love this restaurant. The place is decorated with jazzy artwork,  the servers are friendly, the food is sooooo good....  ORDER THE SHORT RIBS.  What I love most about it though was the overall atmosphere. This restaurant is next door to Yoshi's, steps away from Popeye's, and in the center of the Jazz District of SF. How could you not expect some gooood ass food?  ORDER THE SHORT RIBS.

ZO0LU4unvbD7p32aTDQiIA.review_text: I loved everything about this place. The decor and atmosphere was really nice.  Our server John H was awesome...very accommodating, quick, and friendly.   BF and I shared shrimp hush puppies, slow braised short ribs w/ mash potatoes, mac n cheese, and apple bread pudding.  Everything was delicious!!  The complimentary corn bread was awesome too!  BF claims I was making moaning noises during the meal from the food:)  We'll def be coming back for another romantic date.

CGRkejdGiNtvX-lhcOFUZQ.review_text: My best friend and I were craving something sweet after watching a show at Yoshi's, so we stumbled upon 1300 on Fillmore. Not bad... a typical candlelit dinner type of place.   I do, for sure, can say that the banana creme pie was amazing!!! Possibly one of the best I've ever had. And I'm pretty picky about my pies.   It gets really loud in here, though... so I'm not sure how you'd expect to have a romantic dinner here. Service was a bit slow, too... Nothing too special, in my opinion. We also got tea, but nothing too special -- just Mighty Tea Leaf that was way overpriced =(

a-CtXGkmHkaaXSvnOLFxOg.review_text: Cornbread. Crusty, pan-fried cornbread. Crusty, pan-fried cornbread served with sweet cream butter and jalapeño jelly.  This is how 1300 on Fillmore takes a homey classic and amps it up to the Nth degree.  Yes I have already reviewed this restaurant, but I just have to update my review after going there for my two year anniversary with my BF.  I had the fried chicken again, which is still in every way worth the splurge.  It comes with delicious mashed potatoes and two buttery, cheesy biscuits - think "Cheddar Bay Biscuits" with class ;)  This time, instead of wine I tried a pear cocktail - that was a GREAT decision - it was smooth, minty, and fruity without being too sweet.  Cocktails and live Jazz are always a fantastic combination.  For dessert we decided to share an apple bread pudding with ice cream, and to our surprise, the waitress brought it out with a candle and plate scrawled with the words "Happy Anniversary" in chocolate.  The amazing thing is, neither of us had requested this - we didn't even mention our anniversary except when making the reservations.  What kind of restaurant makes your night *that* special, just on a whim? No other than 1300 on Fillmore.  *Highly Recommended!*

-l0VLqH6lvXEdFDbGTclSA.review_text: I stopped in here before a show at the Fillmore; I have to say i was impressed. We were in the lounge and had drinks and had food off the bar menu.  All around it was top notch. I had the lamb sliders and the banana cream pie dessert.  Great place for a date or an impressive business dinner.

pO6mu_37HMNGZlyzWBwZ7g.review_text: I'm a fan of Front Porch and Farmer Brown, and 1300 Fillmore is a step above both in terms of food and experience.  The pros:  The mac n' cheese with Gouda and tarragon - the girls all loved it but the boys weren't thrilled.  Think there is an opportunity for a more scientific study of this phenomenon.  The crispy sweetbreads are a great way to try sweetbreads.  And the shrimp and grits were deelish.  Our fantastic waiter contributed to the experience (one enhancer was encouraging Fernet as an digestif.)  The sommelier played pop culture trivia games with us - it's not at all a stuffy experience.  And the cocktail list is great - recommend the French 75 champagne cocktail (with gin and lemon juice.)  AND - boneless fried chicken.  The cons:  Feels like a hotel bar.  The beignets weren't great.    Check it out.  It's even better on an expense account.

5D6qZHR1a2wa3JCQ8xf79A.review_text: Absolutely wonderful and a gem of a restaurant. We have been here twice now and will definitely be back. This is upscale-soul food; comfort food like fried chicken prepared with a little sophistication in a swanky atmosphere. Ella Fitzgerald should be serenading you tableside!  I had the short ribs on my first visit and the fried chicken when I returned and they were great. The gf had the ribs and enjoyed them too. This restaurant is WAY too good for the neighborhood and this is definitely one to try!

Nza9TrumxVALFOc3zpPxDg.review_text: Oh happpy daaaay.  Twas Eva Diva's twenty sexy and the girls decided to go to the Gospel Brunch here at 1300 on Fillmore. Upon arrival, we were immediately soaking in our setting -- the fancy but laid back decor and the live music really made it quite an experience.   My personal favorite part of the meal had to be the complimentary corn bread and the different flavored scones. I probably would've been satisfied just eating those. All of us decided to go for the salmon on the pancake dish with the cajun shrimp grits as a starter. Let me start by saying, the shrimp grits was bomb! I wish I had ordered an order just for myself.  Here's where the ball was dropped. When the waiter came out, he had 4 salmon dishes and one salad. Well nobody ordered the salad! The waiter was initially on his way to argue to tell us that someone ordered the salad but eventually caved in and  decided to make us another dish. At this point, Eva decided to go with the catfish po boy (much better than the salmon dish IMO). The thing that I didn't like about the salmon dish was that it was literally smoked salmon with a bit of garnish sitting on an unsweetened pancake. If I know that it was just smoked salmon, I most definitely would've opted for another dish.  Well, you live and learn. Either way, I liked the look and feel of the gospel brunch and the food really isn't too bad. I'll be back but best believe I will not order the salmon dish again.

kXIUxpoZKXPlbSsNYAP3cg.review_text: um.  yes.  yes. yes. - shrimp & grits (i think one of us licked the spoon) - broiled char with lobster reduction (i'd never heard of this sustainable fish that looks and tastes just like salmon, but i was very pleased) Please see: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ar… - beignets with chocolate and coffee soda (thank you Dad for letting me try yours!) - cornbread with honey butter - beautiful decor - coat/hat check - very nice waitress from montana (you were great!) deliciousness.  period. cons: - the noise level was very high (but i'm very glad the joint was packed) - the bathrooms didn't wow me, but the basics will do - it took a very long time to get our desserts - the gingerbread dessert wasn't bad, just mediocre - there's always room for improvement and i'll be back to see if they can achieve 5 stars A great holiday dinner with the fam.  Thanks to Dad, Bonus Ma, and Baby Sis!

CD1Uthk19QBy8MIagO2Qxw.review_text: Beautiful restaurant...large, expansive dining room with leather banquets...nice lighting so that you always look good even when you're madly stuffing your face with hush puppies and friend chicken. Well made drinks that taste like they should be - a drink.

hFCUoOVs1rA4FX9Vps9fsg.review_text: I made reservations through Open Table for Dine About Town 2012. Their fixed menu wasn't available online but i had faith it would be nothing less than amazing. On the day of i called in advance to let them know we would be running just 15 minutes late. The hostess answered that we have an hour and a half limit on our table and it may cut into our time. I said okay... but no, not cool! Rushed on over and they sat us down immediately. Long story short - you know they won't kick you out until you're done :)  Our waiter was an absolute gentlemen and never made us feel rushed once and gave us a great suggestion. The fixed menu didn't sound too great. For the same price, i could get what i really wanted directly off the regular dinner menu and went ahead with that.The Shrimp and Grits starter has great texture and flavorful shrimp. It wasn't too grainy and it wasn't over salted. We wiped that plate clean!   It was a toss up for me between two very dishes. I finally landed on the Fried Chicken because it's one of their more well known dishes. Really good! But i wish i had gone with another dish. The chicken has a crunchy, tasty, fried skin. It was moist and cooked very well. I just couldn't differentiate it from any other well cooked fried chicken dishes.   I would bring a date with a love for comfort food to 1300. It's dimly lit, the food is fantastic, and the place looks impressive.

xFJ5Ja8y40CdMa1sfC4-gg.review_text: Greeting- yes Vibe- cool jazz Prices- moderate. Check Great Bar specials Service- good Parking- good luck. Garage best bet Wine- expensive- $15 glass GR Almvs Food Fat Fries are very good Lamb Slliders were very good Rib sliders were very good Banana cream pie is always excellent $9 Fried chicken is very good Ribeye burger was excellent WIGB? Yes, I have

EqQzayfLmf4fzHY7L8Ilwg.review_text: I got introduced to 1300 by great friends and been wanting to bring my wife over since.  So finally got the chance last night, just by chance.  Walked into the restaurant without reservations.  Of course, it was fully booked, but we got lucky in the lounge area with a table for two in the corner right next to the band.  By the time we left, we ate, drank & danced for over 3 hours with a fun and easygoing crowd.  Great place to bring out-of-town guest that enjoy a jazz feel.

BSad_A8gpQ0_D-wrabpMLQ.review_text: I can't stress this enough....their homemade cornbread is sooo good...topped with their maple syrup butter and jalapeño jam.  When the cornbread is warm the butter and jam just melts away.  Their sweet corn bisque is really good and big.  I couldn't believe the portion.  After finishing the soup, I couldn't eat anything else.  :)  They also have a really good shrimp and grits....the cornbread dusted oysters would've been pretty good but it was a little undercooked for my taste.  The famous fried chicken was good...crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.  The scallops were a little fishy for some reason but the beans on the bottom was quite good.  If you like corn, fava beans and okra, you must get their succotash.  To top it all off, the chocolate beignets were amazing....yippeee found a new place to go....

efIJCmF7G2BoSEosqQiP8w.review_text: Two words: fat fries. they taste like meat. delish. Friday nights there is a live band in the lounge area. This is one of my favorite hang out spots in SF.

TRFvNRuOkytgiD7n3S9gaw.review_text: I took my husband here for his birthday right after it opened. Despite the fact that it was the day after thanksgiving --when I assumed everybody would be fasting or sleeping off the turkey-- I could only get a 6:30 resi. Not exactly the *hottest* seating.   When we got there, I was transformed to what must be the heydey of Fillmore Street and transported to a snapshot of its history. I got a glimpse as to why this place was actually coined the 'harlem of the west'.   The space design is fantastic...small tables feel romantic and private yet they also accommodate larger groups. They had a great dining area and also a happening looking lounge and bar --which especially merchandised the Fillmore jazz heritage.  Each course was delectable -- gourmet soul food done in a modern way. Everything had an upscale/foodie spin on it that was irresistible. Their wine list was fantastic, too.

vVf1cH5afTgG376rzdHygg.review_text: I sat in the bar area with some friends.  The bbq shrimp and grits were absolutely amazing!  And the burger was awesome.  It made up for the slightly shady service with an attitude.  We had a good time.  I will gladly go back anytime for the Shrimp and grits.  Very Fly spot...  Give it another half star...

-lSh8bzu8vbrmf_qH0wFDA.review_text: Went here for dinner after Blackboard eats had a 30% off deal. I must say, I was fairly disappointed with the whole affair.  SERVICE  Summed up: fairly terrible. Our waiter was the slowest guy on earth, the drinks took 20 minutes to be served, and the appetizer came out with our meals. After waiting for 25 minutes, I was finally able to track down one of the runners to procure some cornbread. That is not how a well-oiled restaurant should work.  FOOD Cornbread - OK. After everyone raving about how tasty it was, I found it to be too-dry, very crumbly, and less-sweet than I was hoping (I like my cornbread to have a slightly sweet taste). It wasn't terrible, but after one triangle, I was A-OK with not eating any more.  Sweet pea corn bisque - Amazing. This was definitely the highlight of the night. The texture was very light & frothy, with the pea not overwhelming the corn, and the bisque not being too creamy. I wanted seconds!  Catfish - vert tasty when mixed together! The fish itself was dry, but the dirty risotto was incredible. Mix it all together and the dish is transformed. It may be a little salty for some people, but I love salt so it was right up my alley. The catfish didn't have too much seasoning, so if you don't like your meat touching your other food, stay away ;)  Fried chicken - blah. This was definitely the most-disappointing part of the meal. The breading is super-thick and crunchy, to the point where it almost hurt to chew. The chicken was dry, the mashed potatoes had ZERO taste, and there was no gravy on any of the dish. When i asked for gravy, i was bought au-jus for the steak. What the hell? Farmer Brown, Little Skillet, Gussies...all had better fried chicken, and I don't think their fried chicken is all that great. Way to go 1300, you failed.  I guess to wrap it up, I will not be giving 1300 another go. For the price, it was an absolute waste.

iK5oMORPCmoWUmannptD-Q.review_text: My first exposure to 1300 on Fillmore was at last year's Check Please Bay Area tasting event.  They had a really delicious take on shrimp and grits that tasted amazing.  Ever since that event I have been excited to go check out the restaurant.  I finally made the trip and I can say I was so disappointed.    First of all the decor was really nice.  Very classy and clean.  The waitstaff were all polite and attentive.  I had reservations and was seated as soon as I arrived.  (The restaurant was fairly empty at 7:00 PM.    I started with a Abita Amber (one of two beers on tap).  It tasted really flat.  Maybe people do not go here to order beer so the keg was old?    Next they brought out the corn bread with jalapeño jelly.  The corn bread was decent. A bit dry. 4/5.    Sea and Swine.  3/5.  Tiny, whee little scallops were okay.  Whiskey smoked pork belly - the best bite of food I ate all night.  Braised cabbage smelled very off-putting.  Something was not right about that.    Next I had the barbecue shrimp and grits.  This was the best dish of the night.  4/5.  The shrimp were cooked well and the dish was well seasoned.  It had a nice spicy kick.    The black skillet fried chicken...  This was ok.  3/5.  I did enjoy the boneless chicken.  However it was under seasoned and dry.  The biscuits were dry.  It needed much more gravy.    The spiced fat fries.  2/5.  Not very good.  Kinda soggy and mushy.  Homemade ketchup was okay.    I did not try the dessert.

AoXLFjePadqIpyg1Qc1C8A.review_text: even though our meal was pretty pricey, i am givin 1300 a good rating. our server was hella friendly and very informative. he was patient as we asked tons of questions about what was on the menu. the inside is of the restaurant is beautiful. the fried chicken was delicious. it was a wonderful bday dinner.

C3K_UMPODZ_hDFnMy8E9Bg.review_text: We decided to go here at the last minute. Quite surprised that we were able to make an Open Table reservation. There were quite a few large parties, but space for us.  The service was great: friendly and efficient. In fact, maybe a little too efficient as the food seemed to fly out of the kitchen shortly after we ordered it. Made the pace of the meal seem hurried, though they weren't exactly hurrying us along. Just the tempo of the evening.  We had a good meal: - Fresh Water Shrimp Hushpuppies, Ancho Chile Remoulade - Little Gem Salad, Green Goddess Dressing, Spiced Molasses Glazed Pecan, Cornbread Croutons - Black Skillet Fried Chicken, Buttermilk Whipped Potatoes, Pan Gravy - Half rack of ribs with cole slaw and mac 'n cheese - Chocolate beignets and banana cream pie for dessert.  The shrimp were just fried shrimp, nothing special. The remoulade was flavorful.  I really liked the salad, but sweetie wasn't crazy about it. For me, little gems are the perfect lettuce.  We both enjoyed the chicken and the ribs quite a bit.  I'd definitely come back for these.  Desserts were OK. I didn't care for the pie.  The ambiance was pleasant without being stuffy. The crowd was diverse, which isn't something you see in San Francisco very often at an upscale establishment. It was rather refreshing.  Sadly, there was no music. It might have been piped in, but I was in the mood to hear some jazz.  Great public parking across the street.  All in all, it was a very enjoyable experience. I'd definitely recommend it to others looking for southern cooking but willing to pay for a nice atmosphere and white tablecloths.

XZaJC6F6CMjHOoAkB6FnPQ.review_text: My Wife and I felt we had a real culinary experience here.  But beyond that the setting reminded be of the forgone jazz area which we like.  The service was impeccable and the food was delicious.  Especially the fried chicken it was to die for..succulent.  Biscuits were just right.  And the music was a nice back drop.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

kDt3kmqwX3BFJpPHevT6cg.review_text: This place has good food but it also has the WORST customer service & "Event Director" ever!   I have been dining and supporting this establishment since they first opened their doors and over the years I have recommended countless family, friends and clients.   With that said, unfortunately, I have lost count of how many times the wait staff has forgotten to bring my left over food packages to my table before I have paid & departed. Only to get all the way home and call for them to say, "Sorry we forgot but we've thrown it out." It's happened so many times that I now tell them to bring the box out as soon as they pack the food up.  Recently, I called to reserve their private room for my birthday dinner Ina Saturday in March. The room seats 22 people and they request a $1500 min plus tax & service. That's roughly about $90 a person, kids included. Hello, this is not a wedding but just a dinner! I politely asked Kaley, the Event Director if she could lower the minimum. Without hesitation she said no. I explained my history as a customer and the support that I have given in the community in which they're located and still the answer was no. I asked her to ask the owners Chef Lawrence and Monetta and get back to me but I never heard back from her.  It just so happens that I saw Ms. Kaley tonight at an event where 1300 was providing minuscule samples of food for the guests. Boy was she surprised to see me! I told her who I was and that I never heard back from her regarding the owners' response to my request. She said that they also said no. I asked why hadn't she gotten back to me and she simply shrugged her shoulders and turned away. Great customer service & professionalism right? I have many good friends who know the owners, one of which was with me tonight. She plans to speak with Monetta and get to the bottom of this nonsense because no one, especially those who show as much support to 1300 as the people who would've attended my dinner, deserves to be treated this way.   Needless to say, they have lost my business and referrals, which I am sure they can obviously care less about.

otUjqfx_rEQdrL71e55qHw.review_text: Went here for brunch with some friends and it was great.

Njf7ZCmrI0IjX0cKlHQpGw.review_text: For my boyfriend's birthday dinner we came here and for $106.40 (exactly cuz I paid, lol!) he had the shrimp and grits, catfish and risotto and a beer and hurricane. I had the prixe fix which consisted of a tomato salad, halibut over an okra concoction and peach cobbler with ice cream, and hurricane.  Strong impressive drinks! The cornbread that came out with the meal was a bit dry and the apple jelly and butter really needed to be used to enjoy the bread.  The shrimp and grits were YUMMY! I must try this at home, if I can!  My boyfriend enjoyed his dinner which is what we came there for! My dinner was so-so. The tomato salad really was just a bunch of tomatoes, the halibut could have had more seasoning but I guess they dont want to overseason and the peach cobbler was yummy but pretty small.  Plus it was his birthday and they gave him my peach cobbler. I wondered what they would have done if I hadnt ordered dessert?!?  Anyway, the ambiance (candlelight) was what gave it an extra point. Sometimes you just want to drop your kid off to family and have a night to yourselves and thats exactly what we got at 1300. A lil romance and enough food to settle our stomachs before we headed to Yoshi's to toast the night away for awhile.  Parking is crazy. Park across the street if you can. Some how we lucked out and only paid $8 (no validation, we forgot!!!) even though we had dinner at 8 and left Yoshi's at 145-2am! Not bad at all!!!

qlJVwqTNPKDv91NOfi0k9A.review_text: A true gastronomy blending soul food, and the jazz culture, this restaurant presents a fine dining experience dressing home cooked soul food recipes into  socialite status!  The blend of California cuisine with French cooking techniques, and the sprinkling of soul food seasonings create a delectable taste on the palate.  Who could of thought that grits could be so sophisticated?!?!  The decor of the luxuriant restaurant gives you an old world feel.  You can taste the ghost of the days where jazz was prevalent and booming on the Fillmore.  One wall gives you visuals of historic photos from that era, with a light box behind accentuating the black and white photography.  You almost feel like you are on stage with the singers as the spotlights shine down on you during dinner.  This place is dining to the 9, and the cuisine, ambiance, and service reinforces it!

4PETMR-gqW_o2rp9uWphqQ.review_text: Full disclosure: we were bribed by the owner of the place. True, we had a reservation and were waiting for 30 minutes. But the owner was really nice and didn't let us pay for all three appetizers we ordered.     The bourbon-braised pork belly, black skillet fried chicken, and warm chocolate beignets cannot be missed.

0Oz5I1fWZuaho3gT0t8z-A.review_text: Two words: under seasoned.    What a bland, boring, meal. The cornbread to start off was good. Had the pork belly appetizer and it was dry. The french fries were the most boring wedges of potatoes. Decent burger, but the chips to accompany it were also bland. The food all had the potential to be good with just a little seasoning.   The ice cream with the too runny strawberry/rhubarb cobbler was absolutely comical. We literally laughed when it was brought to the table, as the "scoop" of ice cream looked like it was actually scooped with a melon baller.  I have no idea what the point of even giving a bite of ice cream with the dish could be.  Maybe they ran out of ice cream and gave me what little they had left?  The restaurant also seems to have a bit of a complex. Are they trying to be a casual restaurant or fine dining? Pick one and stick with it.   The space is great.  Service is as bland as the food.  Not terrible, but just missing something.

p0KR5iwoOdoKJrwov66H9Q.review_text: I had pretty high expectations going in, my friends were in town and I was looking to satisfy my Southern food appetite with some California style Southern food.  I was disappointed, but that's not to say this place isn't good.  The decor, music, bar, all of that was great... But, I came here for food.  The cornbread was pretty meh.  I guess the person who used to make this so called heavenly cornbread moved back South and opened up their own bakery.  The Jalapeno jelly made it good though, I just lathered that stuff all over it... Yum.  The meal in itself just seemed pretty spotty.  Fried chicken was not the typical fried chicken (very crispy, cornmeal based batter, dry thick outside) but the chicken was very flavorful and juicy.  The ribs were too dry and you had to dip them in the BBQ sauce just to eat them.  The grits in the shrimp and grits dish were too heavy, but as a side ordered with my chicken they seemed fine.  The rest of the entrees were pretty good and no problems.  And you get BIG portions!  I know the chef here is very good, as its apparent in a few of the dishes, and I absolutely love the menu itself.  I just wish I liked the actual food more because it certainly has potential.

sXskRyJsV8wEpWwFtSnMxw.review_text: I thoroughly enjoyed eating here.  The location was very handy for a show at the Filmore.  Service, Ambiance and Food were all very good and a lot of fun.  I had the ribs and loved the variety on my plate.  Ribs, 2 sauces, coleslaw and the mac and cheese.  More food than I needed but my husband was happy to help eat the ribs (go figure!).  As someone else mentioned, the portion of the mac is pretty small, but they also included the coleslaw so I treated the mac as an extra treat.  Our waiter George was very efficient and informative.  We were seated immediately. I mention this because there are so many complaints on yelp about both.  We had no problem other than we were too full to eat dessert.  I'm looking forward to coming back for the Gospel brunch.

gigS6duXezr77LfzscTEbg.review_text: This has quickly became my favorite restaurant in the city.  The food is cooked to absolute perfection.  The atmosphere is lively.  I'm big on how clean a restroom is and they passed that test. The host was mediocre but it's ok when a place is hopping. I can understand sometimes we customers can be frustrating.  Overall, I really like this place.

ZgwCmrBa8PjBMEnMwJMFbA.review_text: My sweety brought me here for my birthday this year and I was quite surprised.  Loved the ambiance and will definitely go back.  Enjoyed the appeziters (sweet potato gnocchi -my fav- shrimp n grits -yum- pear salad -delish-!  I left 1 star out because of my entre.  It was just OK - had the red snapper.  It was a generous size but it just didn't hit the spot for me.  Dessert was good - had the chocolate beignet - yum!! Will have to try the hushpuppies - heard they were good as well.

m077SPgDrTwQBhUlP7xSOQ.review_text: We had our holiday party here and had a blast. Great ambiance, fantastic service and some stiff drinks all helped to make it another memorable holiday shindig. I would definitely return to get a "full taste" of 1300 Fillmore as many of us gave the open bar a little too much attention. In between the drinks, we did our best to try some of the food and I really enjoyed the grits! Overall, this could be a great date/lounge spot especially when the live music is playing. I'm sure it will be five stars for me once I get the full taste!

4uhpiOBNzIUZLqh7bskj_Q.review_text: Looks like Im gonna be adding another restaurant to my 5 star list.! 1300 on Fillmore... you rocked my world last Friday night ( or at least my taste buds!) Firstly, Id like to start with the decor. Awesome. Simply, oozing with the "smooth-ness" that one could only associate with a jazzy type atmosphere. The lighting, soft but not so dark you cant see your date across the table. The lounge area with big oversized stuffed couches and 50s era pictures illuminated with lights makes you feel instantly sexy and classy all at once. The food was flavorful from start to finish with the wait staff very attentive and not overbearing.  and on to the food, for starters: house made cornbread with apple butter- holy smokes! Did I order dessert before my meal? So warm and just out of oven, perfect to go along with the bourbon braised pork belly. The pork belly was tender and had just enough fat to add flavor without being overbearing.  The braised beef short ribs with onions rings and mashed potatoes were perfect and could not have satisfied me more. The beef was falling off the ribs without as much of a pinky-fingers worth of pressure from my fork.  Now I know plenty of restaurants are showcasing southern love with the addition of fried chicken to their menus, and 1300 is no different. Not one piece was overcooked or greasy. Each being tender and juicy with a  light crispy skin.  Each plate had generous portions, well worth the money. I just wish I had saved room for dessert. Darn....guess that means I'll just have to come back for more.... :-)

O9iVmgS_hPtNd887LDBctw.review_text: I've eaten here a couple of times and I think it's a bit over-rated and past its prime.  There are much superior southern/comfort food restaurants in the city now with higher-quality dishes.  Their fried chicken is just OK, as are the rest of the dishes like the ribs and fish dishes.  Their service is a bit spotty but they try hard to be as professional as possible.  If you're headed to Yoshi's later, this is a convenient place to gather for dinner with friends and have a solid meal but don't expect to be itching to come back for the food.

cx6CMeztrzFYAY0gpaC3Mg.review_text: Excellent Soul Food a la Glam!  The Chicken is delectable. You aren't here to eat dainty so I ripped into mine- skin and all. You must.  We tried the greens w/ ham hawks as well as the mac and cheese as appetizers. Very good!  This dinner specials were DAT so we also got to try the Cat fish w/ andouille risotto. That was really rich and a tad salty. I still devoured every bite.   The service is a little DRY and borderline non-friendly. Minus one star. I hope this review is read by a staff member so they can improve the service and friendliness of hosts and wait staff.

-1Grce7VmCft_uq79JX9Ow.review_text: My broker took me and a couple of the realtors for dinner here as a holiday/appreciation dinner. The atmosphere here is cozy and parking was easy. Luckily the restaurant is near a garage and it did help that it was a tuesday night.   So for appetizers we had Sea & Swine Whiskey smoked pork belly, bay scallops, braised cabbage, mustard gastrique,  House Smoked Hot Link: Chicken Andouille Sausage, Pipperade, Duo of Mustards , a side dish of mac and cheese and truffle, and the shrimp and grits. All were very exceptional except the mac and cheese. I did not taste the truffle at all and the asiago cheese was very overpowering. But for starters the food was very good!!!  For an entree I ordered the Green Tea Smoked Rainbow Trout Roasted Heirloom Potatoes, Blue Lake Beans and Pistachio,Brown Butter. I ate the dish in about 2 minutes. It was that good. Everything on the plate just worked together beautifully.   I order a lemondrop martini at every restaurant, so it is only customary that I do the same here. They are absolutely delicious here!! A definite plus!  I had the apple cobbler for dessert and It was just ok. Nothing spectacular.   Would i come back again? Definito!

xTYXFcS7-eb-L3HTKwO7Og.review_text: I went here for valentines day with my boo. It was fantastic. I had the salmon and it was to die. I also had the Mac n cheese and it was amazing. I enjoyed the band, hot pocket. They were playing there after we finished our amazing dinner.  The only downside is the low lighting. It made it hard to see things, period. I get they are trying to set the mood and the ambiance is supposed to be like sassy, but it was just way too dark.  Other than that, this place was awesome!

PmrFSehNLWAn8pMWtB53Lg.review_text: I have this problem with the whole concept of upscale southern comfort food.  Of course, I really have a problem with paying $21 for a plate of fried chicken.  Come on.  Fried chicken is meant to be eaten with 72 napkins, a couple of beers and at least 5 of your closest friends while either (a) fighting off armies of tiny ravenous ants or (b) trying to get the chicken/waffle/syrup combo into your mouth without major incident.  The entire MEAL should cost $21 - including the beer.    That being said, I love the lounge area at 1300 on Fillmore.  I love the comfy leather wing chairs, the wall of black and white photos, the tiny but eclectic wine list, the fact you can order food there while lolling on the sofas.  This has become a go-to spot with friends on weeknights.  I also like the service, the interesting and frankly swanky decor, the luxurious bathrooms.  I just can't get my head, my wallet, or my taste buds, around the concept of nouveau soul food.

EeKKEO4prC4okF2B2HfIHA.review_text: The Ambiance,service  was far more satisfying than the cuisine ...

5RCcFwMRghhw1wMhnZY5RA.review_text: SUCH an awesome venue to recieve only 3 stars....  Came on a Sunday for the Sisters Birthday Brunch. As I walked in with a little confusion(Never been there before and didnt realize the venue was so nice) the hostess greeted us graciously and showed us to our party.   The waitress was pretty good.(Except for the fact we had to ask her to refill our bottomless mimosas...every...single...time) She was quick and speedy when we did ask for something so it worked well.   The brunch itself came in rather tiny portions...Next time I will remember to order 2 plates of the same thing. The food was absolutely incredible. SOOOO YUMMY!!! That may have been the best part of the Brunch.   The 2 missing stars are sent to the Head Chef none other than Mister David Lawrence. Reading below and realizing many others have brought in their own "Cupcake Cakes" or "Birthday Cakes" I found it rather bothersome and completely tacky that as we are about to continue to enjoy our Brunch and celebrate he comes over to our table and tells not just one or two people in our party, but he explains to the 'Entire' table we will all be charged $2.50 each additional saucer plate for the cake, and how that pays for the dishwasher to be able to clean the plates. I would think the $20.00 for the tiny portion of food might be able to cover a little bit of that(#JustSayin)....  All in All, this is a great place with such a cool and collective vibe...I would reccommend coming here to others just because the music was great and the food was tasty.

TI8m2q2jdsqoenpmyriNVw.review_text: Went here on January 15 for SF's Dine about town. We didn't order from the Dine About Town Menu since the rest of the menu looked more appetizing.  Just as everyone loved the Maple syrup Short Rib, I was absolutely crazy about it. I am giving this place 5 star for the superb service by Nikki.  We walked in late and they almost turned us down however Nikki still gave us her very best service. Thanks for a great experience and we will be back.

oKQfw9uOKBGgm1fBlfBrOA.review_text: YUM YUM!!! First time...but it won't be the last. Shrimp & grits are to die for and I had the Maple syrup beef short rib.  It's the best I've ever had in a restaurant. Everything including our waiter (John) was top notch We'll be baaack.

KZ6vu30XTgq5X6dIO3_GIQ.review_text: Review of the lounge only:  Perfect place to enjoy cocktails, appetizers and beignets before a  show. Gourmet comfort food. Conscientious service, comfy leather arm chairs, dim lighting and the faint sounds of jazz music............this was a perfect place.

blfdqudCduuEdM9AlgYMzg.review_text: There's a feeling of energy, without its being overly loud, in the restaurant, giving the place a fun, yet sophisticated vibe. Two of us perused the well-conceived cocktail list while waiting for the other couple in our party of four to arrive. The bartenders were knowledgeable about the flavor profiles and were able to guide us to try new drinks that would still meet our likes (and avoid our dislikes).  The dining room is lovely, and the service is quick and professional (but you don't feel rushed). We shared four delicious starters while we enjoyed cocktails. The Southern-themed food was excellent, although the dessert menu could use a "refresh" so that there are unexpected twists on Southern classics.   All in all, it was a great evening of food and drinks, and we'll be back.

s3XmVL8UT5duKjPaQp43cg.review_text: Excellent high quality soul food; filling and tasty. Nice restaurant and ambiance as well, prices are just fine. I certainly hope that this part of the Western Addition can continue to thrive...

wvVm5Q69-Su3o8aLD0AjGw.review_text: damn it's good! and me and my bf saw david alan grier! ha! that alone was like "STAR!!"   While dining, I noticed this super cute baby, def black/asian and totally adorable! Me: "Donny, look how cute that baby is! Edible!" Donny: "Oh, cute . . . .hey is that David Alan Grier holding the baby?" Minor celeb spotting at 1300...  After all the rave reviews our night out on the town was destined to start at 1300. I made the reservations on opentable and got a call on the 4th just to confirm. nice! parking wasn't bad and the only thing I regret was setting the reservation at 7.30pm and listening to reviews that it it was pretty fancy so you should dress accordingly. It really wasn't; it's totally bus. cas. Sophisticated yet non-pretentious atmosphere, amazing eats, lots of energy, pretty classy crowd and great service.  there was definitely an older crowd on Saturday at 7.30 but everyone was really cool, relaxed and sipping the whole time. our neighbors sitting next to us finishing their bottle of wine were really talkative and told us about all the great dishes they had. With their recommendation we got the Fried Green Tomato Salad. Small portion but yummy starter (goat cheese!). The boy got the fried chicken which was hella good! perfectly spiced and perfectly crisp. I got the Braised Beef and paired it with a Cab. The presentation of all dishes was tops, but my beef, which was still very tender, didn't have the same kick as the chicken. In fact the 2 onion rings i had nearly eclipsed the beef experience all together--best ever!  our server was Annette who I noticed got a crappy review previously. It seems like she's changed her act because she was super friendly and very engaged. She kept coming back to see if things were okay and while she wasn't super talkative, she was very helpful. We finished off the meal, super stuffed and in need of boxes! they have like a coat check system and annette handed us a number to redeem our food on our way out.  With wine tip and all the goodies, you're looking at least a $100 bill for two. We will definitely come again and next time try at Friday night. If me and my girls stop through, we'll go straight to the bar where all the action is!

91CmjzlVVCkLPZjWOXht6w.review_text: Way too expensive for what we got - period, especially considering that we ate in the lounge.  Music more annoying than enjoying.  I had a salad that would easily fit in the palm of my hand and a few fried shrimp.  My date had a couple of greasy sliders and a handful of greens.  We had 2 beers and 2 glasses of ok wine.  Total equaled $95 before tip.  We left hungry and won't be going back.  There are too many good restaurants in the city to settle for this.

u9KhzES5reUljwccEyFdJw.review_text: Came here for Valentines and I am glad we chose 1300 It was a prix fixe menu but still enough choices to pick from.  As an appetizer we got oysters (had to go with that aphrodisiac for Valentines haha) The oysters weren't that great though. But the rest of the meal was pretty delicious! Normally grits to me are just ok, not something I would order, but my bf got it and they were super good! For dessert we got the dessert for 2 option which was a taste of 8 different desserts. The jelly tarte and cheesecake sample were my fave!  Happy 1300 wasn't marked up for Vday

yGnhcwSbmV6evHdXZefa5Q.review_text: The place is handsome and fun.  Food was amazing.  Had the fried chicken, which was stellar.  Sampled my dates sea bass, which was also first class.  Only one complaint: Beers are too small.  Definitely check it out though -  it's an amazing date place, or probably even really fun with groups...

TvRbvyKSeEbzaoJWWWjovA.review_text: 3 stars here based solely on the food. I actually had a lot of fun here and the scene and the company were great.  The restaurant was reasonably packed on a Friday - we sat at a big circular table for 10 in the back near the kitchen and there were a few empty tables, so walk-ins seem like they would be fine. There's a lounge area in the front where they play live music, and it's a shame you can't see it from the dining area in the back. Theme was quirky - they were playing jazz and the decor was glamorous and glitzy, yet the food was all southern comfort. They're most known for their fried chicken and shrimp and grits.  What you should get: 1) Poached farm egg and sauteed chicken livers (4.5 stars - liver was delicious)  2) Baked oysters (4 stars - really flavorful, good spice) 3) mac and cheese - (4 stars - these were the best side of the night!) 4) Fried chicken (3.5 stars - might as well. This was a lot more "chicken" and lot less "fried" which may be egregious to some. I've had better at Bonchon.) 5) Beef shortrib (3 stars - very tender, but their maple glaze just made the whole thing a little off and a little too sweet) 6) Shrimp and grits (3 stars, didn't see why this was so great. Shrimp was solid, fine. grits were fine.)  Cocktails were average, wine list was pretty good - they have a ton by the glass.   Overall, probably wouldn't come back, especially now that I've had a run of all the top picks, but maybe would for a last minute girls' night out venue or something.

cnUYhtwHOildnOIlmtgjCg.review_text: This place exceeded my expectations after a friend found it online.  From the moment we walked in the front door, it was a pleasurable experience. Invited to sit in the lounge area as they set up for Sunday brunch, we had a chance to admire the vintage photos on the wall.  We had the 'gospel' brunch, not really knowing what it was, essentially a nice brunch accompanied by gospel/r&b/jazz tunes performed by a live band.  Food was excellent. We shared three dishes: - french toast w/balsamic something w/fresh berries - fried chicken over buttermilk mashed potatoes - fried catfish po' boy w/chips Before the food came we had some scones, cornbread w/butter & some spicy topping.  Lemonade was fresh & good.   Music, food, ambiance, all A+! I will return to this place again (& again).  *The only downside was sitting near the performers, it did make it hard to hear my dining companions from time to time. And one of the singers made me sing (poorly) into the mic when he caught me singing along to one of the songs, to my dismay. LOL.

K9N6LHk3SkpNdtaRWV0bdA.review_text: Big pat on the back goes to this place for its decor- large vaulted ceilings, awesome stage lighting- the owner herself came out to talk to my 10-person group about how she had wanted to provide patrons with a real idea of how the Fillmore neighborhood was in its "heyday."  The place is exciting and the chef- the owner's husband- is truly talented. The service was excellent.  Our waiter not only gave us useful and respectful suggestions about our dish choices, but he fought for us in the kitchen, and our party ended up getting the last short ribs portion and the last vegetarian dish. The lost star comes from a shortage of variety on the menu- I am not a huge fan of southern cooking, and it tends to be short on vegetarian options.  But the fried black-eyed-pea cakes I was given we really good, and the corn bisque soup was amazing.  They have a great wine list.  If you enjoy this type of food, this is the best around.

otwf4pFnOKoZf6GsxQd5hA.review_text: We went to 1300 on Fillmore before a Yoshi's show last night (Sunday night).  The location is great for pre-dinner, the ambiance is beautiful.  The food--not so much.   The Fried Chicken, which is supposed to be fabulous was dry and tasted like it had taco seasoning on it.  Really disappointing. The special baby back ribs were also dry, lacked flavor and both of the sauces that were served with it were bland.  The accompaniment was a 2 tablesopoon serving of mac & cheese which was also dry and lacked flavor and a nice serving of cole slaw, which was great.  However, I won't be going back just for the cole slaw.

mSCoQBKkYX7OwUsFhdqXnw.review_text: Went here last night with my husband to celebrate Vday. The food was very good, not fantastic or the best, but very tasty. Started with the mac.n.cheese and I had the friend chicken. Huge portion with mashed potatoes. My husband had the steak, also very good. Way too much food, left with leftovers from both plates.
