I love the shrimp and grits, the steak and potatoes with a crispy onion ring hits the spot right on the mark.   I love bringing people here and its a real treat whenever there is a live vocalist in the house.   I tell people of this spot all the time and will continue to frequent 1300 when I am in town.

5GpOt6sv-fGZkNKxJFhVow.review_text: Wow.   Went Sunday night to casually check this place out by getting a drink and some apps in the lounge. Quick rundown:  Decor: Amazing. Very dark and clubby with the glow of backlit posters of jazz legends and archival photos of the Fillmore from back in the day. Wonderful chairs and couches for lounging. Cool lanterns.   Food: Ranging from good to great. We ate off the lounge menu, although you can have regular food in the lounge. Had the barbecue shrimp cheezy grits which were awesome. Fat fries - delicious. Lamb sliders - pretty good. Warm chocolate beignets - OUTTA THIS WORLD. Served with a dipping sauce and coffee soda. What? Shut up. Only criticism is the food tends to be on the sweet side, including the house made ketchup. They need to even it out a bit. I almost got the diabetus.  Drinks: They have signature cocktails, which I didn't have. I had this very well-priced rose that was on the money. Gotta say tho that this is the place to drink a manhattan.  Service: Great. Friendly, attentive, without being overbearing. They gave great recommendations.

GX6YV2sORHR7tOma3mcYfw.review_text: Another visit tonight. The favorites at the table were the baby back ribs (with delicious bbq sauce) and the banana cream pie with caramel-lime sauce. The surf-and-turf and the apple bread pudding were reportedly good. Still not a fan of the fries or the fried chicken (too much cumin) or the red snapper.

st3m74Bf3cARdwerUgoOLg.review_text: The food was good - I couldn't eat it all and too bad we were traveling so couldn't take left overs. I would love to go back. The bartender was really nice as well and put in our drinks on the happy hour specials even though it was a half an hour later. Great service!

GjdJP2WkhbUdcbxhu33eSg.review_text: This was one of the worst dining experiences!!  BE WARNED!!!  If you are seeking  a  dining experience which truly values its customers DO NOT DINE AT THIS ESTABLISHMENT! To start one of the hostesses clearly hadn't been trained  in the art of delivering superior customer service, as she had 4 out of a party of 6 waiting for nearly 15 mins while our table remained empty because our full party wasn't present to be seated!  My apologizes because our husbands were parking the car!!  Nor was our waiter trained  in superior customer service!!  Once our party of 6 was seated at a table set for 5!!!!??? Only then did our waiter who walked past us for 20 mins without saying a word or introducing himself finally take our order!! Our party waited nearly 30 mins for our food to arrive only to be told.....oopps we ran out of food!!!!   Apparently the kitchen staff hadn't prepared for the number of patrons who ordered the southern ribs????Therefore my husband wasn't able to eat the ribs he ordered for dinner!!!!! REALLY????!!!!!  Somehow the chef was able to round up a few ribs and provided my husband with his meal nearly an hour after he ordered his meal! And 15 mins before we had to leave for a 10PM show at Yoshis.  Of course we expressed our dissatisfaction and we comped for our champagne, side dishes, and the meal my  husband received late.    Overall we paid less than half for a dining experience that would have cost over $400. The general manager who comped us and tried to help and apologize for our awful experience did the best he could. However, at the end of the day 1300 on Fillmore has poor management at the head which is ultimately is demonstrated by the poorly trained front line service team! Never once did our waiter apologize for our poor experience at 1300 on Fillmore.  Had we received better service we could have easily spent over $600+. I will never go back to this place!!!

q0TTna05UhSa6EyUPj2zdw.review_text: I LOVE breakfast here. I frequent with my boyfriend on the weekends and we've never had a bad experience. The brunch is divine and the staff is always courteous and amazing.  We tried dinner here for the first time the other night though, and I was very disappointed. The ribs were extremely dry, his risotto was under cooked, and the sides were only OK. The fried okra was great, as was the cornbread. All in all - it's a bit expensive to me for the quality of meal at dinnertime. Stick with breakfast, it's a safe bet.

fjwaj2kcTFIkqSYIc7Dx9w.review_text: I just had a wonderful meal at 1300 Fillmore.  The food, the service and the wine were top notch.   While they did not have the wine I originally picked, the suggested Black Coyote Cab was a wonderful surprise.  We both ordered the beef short ribs, which were soo tender they were almost melting off the bone - cliché as that expression is...   The desserts my friend and I had were delicious and very innovative - the banana cream pie with lime caramel was light and fresh and the pears in my chocolate mousse were a combination I've never had before but certainly liked.  We left happily stuffed and will definitely go back.

8_N2umsn31E6xYHT3eWqDQ.review_text: If you are in San Francisco, go immediately to this astounding restaurant, "1300 on Fillmore St." Enjoy the taste-bud-delighting cuisine prepared by Chefs David Lawrence and Max Hussey. So happy to have found this delightful place. Delicious food to dream about. Best Scallops, Salmon & Fried Chicken with Biscuits EVER. The South had better lookout!

GfVPzuscQLOUk8wDkUOLOg.review_text: Four of us came here last night before Yoshi's.  We loved most of the appetizers and sides but mains really lacked luster and flavor.  Not sure why.    The sweet pea ricotta ravioli should be a main!  It is fabulous...so delicate and delicious.  The hushpuppies....actually hushpuppy dough wrapped around large shrimp and then deep fried are worth the trip on their own.  The wild mushrooms in grits, greens, buttermilk chive potatoes all were really tops.  We were not impressed with the macaroni and cheese...too greasy and grainy...the cheese did not hold together.  So why are the mains so boring?  The  fried chicken was actually not good at all...too thick crust and overpowering sauce.  The snapper was just okay...nothing special.  The succotash made with fava beans and grilled corn was, again, really really good.  Sides and starters at the bar!  Here we come!

-wHq_uJCtOwuqi1VaUxH8w.review_text: Came here to celebrate my husband's Birthday with my sister and her boyfriend and it was so nice!  Ambiance: A+. We didn't come on a night where they had live jazz but the jazz playing was nice. Loved the dimmed lights, the couch along the wall for the ladies to sit on, while the gentlemen sat on the other side of the table was a nice touch. Super comfortable. As we looked down the row, we saw that only the ladies sat there so we chuckled to ourselves. Loved the drapery, the trees, the bar and lounge areas. Everything was just beautiful.  Service: A+. We were seated right away (reservations) and had a pleasant server with the thickest eyeglasses I'd ever seen. THEY WERE SO COOL! LOVED his glasses. LOL! Can't remember his name but he was very nice.  Food: A+.  Pork chop, asparagus and stone fruit = I'm not a huge pork eater but this was so tasty. Seasoned to perfection. The asparagus had this glaze on it that was out of this world. Fried green tomatoes: I've always wanted to try this anywhere so here was my opportunity and it did not disappoint. Lightly breaded and fried tomatoes, not greasy with fresh mozzarella and a yummy sauce underneath. Cornbread w/sweet chili sauce: get your EVERLASTING life with this cornbread honey! YAZ! You could smell and taste the butter and it was so good! BBQ shrimp & grits: the BEST I've ever had. You could taste the flavor in your mouth before you chewed it.  Greens: delicious. Cooked to perfection. Seasoned well. My husband said they were a close 2nd to mine. =D Skillet fried chicken, mashed potatoes & gravy, and chive & herb biscuits: MOUTHGASM. I wanted to kiss the cook!  I would catch a flight from Orange County to San Francisco just for dinner. Every time I come to the Bay, 1300 is a MUST!

E77OzhkMVYUmATqEgq8g6w.review_text: The fried chicken was very mediocre. The  prices were high, but didn't live up to the quality of the food. Overall, I would go somewhere else if you are looking for great southern comfort food.

GV7ssHNxpnnY3IGRvKsPDw.review_text: I like 1300 primarily for a cocktail - they have a very stylish lounge area with dim lighting that makes everything (and everyone) look sexy. The menu is soul food with a touch of elegance, but it is on the heavy side for my taste. I do love 1300's brunch though, especially the Gospel Sundays they put on once a month with live music.

PYxHpeTz2ZxZNJEBIAJgvg.review_text: Of all the times I've been to Yoshis (right next door) I've never noticed 1300, until one night. Well actually I didn't notice it a friend of mines did. So after the show we decided to go and have a bite to eat with a night cap.   I had the bbq shrimp and grits. Followed up with the  Pear Flower cocktail (Grey Goose La Poire, St. Germain, Fresh Grapefruit and Lemon juice). Everything was excellent! No complaints....wait with the exception that it was extremely dark inside. I literally had to use the flashlight on my cell phone to read the menu. Aside from that everything was great, even the band they had playing in the lounge area. I even caught the former Mayor Willie Brown, dancing out the door. Looked like he had a good time here as well!  Think this will be my go to spot after concerts at Yoshis!

VqKpq5kFSs5JW-wM3secig.review_text: Enjoyed a Sunday brunch here.  The music was joyful and the atmosphere is classy.  The portions are sensible although my wife left hungry after having the shrimp and grits though she enjoyed the dish.  The 1300 Filmore dish however was plentiful and tasty.  All in all, I'd definitely recommend a visit.

mAhty2OHDTtLm00quB5Xjw.review_text: A stylish, audible lounge to bring a group of friends together for drinks. Ali B. hosted a great monthly happy hour here! Look forward to coming back to try the food.

lkAl5zKqm9P2INCWUnNziQ.review_text: The cornbread they brought to the table was excellent.  The fried chicken, mashed potatoes and biscuits I had as an entree were delicious.  The wine we ordered was EXCELLENT.    We did not have a reservation, but only had a short wait before we were seated (it was a Tuesday night).  Our server was super friendly, but a little bit forgetful.  I LOVE THE ATMOSPHERE at this place - excellent decor, very warm.  Loved it!

9d9kgq7womnxi_NGKsJMEA.review_text: I had been wanting to go to 1300 On Fillmore since I moved to this city. It took a few years to actually come here for some reason, but now I can say that I have. It has been crossed off the list and it probably won't make it's way back onto my list, although if you have been wanting to come here I would not deter you from doing so.  I have to say that the interior is great and the ambiance of both the lounge and dining areas are fantastic. The server we had was in his first week of work but did a really good job. The food was pretty good but did not live up to the expectations we had built up due to the restaurant's reputation. The night manager that Friday needs to go through some additional training or be replaced.  They told us that they were famous for their Shrimp N' Grits so we ordered that along with the Pork Belly & Egg to start. The shrimp n' grits were very good but the pork belly, while it had a lot of flavor, was just too sweet with the bbq sauce.  For the entree we had the Fried Chicken. It was pretty good and I can't really complain about the dish, but it was not extremely memorable. I have heard about their fried chicken being fantastic, but I can honestly say that I have had better in SF alone for a lower price. (Search: The Front Porch). On the side we ordered their Mac and Cheese, which was the best thing of the night.  Overall, the meal was better than average but not fantastic. The biggest downside actually came from the manager that night. He decided not to honor our Blackboard Eats 30% discount because he thought we did not meet the minimum order of 2 small plates per person or 1 entree per person. As you can see by what we ordered we did meet the requirements, as well as having an extra side and 4 of their $12 cocktails. He decided to argue with me right in the dining room and I was the one who had to say "maybe we should continue this discussion somewhere else". When all was settled he said that it was his mistake because "the ticket only showed one small plate and a side, and that he didn't see the second small plate on our bill". He gave us a free dessert for the embarrassment but the whole incident really left a sour taste in our mouths when we left.

KNh_7eMdEDvY6RW1VHnUCA.review_text: Love this restaurant, thank you fellow yelpers for the recommendation. A great spot if your looking for soul food, and are looking for something fancy ( great date spot). Love the ambiance, great service, and most importantly I got to meet Common (hip hop artist), who was also a patron there! This eating experience will definitely be a memorable one. Oh yeah, get the fried chicken, delish!

d1ZdZrtVNBdSEg6561IsWg.review_text: Went here for an anniversary dinner. Very romantic atmosphere! Had a reservation and was seated promptly. Food was excellent. The only reason it was not 5 stars was that the service at first was a bit slow. The manager noticed and came over to get our drink order and said our waiter would be with us shortly. As soon as a large table next to us left service was very prompt. Would definitely eat there again! Scrimp and grits highly recommended!

3G9Jkn7hKc8fmbdK8_lC8g.review_text: there are things about 1300 on Fillmore that i really like and things that i completely dislike.   let's start with their door. it looks all grand and tall. big doors always look good. but on a windy day we tried to open the door and it literally seemed like it was locked. after searching for a different door, we realized that the first door was the only entrance. so i had to bend at the legs and use my leg muscles to open that sucker up!! it was insanely heavy! but the vibe of the place makes up for the weightlifting i had to do to get in there.  the rest of the good: the cornbread with jalapeno jelly was right up my alley and i loved every crumbly bit of it. the shrimp and grits were exceptionally tasty (and i generally hate grits but i loved these). the short ribs with chive potatoes was really tender and had tons of flavor. the banana cream pie was pretty good. light and airy with a hint of lime in the caramel sauce (though good, i wouldn't say amazing....but certainly a good naner cream pie.)  the bad/"eh":  the hyped up fried chicken is not the business. not for me anyway. instead of crispy delicious fried skin, you have the same flabby slimy chicken skin but laying on top of it is a crunchy crust of some sort mixed with crazy amounts of spices that i don't like. i can't pinpoint what spice i don't like in it but it had an off-putting taste. the beignets were NOT good at all. they were dry and dense and nothing like you would want.... although the coffee soda foam thing that came with it was interesting. oh, and the server forgot to give us our left overs at the end of our meal and we stupidly walked away without noticing until we were already on the freeway.

dquYc93gZ35dxeO88d9sfQ.review_text: Booked this restaurant  for my birthday and I was so disappointed. We order the fried chicken,beef,pork chop and the fish but the only one that's  good is only the fried chicken. We ordered medium rare for the steak but when the steak coming,it was well done and so hard to cut and chew. The pork chop and fish were no taste.The cocktails was so so as well. I spent almost $600 for 8ppl I dont think its worth it Will not comeback again

S61KB_xdKb2W3PYnzLG3JA.review_text: Our new favorite restaurant--on either side of the bay. If you miss the Purple Plum, don't miss 1300 on Fillmore. Everything about it is five stars.

KXSzTO-bi6_Fcysm0mEHpg.review_text: went with my friend for dine about town. the food was great! love the corn bisque and it was very yummy! i had the sweet ice tea (forgot the exact name, but it was on the specialty alcohol list), and it tasted really good :) as for the dine about town menu, i had the beef one, it was pretty good as well. nicely cooked and layered on the plate. i love the sweet potatoes. just the right enough amount. the ambiance was nice, wish it'd be a little more quiet. people were pretty chatty when i was there haha....but the waiters were prompt and nice. overall, very nice experience and love the interior design :)

XduciX-f9ONDZ-rUhs3PfQ.review_text: Another not quite a 4 start restaurant for me.   3.5 stars.  Lots of good.  A few mediocre dishes.   First the good.  Sea and swine.  The pork was delicious, but this app is really small.  Not something you can really share.  Fried green tomatoes, crisp and tasty.   The not so good apps.... for me it would be the Beignets.  The chocolate sauces weren't doing it for me.  The potatoes were just okay, I would skip them.   The mac and cheese was so so.   My entree was great, braised short ribs.  The meat was crazy tender and well flavored.    They need a better beer selection.  Nothing interested on tap.  And the bottle selection could be much better.

89RWEqsGVBS-yUOI2w5JCQ.review_text: I went here over a month ago with a group of 8.  I still drool dreaming about the food.  Really, I don't think I've been to a restaurant in SF where so much of the food is so consistently strong and delicious.  The best I've ever had: Cornbread (with simple jam and butter) Fried Chicken (how is this so good? i don't understand)  Really solid: Service: the waitress & waiter were great, attentive and made a great wine recommendation  Decor: love the atmosphere. wish there was live jazz that night though Short ribs with truffle mashed potato and vegetables sauteed mushrooms with grits (I didn't even normally like grits) mac and cheese  side dies of braised greens (this was surprisingly spicy)  Average  biscuit- yea, amazing that I thought this was the only food I had there that I didn't think was outstanding.  My only knock against the place is we made a reservation for 7 but had 8 show up, they said their extra chair was "broken" and then we ended up waiting for over an hour and half.  At first they made a small attempt at making things right by saying "they'd care of us for making us wait".  At first, this meant 1 free small appetizer.  Upon asking nicely though, they took some side dishes and dessert off the bill.  To end on a good note, I like how I one of the owners was working the hostess table, networking and meeting future regulars and esp. how I saw that the exec. chef was actually still working there, managing the outgoing meals.  I rarely see the exec. chef at a restaurant so was impressed that he'd still be working there on a normal fri. night.

DvO8Jaum_Z42fnrh-w4eaw.review_text: Nice lounge area. The bartender ignored us at first which was strange as there was NO ONE THERE.  When he did get to us he made a great drink. I had the Pear Flower. He turned out to be nice, but strange manners when we first sat at the bar. The food was okay. The best was the mushroom appetizer. That was really good, but I came here for the chicken which everyone seemed to rave about here. I am a fried chicken fanatic and I did not appreciate their take on fried chicken. It was spiced up (not spicy), but heavy on the spices. My husband liked it, but it says something when I just eat one piece. My husband had the short ribs, which was very fork tender, but it wasn't something that memorable. My girlfriend ordered the burger medium-rare and it came out mooing.  The service was good though, after remarking about the rareness, she did get a free dessert. 2 stars for food, 4 stars for service

GfB6sC4NJQvSI2ewbQrDNA.review_text: I went here with a large party a few months ago and we had to wait 2 hours for a table.  The food was pretty decent, mostly southern food.   They have good drinks and it's a fun place and close to Yoshi's.   --Update 11.1.08  I went here for a drink with some friends.  The Matre'd overheard me saying that I ended us waiting over 2 hours for a table.  First he gave us a free desert which was amazing.  As well as at the end, giving us our drinks for free.  This was a really great gesture and I am definitely going back here to try their food again next time I go to Yoshi's.

b0ZRfMh7SJdti19nmmtqgA.review_text: GROWN & SEXY- SOUTHERN CITY FLAIR! My fiance and I went for dinner at drinks this past Friday and had a fabulous time. Here's the run-down:  PARKING: This is the only drawback to anything in the fillmore. Parking is on the street, valet is available but pricey. We spent 20 minutes looking for parking and found it about 2 blocks away.   FOOD: Having lived in Louisiana for four years and having both sides of my family deeply rooted in the south....I am SUPER SERIOUS about my soul food. 1300 DELIVERS! My fiance and I both ordered the BBQ shrimp and grits. The dish was very flavorful and good to the last drop. We also had the greens which were also delightfully flavored and tasty.  DRINKS: I ordered the Tea something or another (alcoholic) and loved the flavor! I hate when I order a girlie cocktail and can only taste alcohol. If I wanted a shot...I would order one. My fiance had a Key Lime Pie drink which he enjoyed so much he ordered another right before leaving.  SERVICE: Our waitress (Chloe) was delightful and attentive. I always like it when your server knows when to make a joke and suggest a menu item with perfect timing. We made reservations for 8pm and were seated right away.   AMBIANCE: Low lighting, dark wood paneling, and plenty of pictures from old fillmore jazz personalities make this a beautiful romantic place to go for date night or happy hour with friends. If it's good enough for DA MAYOR (Willie Brown was seated at the table adjacent to ours) it's good enough for me.  Why not five stars? Difficult parking and a waiter (not Chloe) forgetting to pack up our shrimp and grit leftovers left us slightly disappointed. WE WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK SOON!

VGwMEz3BpRfgJuUgx5RpMw.review_text: This review is for the Gospel Sunday brunch. We didn't quite enjoy the band as it was really loud. There's a $6/person charge for the music. The food was good, but nothing to write home about. We had: - Barbecue Shrimp N' Creamy Grits 15 - Black Skillet Fried Chicken, Buttermilk Whipped Potatoes, Pan Gravy 19 - 1300 Mimosa  Sparkling Wine, Orange Juice, Splash of Grand Marnier 9

Xj0O2l0bp633ebmG468aZw.review_text: Nice place. Beautiful hip, but cozy, contemporary space. Delicious food! Shrimp and grits were the best. Loved the seared arctic char!

8mKKD5KCSMsu0T5QMK10ng.review_text: I sat at the bar... where I believe you get the best service and view of the restaurant in whole.  We were lucky to have David, their general manager, behind the bar helping us out and engaging in great food conversation.  Everything that came out was perfect.  We hesitated in ordering too much of the fried goodness, but had to get the battered shrimp and fried green tomatoes.  The shrimp were fried perfectly, the tomatoes, as well, with the perfect crust which is hard to obtain with tomatoes.  The lavender sauce paired wonderfully.  For the main, we got the skate wing, which luckily was not drowned in brown butter sauce like many places do.  It was probably our least favorite of everything, but I'm an app girl myself.  Oh, and we really wanted to try the cornmeal panzanella but weren't in the mood for the quail, which it came with- so ordered a side and it was to die for.  Thanks 1300 for a wonderful meal.  We will definitely be back to try your bar and lounge menu.

R_DWZz6z5yHFkaBB7O1ZcA.review_text: Awesome food, service and music!  Don't hesitate to go.

zDltf7SGyDANcA6ndZkF7A.review_text: I had never heard of this restaurant prior to a week ago. My friend suggested we dine there and unjustifiably, I was skeptical. The restaurant is located on Eddy and Fillmore in the heart of the Western Addition which, if you've never been, isn't the best neighborhood.  I should be smacked in the face for being so judgmental because I absolutely adored this place. Everything was great: service, food, the live jazz music, the comfy seating...I could go on.  I ordered the short ribs with a side of brussel sprouts. The brussel sprouts were a tad on the greasy side and I felt, had more onions than sprouts, but were satisfying nonetheless. The short ribs were amazing with the meat falling of the bone at a mere poke of the fork.  For dessert we had the sweet potato souffle. While I really appreciated it for what it was and I'm glad I can say I've tried it, I more than likely wouldn't order this again. For me at least, sweet potato isn't something I crave over and over again :)

E3I4u84J5j3_DO3xjulCmQ.review_text: The lounge and setting of the restaurant was very nice/upscale.  Very good drinks and the wait staff and bartender were knowledgeable of the menu/drinks/history/neighborhood.  The only thing that wasn't the best was the food.  It wasn't bad, but when you go to a southern place you have to judge it by the fried chicken, which I wasn't blown away by.   The shrimp and grits and the mushroom and grits were great tough. 3.5 stars

EO47ao8qAykoK1PGstY4JQ.review_text: Comfort food with an upscale twist. The Bar is a little small but the lounge area makes up for that. I hear they normally have a live band so I will definitely be back to try it out. Wine and liquor selection was awesome and or waiter was even better. Didn't hoover but was always available. The only thing that sorted sucked was the private even that ordered all the fired chicken! If you are a comfort/soul food restaurant I feel like you should never run out of fried chicken. So I guess I'll have to ask my mom to make hers. All in all a great experience next time they better have fried chicken!

V2ux0XsXWMgue-fUQB5Uhg.review_text: The food was fantastic and I highly recommend the fried chicken.  We also had the corn pudding and mac n' cheese which were both delicious.  However, my biggest complaint with this place is that they totally overcharged us - I discovered that the amount they charged to my credit card statement did NOT match the amount I was charged plus the tip on my receipt.  Really shady.  I'm disputing the partial charge with my credit card company but wanted to warn others too just in case.

hicTosabEy471XhhWwghzQ.review_text: Went after a show at Yoshi's; second visit thought I would write a review  The interior is perfect, dark (but warm), comfy seating and intimate.  Our waiter was prompt and courteous as we ordered drinks.  Is there crack in the cornbread?  It is sooo addictive - plus that honey butter is sooo awesome; lots of self control not to get some more...  I got the short ribs and my friend the fried chicken; I have to say the fried chicken was perfect, the batter divine - all in all the best fried chicken ever (and I was on business travel in Atlanta for a year).  SHort ribs were great too - falling off the bone tender and over chive mashed potatoes - yummy.  Of course we had way too much food and our clairvoyant waiter suggested that we take the rest home so we would have room for dessert; we both were scpetical that anything else could fit but I went with his suggestion of the banana cream pie.  He was spot on; it was actually 'light' and didn't weigh us down like most desserts; haven't had one this good since Melbourne (that's right Brian)....  Defintiely worth the rating and I would recommend the shrimp grits that I had last time too....

RuMTrArIbDDFHlXJYPZFfA.review_text: I came in for the Sunday night live music.  Great music!  I love the quality of the furniture and the look of the decor.  Tip: Don't sit too close to the band or you won't be able to hear your own conversation with your dining partner.  Cocktails were very well done.  I got the Hennessy Sidecar (pretty good), she got the Key Lime Pie (amazing!).  I highly recommend the Key Lime Pie.  Appetizers: Butternut Squash Soup with Apple and Creme Fraiche, Sauteed Mushrooms with Mascarpone.  Both were exemplary.  Portion size, texture, and taste were perfect.  Entrees: Red Snapper with Brussel Sprouts, Apple, and Bacon.  I would've preferred the brussel sprouts whole (or half, perhaps), rather than chopped into bits.  I got the Surf n Turf, which had scallops, foie, and I think pulled pork?  It was really good, no complaints.  Service was a big standout, probably the best service I've had in the month of November.  I didn't get our server's name, but she was serving the lounge on Sunday, November 15.  She was very genuine, helpful, and had great timing.

RON1XlAe5SqXjPNt5FWX2A.review_text: I loved 1300 at Fillmore. The ambience was warm and inviting, and the (I think) chef came out to speak to many of the other diners. I had the maple-syrup slow braised short ribs with mashed potatoes. They literally were 'falling off the bone'. Hell, they weren't even ON the bone to begin with.  In fact, they'd stuck the bone right in the middle of the ribs, I think to make a point. They were unbelievably tender and flavored just right. I am also on a huge brussel sprouts kick, so I ordered the roasted brussels sprouts side. Wow.  Those were amazing too!  My date and I shared a really outstanding bottle of wine, a little expensive but lord, it was worth it.  It was one of those dining experiences that make you smile.  I'm still thinking about that dinner three weeks later.  Now if I could just get someone else to pay for dinner again....

_BBFY6sBot2j1iY-UDfdxg.review_text: I went with a party of 22 to dine here the night before Valentines Day. It was packed but thankfully we had our own private room to ourselves. We received a pre-fix menu. I had Sauteed Wild Mushroom with Grits, Fried Chicken with Mashed Potatoes, and Biscuits, lastly, Apple Bread Pudding with Vanilla bean Ice Cream.  The concept of Mushroom and Grits is unconventional and had white truffle oil surrounding the dish which made it sooo yummy. This was my favorite dish of the night. The fried chicken dish served huge portions. It could be shared with two. The mashed potatoes lacked flavor but the skin of the chicken was my favorite part! Lastly, the bread pudding was wonderful! They topped the crispy bread with savory apples.  Their culture and staff are inviting and unique. If you are ever hanging around fillmore and have a craving for some comfort food this place is it!

iK4QagEgn0q30ys4bhBb1A.review_text: Food was good. Rack of ribs were substantial. BBQ sauce really needed some work. Short ribs were good - nice flavor and wonderfully done. Corn bread was amazing and the Jalapeno Jelly was great as well.   Service was OK. Decor was nice.   Bad = mixed drinks were awful. Beer List = Awful. Drink Wine if you can.

clFehAg0EJkBuTuOb5exKw.review_text: I went out to dinner on Sunday evening w/ my finace and loved the location. Just right off the Fillmore/Eddy intersection, fantastic who could ask for more. By the way I was planning to slam down a few cocktails so I had to rely heavily on the the #22.  We met sous chef Mark Danziger who is super nice and gave us a run through about the menu. As noted by all of the other reviewers the staff was wonderful, polite and full of life. It was a great experience.  First off my beau and I had the BBQ shrimp with grits, fried okra and the shrimp hush puppies. All carefully prepared. For the entry my man had the fried chicken plate with a side of greens and I had, of course, the Maple slow braised short ribs. Really good stuff. The meat was soft and  and the mashed potatoes had the best balance of salty and buttery. Delectable !!! I thought my gut was going to pop but we ended up ordering the Mississippi mud pie. "M... crooked letter, hump back, hump back, crooked letter. Okay I felt like a hump back after eating everything seriously I was so tired but smiling all the way through it. People if you plan to go to Yoshi's or you're just around the Filmore, skip over and try some southern lovin'  at 1300 Fillmore.

fSPvk0Z_9eWm2kkUvhDJeg.review_text: It's not fair for me to review this restaurant. I'm from the South and I come from a family of excellent Southern chefs, a few of whom have owned their own restaurants. Anywho, the food here is pretty good. It's slightly reminiscent of real Southern food, but only slightly. I, or my mom, or my niece or maybe a hundred other people in my family could do better for cheaper. But in SF this is a pretty decent option for Southern-style food.

w1VEx5DWK5j0CPuejatsvQ.review_text: This review is for my second dining experience at 1300. My first experience was a reservation I booked for my hubby's birthday. The restaurant ambiance is very relaxing, and romantic. I was greeted by the hostess by name, and we were seated in a very comfortable area. The leather seating is so comfy you can fall asleep after devouring one of their delicious meals. Our server was absolutely great.  She was very polite, and attentive without being overbearing.   My second experience was with my brother. I wanted to treat him to dinner at 1300 since I enjoyed the first experience so much. Once again we had the same server who remembered me. We were sent some mini appetizers that was compliments of the chef. At the end of our dinner they sent out free beignets at the end of our meal. Hey, I love free stuff.   I would definitely recommend this restaurant for a scrumptious dinner.

7p1RiSb8DPhcXCeqcycEYA.review_text: Okay, it's a bit pricey. But the service is great, the food is phenomenal and my stomach was happy. Add the live jazz and you have a recipe for greatness!   I didn't give it five stars because I have only visited once and don't think it's fair to give five stars without a 3 time perfection rating! LOL   The BBQ shrimp and grits is wonderful! The fried chicken is a must have...everything we had was wonderful! I enjoyed my evening a great deal.

D-rKFBb1s4_4vpDA9Wjiog.review_text: Fried chicken was a little to expiremental and not that tasty (too dry).  Everything was ok, but rather over priced.

pv7yUP2F4vN0WanV_kWWnw.review_text: I have been back to 1300 on Fillmore twice more and love, love, love this restaurant.  My last two experiences the service has been great.  I love the sitting area where you can have drinks before or after and they make a great spicy drink with red pepper that is phenomenal.    The boiled peanuts are a fun bar treat and shrimp and grits and the short ribs dish are both to die for.  Great job 1300!

e1wITjiqK6Os1DHMarGpog.review_text: Fried chicken fried chicken fried chicken.  Got it?  Delicious food from start to finish.  Cornbread with spicy jelly - yum.  Poached egg salad with bacon vinegarette - outstanding.  Fried chicken - wanted to lick the plate.  It's decorated with a homey atmosphere.  No big issues except we had multiple waiters which was a bit confusing.

gx-l78IQFqJGCrhKKMmq0w.review_text: After trying to figure out the closest place to Yoshi's for some good food and drinks I stumbled upon 1300 via fellow YELP-ers. I figured me and my bestie, and younger sis could give it a try before the 8 pm Mint Condition show next door. We did not make reservations as we were all unsure of our arrival time. We came in through the large wooden doors and were happy to find the environment warm, dark, and sexy. A large party of twenty-somethings walked in just prior to us and were trying to decide whether or not to dine in the lounge or the actual restaurant. Since there was a wait they chose the lounge as did we, and we all made our way to the candlelit lounge with its large comfy chairs, and small tables. As soon as we sat down, our hostess, a very friendly young woman came over to ask if we wanted any drinks. This is where the party began ladies and gentleman as the specialty cocktail menu is a mouthwatering selection of libations! My bestie and I got the French 75, while my sister went with the waitresses suggestion of Honey Sweet Ice Tea. The cocktails were delicious and potent, which some of you know is hard to achieve. We ordered from the lounge menu, as we were running behind for our show BUT we when our waitress heard our concerns she assured us that she could get our in and out on time. We kept our order for the Baked Oysters, Sauteed Wild Mushrooms & Grits, Fat Fries, and Black Skillet Fried Chicken Strips and ordered another round. After some thought about it, and reminiscing on my bestie's Dad's fried chicken we ordered the entree of Black Skillet Fried Chicken with mashed potatoes and pan gravy as well. Let me just say, I don't run around giving undeserved props for food. Now that we've established that, let me tell you that this place was awesome!!! Five stars for the food which I have now dubbed southern, sophisticated soul! Five stars for the waitress who never missed a beat, kept the drinks coming, and her overall professional AND friendly demeanor. And five stars for ambiance from the decor, to the dim lighting. The chef even made the rounds at one point in the evening and said hello to some of us dining.

ZpjAzfkVSSFljqxXGUWpIw.review_text: I wouldn't call myself a regular, but I've dined at 1300 about 10 times since its opening. And the more I go, the less I expect, the less I get...  It was always on my list of SF restaurants with great ambiance and  good hearty food. Up until last night -  which made me create Yelp account and write my first review.  Managers, owners, please read and react!  The great, one of a kind restaurant of Southern cuisine in SF is about to go bottom up. Not in the near future, since it's still quite packed, but in the foreseeable one, due to the absolute lack ability of maintaining a respectable service. Again, I'm referring not to just one occurrence, but to a chain of events.  First of all - hold time, to be seated - if you were told that your table will be ready in 10-15 min, don't expect it earlier then 45. Last night during our half hour wait, a suggestion from the host came up: " since your table was given to the other party with reservation, go ahead and start ordering some appetizers from the bar". I understand that bartenders are usually expected to pour drinks and not necessarily be familiar with the rest of the restaurant's servings, but wouldn't you expect him to take your order of 3 starters for 3 people even if it was asked to be dairy free (since one of us is allergic to it)? Do you want to know the response? - "Not possible, everything is already mixed-in; moreover, 90 % of our menu contain dairy, so you won't be able to eat here". Ha!! 40 min into our wait and we are out on the street again, looking for a place to dine.  Too bad I'm not going to have their wonderful cornbread with chili-cranberry compote anytime soon, along with  other great stuff on their often changing menu. I would only go to 1300 again if I am not hungry in the first place, without any plans for at least upcoming 2,5 hours and NO expectations whatsoever.

RJQTcJVlBsJ3_Yo0JSFQQg.review_text: Mmmmm...  Bone-in medium rare pork chop, creamy cheese polenta, wilted greens, and peach compote... 1300 isn't playing around!  A little over half way through my dinner I couldn't tell if the dish was starting to get too heavy for me or if i was just getting full. I think it was a combination of both but it really didn't matter because I cleaned my whole plate.   I tried a piece of my girlfriend's braised short rib and was glad that I did. It was tender, tasty, juicy... everything a braised short rib should be.  Service was excellent. The hostess greeted us with a warm smile and even suggested that we eat in the lounge area since we were the last reservation and the lounge was empty. The lounge was warm and full of character with lit-up pictures all over the wall. We accepted her offer and had the whole lounge to ourselves which was really cool. However, what wasn't cool was trying to eat dinner off of a tiny table sitting on a couch... felt like bumming it at home on the couch with a bowl of instant ramen watching TV. We really didn't think that one through. Oh well, we know better for next time.    The food and service was great and I think we'll be back for more.

seALfO5AR6EqcIEECs9WdQ.review_text: Basically this is how it's going to go:  You brag to your friends how you have reservations at this great new place that serves ... Fancy BBQ you say. They doubt and doubt they do. You bring someone adventurous and order:  Barbecue Shrimp and Grits... you keep yourself from licking the bowl on the spot. You take it around the corner where they can't see you.  You order the Maple Syrup Slow Braised Beef Short Ribs. Your date will look across the table longingly at your ribs. Do not let her eat them. They are rightfully yours, and they are tasty. She will ask you how they are expecting for you to offer the goods. Don't make eye contact. You made eye contact, didn't you? Ok, give her a little.  She'll have ordered the Southern Exposed Black Skillet Fried Organic Chicken. You'll revel in the number of adjectives while staring at the truffled mashed potatoes. Ok, now's a good time to trade some of your ribs for the mashers.  Then for dessert you'll split the chocolate beignets or the sweet potato souffl. At this point you'll have forgotten to pay your bill, and you'll have a bottle of campari in your hand as you head out singing an ella fitzgerald song in your falsetto that only you and your shower have heard before.

7a4xLEk5ikg0fnpnErWbpw.review_text: Went here for dinner last night. Waited in the lounge and had a beer while our table was being prepped. Great to see the live jazz band in front of the wall of photos...was very relaxing and the whole 'vibe' was just so pleasant, even though the place was busy.  Our meal was great, especially the shrimp and grits! My god man...they were delicious. We left stuffed to the core but pleased. Would definitely come back sometime.

GEgIF8FFtNB_rJ5uvGKLdg.review_text: Meh... food was okay but nothing great or mind blowing.   Their desserts redeemed them some points but the service was just not friendly. The staff hardly smiled, probably due to stress or whatnot and I can understand how work can be stressful sometimes but it just ruined the whole dining experience.   I probably wouldn't come back because prices aren't worth the quality in taste of food. Not to mention, they had charged my credit card double of what was on the receipt. Not super thrilled about that cause it's just another thing I have to take care of on top of the many things I already have to do. Blehh...

dh2fVHvb9EC9uJVjD2_DCA.review_text: I am definitely still a fan.  After seeing Bottle Shock, our group of friends were seriously jonesing for Napa Chardonneys.  We were not super hungry, but I fell in love with the corn bread all over again.  The service was super-enthusiastic this time and really turned an impulsive last minute stop into a special topper to a fun evening.

DfcdoGzz39FBS6o8U7ZyOQ.review_text: Went here for Thanksgiving with Mom and the boy.  They do a $49 prix fixe menu (with an optional $21 wine pairing, which we opted not to do).  We got to the restaurant a little before our reservation and were greeted by the hostess and encouraged to wait in their small front lounge.  The space is beautiful and we all order drinks (I got a beer, nothing wrong there, Mom got a martini, and the boy got wine).  After we were seated, our super friendly waiter took our order (for the appetizer, I got the shrimp and grits, Mom got the fried quail salad, and the boy got the squash soup, for the main, we all got the turkey platter, and for dessert, we got two of the pumpkin samplers and one of the chocolate pana cotta). We also got a bottle of wine (which was cheaper than doing the wine pairing).  The food came quick and WOW was it good.  The meal started with a complimentary order of housemade corn bread with jalapeno relish.  It was delish.  The shrimp and grits were perfect - creamy grits and spicy shrimp. SO tasty.  The quail salad was delicious and the soup was good - not too sweet.  The turkey platter came with a little bit of mashed potatoes, sweet potatoes, brussel sprouts, cranberries, cornbread stuffing, and white and dark meat turkey. All were delicious. Seriously.  The desserts were also amazing. My chocolate pana cotta just melted in my mouth, it was so smooth and so sweet. Wow.  The pumpkin platter was cool - candied pumpkin seeds, pumpkin ice cream, pumpkin tartlet, cookie, and truffle, cranberry sorbet and candied cranberries.  Just a little of everything, but it was all really good.  By the time we wandered out, we were stuffed.  Yeah, it was kind of expensive, but for this southern boy missing home, it was a great way to spend Thanksgiving.

yxWNUr-K2aD8jiwztDPU0g.review_text: This review is just based on our visit to the bar for a drink and some appies, but I will definitely be back!  I love the vibe here - old school/modern, if that makes sense.  The lounge area it set up with couches and club chairs - perfect for a date or a small group of friends.  The service was great and the two apps we tried were yummy too.  I could have sat in that chair all night, sipping champagne and chatting with jazz playing in the background.  I will return for dinner and hope that experience will be as good as my first!

PJGD7zKksRjePnAIppFoiQ.review_text: My bf loves this place on Fridays because of Hot Pocket, a band that plays hip hop jazz music. Sadly, hot pocket wasn't playing today, so we just got a couple drinks. Bf recommends the Hennessy sidecar. Apparently it's really good, but I'm a girl so I can't appreciate strong drinks. I had the pear flower which was sufficiently fruity and yummy. If only the drinks were so expensive here, we would have had a couple more.   Bottom line: pricey but good drinks, about $12+ for a cocktail.

mD7Rg2_NtFWEErFlONzBww.review_text: This place has some of the best food (fries, chicken, short rib) I've had in a while. Drinks from the bar are pretty good and they have a pretty good menu selection. The atmosphere is tight and they have a really good vibe going.  I've been here a few times and would agree with the others that have mentioned issues with the service. Just seemed like the waiter/waitress wasn't that interested in helping us. Had to ask for my check every time. The parking is a little tight but Yoshi's is right next door so I can understand that.  Overall, if you like soul food, you gotta try this place at least once!

TDnoRfgfdcCMxiIQDsH04Q.review_text: I've been here several times. Service has always been courteous to ask if we were going to a show next door at Yoshi's or to a movie at Kabuki after, and help us adjust our menu choices to match what the kitchen could produce within that timeframe. Their appetizers are also usually good enough where I usually order several instead of committing to an entree.   Located literally at #1300 on Fillmore, the really dark wooden and leather paneling creates a cozy and luxe interior. Like a cigar bar without the smoke clinging to all the furniture. Real votives instead of the flickering electronic ones, cute that they use dry lentils as a base in the votiveholder instead of rocks.  We decided to come here recently to celebrate a friend's birthday. Originally a party of 12, we quickly blossomed to a roaring group of 20 on the actual night. Considering that the dining floor and bar area were not well built to take on this large a crowd, 1300 managed to perform beautifully.   We were crammed shoulder-to-shoulder at their special large table, there were partitions to separate us from the rest of the dining floor but the noise level still made it hard to hold conversation with anyone farther than my immediate neighbor. At one point we all started randomly switching seats to talk to one person or other and try to keep our noise level down. It made it confusing to the servers, but they accomodated us as best they could.  Note: Before they all come find me and kill me, this does not mean I'm recommending you to make this the perfect spot to crash when you have this large a party. This was a rather unusual situation that I doubt they'd want to handle everyday.  As if our group wasn't complicated enough, everyone wanted to order their own appetizer. To synchronize serving that many people not once, but twice (again for the entree course) was no easy feat. I think even the manager was involved, lending in a hand to service this oversized mess of a group.  The food has always been enjoyable. Upstyle lighter versions of southern comfort fare, I love almost every appetizer on this menu. From their buttery wild mushrooms atop creamy marscapone hominy grits, soft sweet potato gnocchi, interesting fresh water shrimp hushpuppies, to their little biscuits with butter and homemade chili jam. The warm poached egg salad was really messy to look at but my friend loved it. People were ultimately passing little bitefuls all over the table.  As for the entrees, luckily for the kitchen, the majority of us ordered either the fried chicken, maple-syrup braised shortribs, or pan-roasted snapper with apple cider form and apple bacon brussel sprouts. One lady ordered a lone hamburger that came several minutes after all of ours were served. "Oohs" and "aahs" echoed around the room as the dishes were put in front of them. Various people were quickly whipping out their camera phones to take a shot.   Although everyone was staring at the food, I caught a glance up at the server. When the girls clapped their hands together and exclaimed how beautiful the dish looked, the way his eyes lit up and a huge happy beaming smile appeared on his face said it all. These are people here who love the experience they create, a passion for the food that they make, and it's reflected in their work. The entrees were yummy and everyone was happy (although I could've gone without the foam on the fish).    Thank you as always for a delightful food experience.

swocJWD8R1iH20-lveXh0Q.review_text: Wow!  I came here for HH with a friend and was surprised how nice, very nice the interior was.  I was then further surprised by how small our bill came to.  We shared the fat fries which we made sure weren't call that because they were extra fatty.  They're actually just large cut fries, thank goodness.  We also shared the rib sliders that came 3 per order.  Even though they were recommended by the waiter, the sliders were our least favorite dish.  The meat was dry and the sauce too sweet.  We also shared the mushroom grits.  I could have eaten a whole 2nd dish myself!  The parmesan crisp was a nice touch too.  Add two glasses of wine and we walked out of there paying about $30.  Let's go again!

Ef1SHUZY5pxWAJFmv9hgfQ.review_text: I had a dinner party here for my husband's birthday.  They serve some of the best soul food I've had!  They also have a live band in the lounge that was amazing!  So if your looking for good food and live music, and dancing, this is the place to go!

0I99ibr1vy7yiHIUdo3Zyw.review_text: Incredibly delicious Southern home-style comfort food, but polished up and gentrified.  The result?  Clean, refined, simply amazing.  There's such a great ambiance going on at 1300: great over-sized light fixtures with paisley and polka dot prints in muted beige colors, long and luxurious sheer curtains that hang over floor to ceiling windows.  Beautiful.  My one complaint is the chairs: they were a little too high for my liking but eventually I acclimated.  Get the hush puppies and the fried chicken.  They are done up right and are uber-tasty.  I ordered the Halibut which came plated on a bed of asparagus and I did not go home disappointed.  My fave?  Get the Fillmore Kiss cocktail!  Think: whiskey, peach and pink lemonade.  Delish!

MF8hfjzIVrCiKbyBekI-og.review_text: Had this place bookmarked for a very long time. Glad I actually went out of my way and came here after work tonight. I don't think they have happy hour prices on drinks but drinks very very well made and lounge had a very nice ambiance. We ordered fat fries- easily best fries ever! I had to order two more orders! Sliders and chicken tenders were tasty as well

wZ57iVBf0tXpBMaPZHrEQA.review_text: This is definitely one of the more affordable fine dining establishments that I have attended to. Eat a ton, make your stomach feel like it's going to explode, and your wallet won't be too hurt in the process.  I found 1300 on Fillmore by Yelping "truffled mac n cheese", so it was the only thing running through my mind when I was asked, "What would you like to drink today?" "Truffled mac n cheese, please!" They wouldn't let me drink their truffled mac n cheese, so I got a pomegranate margarita. I'm crazy about sugared/salted rims, so it made me a little excited. I also had a sip of the Manhattan, which was of course, blegh (only someone as stupid as me would order it two days after realizing that it was terrible). As someone once told me, "That shit will make you grow a mustache." Touche.  For the appetizer, we had the quail. It was fried to a crispy goodness, complimented with a stupid (healthy) salad with bacon bits. The corn bread was sooo yummy! It was moist and fresh and warm. Mmm! It was served with butter and red sauce, but was perfectly fine by itself. My scallops were soft and came with a sauce that tasted perfect with my mashed potatoes. I couldn't get enough of the mashed potatoes! Truffled mac and cheese was not as expected, but still great. The truffleness still came out subtly, but I wished it was a little more cheesy.  Dessert was very meh. We had the Kentucky bourbon cake (to my mistake, which I chose) and the chocolate beignets. Nothing to rave about, but nothing to complain about.  The ambiance was pretty good. It wasn't too loud, and the lighting was really dim (my kind of place!). In retrospect, I'm not sure I'll be back. This crowd is a little too homogeneous for me... There were only a small amount of people who didn't fit in.. And they had their own private dining room with glass windows and curtains. A bit discomforting for my taste.  Despite that, I'd still give 1300 4 stars!

iFVzps70vJVc7Ss3xhsxSA.review_text: Our company summer party was hosted here over the weekend.  I came expecting lukewarm and dry popcorn chicken and celery sticks, but nope, I got spoiled with barbecued shrimp and grits (easily my favorite dish of the night), mushroom crostini, crab cakes, and a full-on dessert bar.  The event was open bar, and I'm pretty sure we drank the  bar dry.  I spent most of the night trying to hide from my alcoholic co-workers who insisted on taking shots of Patron until our pores were oozing with booze.  Big kudos to the bartenders.  God knows we kept them busy all night long.  Classy decor, yummy hors d'oeuvres, and strong drinks - could a girl ask for more?

qSb6-Vmyv42-5f-GhminPg.review_text: After a special event nearby, I had the greatest evening at the bar of 1300 On Fillmore with a wonderful and brilliant bartender named Nikki. She was holding it down, working the bar, the lounge, and serving us all her favorites from the menu (and one of us is a vegetarian!). She is so entertaining and fun to be with, that we stayed a lot longer than we had planned. In the midst of all this, a sea of beautiful Black men arrived in suits and enjoyed the ambiance of the lounge. Great night all together and will return many times. Food and drinks amazing. Thank you.

zqo2nhiXQgugTARoP4LUVw.review_text: Went on a Sunday for gospel brunch. AWESOME! Live gospel music, great FOOD and great atmosphere. I had the fried chicken and mash potatoes...BOMB! My man had the shrimp and grits...he was happy with his meal. Planning on going again soon!

b6_gR3caZcaf3PIein5ktA.review_text: I adore this place!   Food Starters:  - Complimentary Corn Bread with a side of strawberry jalapeno jam. I have to refrain from filling up on the yummy stuff   - Barbecue Shrimp N' Creamy Grits are delish!  - Sautéed Wild Mushrooms, Herbs, Mascarpone Yellow Hominy Grits are a great pairing with dinner.   - Maple Syrup Slow Braised Beef Short Rib is the best Short Rib I have ever had!!! It melts in your mouth. Served with Crispy Onion Rings and Buttermilk-Chive Mashed Potatoes. I go to this place almost for this plate alone.   This place is a great spot to go for an intimate dinner. On weekend evenings they almost always have live jazz at the bar. I would highly recommend them.

2LGsEZRSOI_zEfowjbP0bw.review_text: This is a great date spot, nice vibe mellow, relaxed, comfy and cool.  The food and service was outstanding.  We went there on a Tue night so the place was not too busy.  The wifey and I split the pork belly for out appetizer.  The portion was not large but big enough to give us both a fair taste and to get our mouths watering for the mains.  It was tender with just enough fat to give you that full pork flavor.  For the mains we both ordered the braised short ribs.  We usually order two different mains as we like to share and taste more than one dishes but this time that wasn't going to happen as we both wanted to have our own full dish.  It was a good call too since this dish pretty much ranks up there as one of my favorite all time.  As others have mentioned they also give you these wonderful cornbread with what I think is pimento spread.  Warning don't fill up even though you just want to keep eating it.   Overall, amazing dinner.  I would have to come back to validate but for now this place maybe going into my to 5 restaurants.

lJIwrjiTjyAGsTE51hQj8Q.review_text: Very disappointed.  Shrimp and grits good but very small portion.  Corn bread delicious. Bloody Mary watered down. Desserts poor.  Service poor. We went to hear gospel singing and instead music was mostly blues.  We felt like we were being herded in and out.  Won't be going back.

mvRlBcAO6b97L1Dw7xIr9g.review_text: I had an enjoyable evening at 1300 on Fillmore.  The ambiance is lush and a little formal, and I thought it was a nice change from the typical SF eclectic restaurant style.  We sat in the dining room, which is very quiet even with several tables filled, and the lounge looked comfortable with the same dark, lush look.  The waitstaff were great, made us feel taken care of.  The wine list (by the glass) seemed to be priced about right, and for my level of wine-drinker, I was very satisfied.  All California wines so far as I could tell, and the two we ordered turned out to be good selections.   The food had its high points, but was inconsistent.  I will say that the pork belly starter was lovely, perfectly cooked fried duck egg with butter beans and a good sized portion of pork belly.  They let the flavors speak for themselves in this dish and it's perfect, kind of rich and primitive tasting.  Freshwater shrimp hush-puppies were also good, fried pefectly in a light batter and paired with a tasty sauce that could have had a little more kick for my palate.  The cornbread was excellent, served with the awesomest jalapeno catsup.  I wouldn't mind some catsup to take home.   Things went downhill somewhat with the main course.  The boneless fried chicken half was too salty for me, particularly the thigh.  The breast was more tolerable and would have been very good except for the saltiness.  It came with mashed potatoes that could have used something, some garlic or mustard or something.  The portion was enormous.  Two of us couldn't finish it.  I was basically stuffed, but I always feel so cheated if I don't order dessert, so I went for the chocolate filled beignets with chocolate sauce and some kind of coffee flavored sauce that was almost like a pudding, I forget now what they called it.  The coffee stuff was weird and not in a way that made you want to eat more.  The chocolate sauce lacked richness for me.  The beignet was kind of overly solid and lacked lightness.  A definite disappointment.   Although it was a nice night, I'll probably be shopping around a bit the next time I want to get some high-end soul food.  For this town, the food, although there were highlights, just wasn't quite good enough considering the prices at this spot.  We had the savored.com discount, which I recommend if you're interested in visiting 1300.

_DsbAfA1kTbVeV3J7f5tGQ.review_text: My wife, Carol, took me for a Birthday Treat.  We were seated right away, although the room was quite full. Thankfully, it was big enough and soft enough so we could speak to one another and our waiter in normal tones. Carol said she read that it was a soul food place, and indeed, the clientele spanned a wide range of age and ethnicity.   The waiter and sommelier couldn't have been more personable and helpful. We felt good before our first bite. Well, okay, we had been munching on lovely light slices of cornbread with butter and jalapeno jelly.  The Bourbon Braised Pork Belly with Shelled White Bean Puree appetizer was artfully presented and tasted as good as it was described, and just the right size for the two of us.  Carol ordered an entrée of Maple Syrup Slow Braised Beef Short Ribs, Crispy Onion Rings and Buttermilk-Chive Mash Potatoes. Since that was taken out of play, I decided on Fulton Valley Farms Organic Black Skillet Fried Chicken, Buttermilk Whipped Potatoes and Pan Gravy even (or maybe especially) though I was warned that I must "allow for a 20 minute preparation time" for that dish. Hey, Southern Fried Chicken... what better place to have it. We also ordered a Caramelized Sweet Onion Ham Hock Braised Greens side dish, mostly because I have all those ingredients at home and maybe I can recreate it.  We shared a bottle of Tejada Temprinillo, a medium bodied red wine made from a traditional Spanish grape in Lake County.  Our entrees and side dish arrived shortly after the appetizer was cleared. Each was presented to tickle our taste buds. I had three pieces of chicken, a leg, a thigh and a breast, all boned and covered with a spiced thick breading. The meat inside was juicy and each bite brought home the idea of Southern fried, with no lingering grease. I ate slowly, wanting to savor what I could - there was no way in the world I could eat it all.   Carol gave me a taste of her short ribs - we're not ones to share entrees, but an exchange of bites is okay, sometimes - it was as good as I imagined, but I was into chicken tonight.   The side of greens - though excellent - was unnecessary. There was quite enough food, and variety, without it. The waiter took our copious leftovers to package for take-home.  I wanted the apple bread pudding for dessert, it just seemed like the right thing. Carol felt it would be too heavy. Au contraire... it was light and tender and a perfect finishing touch.  After we paid the check and were ready to leave, the waiter brought out our leftovers. It just put the cap on the superb service we had enjoyed throughout the evening... they brought the stuff when we were ready, not when they were ready.

BXtevhFyGmpEg8P59rsTlA.review_text: Great. Great. Great. Great. Great. Great. Great. And another...  ...great.  I loved this restaurant so much. I went there for Christmas Eve dinner and it blew me away. Incredible service, delicious food; it was everything you could ask for in a special occasion SF restaurant.   The interior was beautiful and as we ate, the TV had a slideshow of vintage jazz music photos. Great fried chicken. Great grits.   So much to love. Go to this place today!!!

Lw6agCKyeuFa0yR_JzQALw.review_text: Great brunch with many good innovative items to choose from, pancakes, standard egg dishes with bacon or benedicts, fried chicken and salads. The music is good and a nice place to take older relatives for an "upscale" brunch if in town.

GjqTvkCX9IVCwIssi8QtHA.review_text: We finally decided to try this restaurant because we were in the neighborhood and had read some of the great yelp reviews. The restaurant was very nicely put together and the ambiance was very relaxing. However, the food was way overpriced and not very good.   Fried chicken - very juicy and tender. easily the best dish of the evening. however, the crust was very, very thick and not light and crispy   Ribs - very dry and zero flavor. we had to dunk it in the sauce just to wash it down   Catfish - it was served lukewarm and everything else on the plate was cold   We went elsewhere for dessert. Could not take the chance of spending more money on underwhelming food.   I was very surprised at the good reviews on yelp

cvkFlsJNZb_BSK8eZtcgZg.review_text: Putting starters in condiment cups and making 'Soul Food' into mini-sized portions isn't clever or groundbreaking in any way. Pretentious, underwhelmed and overpriced. $150 bill for Popeyes or KFC level quality. Loud and not worth the wait or price point. Pass.

Te18TxvzfLomGE56N7s3Dw.review_text: I came here to celebrate my big 3-0 with my friends.  Unfortunately it didn't work out too well the first week as I got sick and had to cancel.  Even though I canceled last minute, 1300 was very understanding.  My friends and I came back the next week and it was a very memorable evening.  Service was top notch, food was very good, and they even brought out two desserts for me.  Whether it's a regular dinner or celebrating a special occasion, I definitely recommend it.

wCYNDnaVnvqqrLXjwVKeIg.review_text: Uhmmm...have y'all heard of KFC or Popeyes?? seriously the fried chicken at this place sucks!! I mean for $23?? I def could've bought myself ALOT of KFC n Popeyes with that $23! me n my cousins went here to try out the Dine about town on a saturday nite. So after we waited for 20 minutes to be seated we asked about the dine about town menu and they told us it was only from Sunday thru thursday. If it was not close to 10 pm..we probably would've left but we figured that since this place got good reviews why not?  Well this place apparently should be more known for the Short Ribs instead of the fried chicken. We all got different things so that we could try it out...we got the short ribs, fried chicken, and half stack ribs. Then we also got the spiced up fat fries and the BBQ shrimp with creamy grits. I don't know why they say BBQ shrimp cuz it def was not BBQ at all! man...I must admit that I was a bit disappointed at this place. I mean I am a fried chicken lover so to say that a $23 fried chicken was bland n not good...it really breaks my heart :( I ended up eating half of the short ribs that my cousin ordered. This place is pretty pricey...if it was not for the short ribs..I would've given this place a 2 star. I do however liked the decor and the lounge area. Maybe it was lacking chili sauce...but still I would not be back at this restaurant anytime soon.

wZG2xlICfUkJiY1NdPJH2A.review_text: wow, started with a very warm welcome. We were on the tail end of the night, just wanted to stop by and check out the drinks. The host was super friendly and inviting. We even asked if it was too late, but we were offered seats and a menu. The waitress however was incredible rude. She must have been pissed that we wouldn't be letting her get off her shift early and she made sure we knew it. It colored the entire experience. Had we know that it was going to be like this, we would have skipped this place. The drinks were ok. I'm a little disappointed that "Malibu" is showcased on their list of rums and "lemon drop" is a signature cocktail. It's kind of opposite of the classy image the restaurant seems to project. The hushpuppies were nothing to remark about. The ambiance would have been nice, if we weren't so rushed. We obviously were not the last people in the place- plenty of dinners and bar customers abound, but somehow we felt like we were being rushed out. I might give this place another chance, but from our first experience this was crossed of the list. There's plenty of places to eat on Fillmore. There are also plenty of classy southern cooking restaurants as well. Unfortunately the bathrooms were incredibly messy, but I suppose that's how it gets at the end of the night?

MEIh2UJYxMIZj2mfipdipg.review_text: Recently went to the Sunday brunch.  I had 2 issues with the restaurant.  First, they only take reservations at 11 or 1 and charge a fee for the live music.  Wouldn't that lead you to think that the musicians would actually be ready and playing at 11?  They dicked around and did sound checks for an entire 30 minutes before starting.  Second, they will serve you bottomless pamosas, but not bottomless mimosas - not sure I get that one.  I did really enjoy the atmosphere and the food, but overall, they need to correct these issues.

Qyi0ZXMrgp0C0RThytSHsg.review_text: Absolutely amazing. We went on NYE, listened to good music and the steak was perhaps the best that I have ever had - truly mind blowing. Service was amazing, everyone was very attentive and the atmosphere is fun. I would highly recommend this place.

ybk_vGgqfsSDBRteWVCrfQ.review_text: This is going to be very interesting. A center part museum, part restaraunt and condos in the heart of the Western Additions Jazz district. The world famous Yoshi's will bee opening up in this structure as well. According to the Web site Yoshi's will be opening up in the summer of 2007, which means it could be any month now - how exciting. I for one think this is wonderful and I can't wait to be there for the opening day of this structure.

0Lio5NNlqy7OX6TUWx47Uw.review_text: May not be in the nicest part of town but well worth a trek!  All around great place - service, food, ambiance, and love that there's a lounge area for just drinks and chilln.  The red pepper jelly that comes with the complimentary corn bread is SO good!   The BBQ shrimp & grits appetizer was super tasty.  Both entrees were outstanding - beef short ribs and pan roasted red snapper.  Everyone around us were having the fried chicken so I will definitely be back to try that next!

nHnNraNUct25HJJTRAGYkA.review_text: I had high expectations for the Sunday gospel brunch at 1300. Two seating times at 11am and 1pm, $40 prix fixe menu, live music. Pretty fancy schmancy brunch if you ask me. Unfortunately, they didn't deliver and I'm better off at cheaper, more relaxed places like Foreign Cinema and Citizen Cake.   Service: It's the little things that count and they fell short. They didn't bother to remember who ordered what, so over the loud music, you had to shout out if it looked like your dish. Also, the dishes were not all ready at the same time. One dish came out a good 10 min after everyone else's. Last pet peeve, they asked if I wanted a refill on coffee. At $40 a pop, you don't ask, you just do it.   Food: Overall, above average, 4 stars. Bread basket was so-so. I had the corn bread and it wasn't anything extraordinary. It would have been nice if they refilled it so you could try something else. It sucks when you have to race to grab the best looking thing. For the main course, I had the bbq shrimp and grits. It was quite delicious and highly recommended. They also did a nice job with the desserts. I tried the apple cobbler and peanut butter crunch chocolate mousse. Both were great.   Ambiance: The gospel band was a nice touch but there's a difference in opinion if you like loud live music during a meal. At the one hand, you're entertained. On the other, you are shouting and can't hold a decent conversation during the 30 min setlist. The band was good but I have a feeling they don't vary their set much so this wouldn't be a good place to return to frequently. They played your standard Lean On Me, Oh Happy Day, Amazing Grace, etc.   Conclusion: Glad I went, decent experience, but not outstanding.

To3gZnaYEsbbT-KYjVtEDg.review_text: I have never been to a restaurant where a basket of corn bread and one chive biscuit is considered the first course of a 3 course prix fixe meal.   The chicken in our 'black skillet fried chicken po' boy sandwich' was about the same amount of chicken you get in an order of KFC chicken tenders - and tasted about the same.  The lemon meringue tart for dessert was a little bigger around than a silver dollar and was more tough pastry than lemon or meringue.  So much for our $41 Easter Gospel brunch.  Never again.

skbgDLJSzfr9IudxrjHc6g.review_text: Second time's a charm! We gave 1300 on Fillmore a second chance after a bad first experience, and we were very happy that we did. The service was excellent and friendly, the food was incredible and the overall experience very positive. We had the fried chicken and short ribs and practically scraped the plates clean. There was a very nice atmosphere, and we would return.

WALNtcSZlONK4Yj-o3pzKA.review_text: Sampler app alone made up for being denied both Trickin' Traklava and every Adam Bomb sando in one day. But let's speak on the service: 1) After I ordered, mro (Mexican bro) asked if that would be it #noandthen or if I wanted to open a tab. Most restos are #soquicksofast to take my menu away thinking I don't want more; mro knew better. 2) Server completely filled my table with plates then asked if the food was for one person or two. Ha, cute. (^_^) Sampler $27 (yelp.com/biz_photos/1300…) Dip all the foods in #datbluecheesefonduedoe. (^_^) Matchstick Okra $7.5 (yelp.com/biz_photos/1300…) Not your typ fried okra. (-_-) 6 Oysters On The Half Shell $18 (yelp.com/biz_photos/1300…) #shrugyourshouldersoff Walker Creek. (-_-) Iced Tea $4 (yelp.com/biz_photos/1300…) Did its job. (-_-) Black Skillet Roasted Catfish $27 (yelp.com/biz_photos/1300…) Ok but not mind = blown like the apps. (-_-) Silverware $0 (yelp.com/biz_photos/1300…) Arthur Krupp forks, Oneida knives. Basically, the apps & service carried the meal. I want to return for the Molasses Glazed Peanuts W Bacon wtf.

bzLY-VVHEF_Kcig1TTa5SA.review_text: We came here for Dine About Town tonight, only to find out that the DAT menu is only available Sunday - Thursday. Bummer. It was more of an Open Table issue rather than the restaurant, but we felt a little duped because we specifically booked on a Dine About Town branded Open Table page so felt like this restaurant should be removed on the days they don't offer the menu.   In any case, we stuck around because we had heard good things and the menu looked pretty good. We started with the spiced fat fries and were only mildly amused. The homemade ketchup was pretty tasty, but I felt like the fries could have been crispier and overall kind of underwhelming.   On to the mains. I ordered the blackened catfish and my boyfriend ordered the fried chicken. Having been to a couple other places that offer $25+ chicken, we were pretty anxious to put this chicken to the test and I am sorry to say that it - FAILED.  It wasn't very crispy and the spices verged on funky at times. I still can't put my finger on what it is spice wise that I'm tasting, but it was kind of awkward.     Unfortunately, I had the same reaction to the catfish too. It was just ok and not great.   Finally, we ordered Apple Bread Pudding and again, it was just average as well and came out pretty cold for bread pudding.   Probably won't be back anytime soon. However, on a positive note the decor was fab and the vibe was really nice.  Too bad the food was so blah.

y9dpZbXVXnzmqMl6unR0ag.review_text: Ambiance is beautiful. Classy spot for a date night and perfect for jazz lovers since they have performances on certain nights. Their jalapeño vodka drinks were tasty too. I was a little disappointed that they ran out of oysters when we tried ordering that for an appetizer, considering it was a Saturday night... but none the less, food was good. My husband had the Gumbo and I had the Fish of the Day entree, which was good but wasn't extraordinary. Overall, this place has great atmosphere, great drinks, and good soul food. We'll be back 1300 Fillmore!! We'll be back...

N0mVci8y9eC4PJJmaZ9ymA.review_text: We came here for brunch last weekend, because we were hungry and had other business in the area.  The decor is truly beautiful. Very upscale and pretty. The photos in the lounge are amazing.  We started with the scones, which were very tender and went nicely with the accompanying strawberry and rhubarb jam. I ordered the often-mentioned shrimp and grits, and Carly P ordered a goat cheese and asparagus omelet.   I found the portion of the shrimp & grits to be small (maybe I was just hungry?) and while the dish was good, it wasn't at all what I expected. Instead of a thicker and more smoky barbeque sauce, the sauce on top of it was vinegary, and tasted strongly of worcestershire sauce. The grits, however, were amazing and I would happily order them as a side or a portion of any other meal. They were okay, but next time I would try something else.   Carly's omelet was really, really good though. It was cooked well, cheesy, and yummy. I had more than a few bites. The potatoes that came with it were over-seasoned, though.   Because we were still hungry (the portions were on the small side), and we had time, we ordered dessert. The strawberry shortcake was beautifully presented, and tasted just as good.  I'd like to come back for dinner to give this place another chance. Overall, I thought the food was overpriced for what you got. Yes, the omelet was good, but I could make that at home pretty easily.

s7w-Xu3A75lgwtcEaWn98A.review_text: Other reviewers complained about their servers... Our server was the best part of the meal! He was attentive, brought us tons of cornbread, and was on top of everything.   The food was tasty, super rich. We had the full rack of ribs which was good but not the most flavorful if you didn't use the sauce liberally. The risotto with shrimp was awesome, the shrimp was super fresh and it was perfectly seasoned. Pork belly appetizer was also amazing. I forgot what else we ordered, but it was just okay, and we were stuffed, but finished it off with strawberry rhubarb pie + ice cream, which we did not regret one bit!  Their menu can be pricey, but we used a discount :) Oh, and loved the decor!

IWbdz__L39NNqJbIXhDU8A.review_text: Came here for an anniversary dinner.  I ordered the short ribs; it was just okay.  The hostess was rude.  I don't think I'll be back.

xlJ18qLnXoKHgtXP9P0Z0A.review_text: I was very surprised to see this part of Fillmore so revitalized with this new restaurant and Yoshi's across the street. The space that 1300 Fillmore now occupies is a beautiful grand space. The spacious bar has generous seating and floor to ceiling pictures with the heritage of this culture.   The menu has quite a selection and I love going to places that offer so many options, you can't decide. We definitely had that problem. There was fish, fulton valley fried chicken, short rib, lamb chop - something for everyone! The menu has American bistro items but a certain southern feel is infused in most of the appetizers, entrees, and sides. The lamb chop from Colorado was big, juicy, and tender. Although I didn't try the short rib, I imagine it is one of their specialties and it looked divine! The braised pork belly was absolutely fantastic and the best I've had in SF.   Definitely would go back for another visit to have the pork belly and also try the mac n cheese!

sOKGlPSdwcYHL_mpJJxN0A.review_text: This place is very nice. The ambiance is amazing...  They have some AMAZING DRINKS and FOOD....
